text: Came this past week on a weekday night at around 8pmish - and was surprised there were actually spots to sit!  After getting slightly bedazzled by their simple yet overwhelming menu, I set on getting the whole chicken (half seoul sassy sauce and half the crisp super spicy sauce) with a side of fries. Totalled to around $21 without tax, and I was sharing this with another person, so ended up being quite the deal! So much food...I was surprised how much they battered and fried each piece of chicken, I guess this is what they call Korean Fried Chicken, so different from the saucy wings I'd eaten before!  Seoul sassy sauce was a little too sweet in my opinion, and the fried outer coating was a little too crunchy for me (and much too oily), but hey this was my first time trying KFC so maybe thats just the way it is. The spicy sauce btw is no joke...I could barely swallow my second bite of the angry red battered wings, so definitely be prepared for the heat! Fries were on point.  Remember if you get the whole chicken, you are getting a whole chicken - so that includes the drier white meat portions too!

Easily the best wings we have ever had! The Korean BBQ sauce is a little sweet and a little spicy! Prices are great and the atmosphere is calm and clean! If you love wings don't miss this stop while in Chicago!

Mmmmmmmm, I love this place! One of the best places for wings! It's a small, casual spot in a Lakeview, sometimes it's hard to find a spot if you want to dine in, depending on the time and day you go. I typically get it to go, doesn't really alter the taste at all-still very crunchy and not soggy. I always get the Seoul Sassy and regular, highly highly recommend!! The wings are pretty big, def good portions, and they've been consistent here, never have one complaint. Buttt, in terms of parking, it's kinda in a congested area, if you could walk or take public transportation, that would prob be best. This place is a must!

NOOOOOOOOOOMS. This place knows how to serve fried chicken! I have always been a fan of korean fried chicken so coming to this place was a must. The Seoul Sassy Sauce- to die for. And it's not just the flats that they serve you, its the entire wing! Perfectly fried in its own skin - no dough added and drizzled with their delicious soy flavored sauce! I can't even count how many I had but I wish I had taken some to go! My friends enjoyed the sassy sauce very much but they were expecting the spicy wings to be much spicier- I didn't have any of the spicy ones. I stayed with what worked! Overall, will be on my list to recommend to friends and will definitely make the trip there if i ever go back!

Oaky so the fact that I'm Korean I had my skepticism about this place but I have to say it was good. I wasn't blown away by the menu but it was a decent representation of a traditional Korean street/fast food type of a restaurant. They're know for their wings so I ordered the Korean bbq with the buddha bowl. All in all decent food but nothing amazing personally I thought the wings were just drowning in too much sauce. Buddha bowl was good but I felt like I was missing something...... oh yeah that's right kimchi. You can't open a Korean restaurant and not serve kimchi . But too be fair this would be a good place to start for someone that's never had Korean food before and want to give it a try. One thing to note this place has bench style seating so if your not comfortable sitting next to a perfect stranger while getting sauce all over your face then you might want to go elsewhere.

I have ordered from Crisp a bunch of times and ate in once or twice. The wings are good and the buddha bowls are really tasty. When i ate there i found it kinda loud and chaotic but thats part of the charm. Its usually pretty busy so be prepared to wait if you go at a busy time. I don't really have a standard order as i try something new every time - and its good everytime!

I'm about to blow people's mind...so keep reading.  My name is Julie...and I don't like chicken wings.  Say what?!?!  Came here with a group because they wanted to try it and I tagged as I've been here before and knew they had other things on the menu.  I got a buddha bowl which basically is bibimbop in other Korean establishments, which essentially is the same thing just named differently at Crisp.  My dish was fine and hard to mess up white rice and veggies.  I had a small bite of someones wings and to my surprise it was pretty good, but I don't do dark meat, chicken on the bone nor skin so couldn't bare to take more than a bite to just try it at least. They all said the wings were pretty good so I'll give that a thumbs up even with my limited taste of the wings here.   Place can get packed, so if you're with a group, have someone maybe grab spots in the communal bench seatings they offer because it does get pretty busy and seating is limited.

I ordered the plain Jane expecting something more but it was literally plain fried chicken wings with no real taste. I was highly disappointed. I then ordered the Seoul sassy and that was much better. Meat is tender and the sauce was delicious. Can't say I would go out of my way for this chicken unfortunately.

Crisp has the best wings in Chicago right now (in our humble opinion.) They also serve bibimbap & some crazy awesome burritos.  10 wings (they are seriously MASSIVE) will run you about around $16. Perfect for splitting.  *Pro Tip: Get the Seoul sassy sauce - it will not disappoint.  Get ready to wait for a table if you want to sit inside after 5 pm, or really anytime on the weekends.  This place is always packed!  Also love the baby Buddha bowls.  Would pass on the fries, personally (but I'm picky about those).  Heard great things about the burritos, haven't tried yet!

So the first time I had the wings was at a picnic. They were good, but they didn't really "wow" me. I gave them a second chance today and ate with my mom in the restaurant . Wow! What a difference! The chicken was crispy (aka Crisp!) and the sauces were really tasty. I got the suicide sauce and the BBQ. My mom got the Seoul Sassy. While the suicide was good, it wasn't as mouth burning as I expected. It wasn't bad, but I wanted more hot! The BBQ was my favorite and the Seoul Sassy was my second favorite. If you get anything out of my review, go with Seoul Sassy and BBQ. Get the BBQ hot if you want a bit of a heat challenge. They let you pick up to two sauces which is key.  The only downside is that the restaurant is really small and gets a little dirty quickly. It wasn't a deal-breaker for me, but something that was a little off. I will be back for some more yummy wings!

This is foodie heaven. If fried chicken is your personal weakness (*raises hand), then this should be at your top of the list of places to frequent in Chicago. I opted for the 6-piece boneless chicken strips, which honestly came out to be around 10 pieces (!!!). For about $11, this was a steal considering the portion size. I chose the Seoul Sassy sauce, which is a soy sauce, ginger, and garlic sauce. The crispy breading envelopes the chicken so that it all comes together in a green onion and pepper topped masterpiece. The more you eat these, the more the heat will come through and the salt, so have your water prepared. I appreciate how they provide sturdy plastic cups and a water dispenser for customers at the register.  My brother got the buffalo sauce wings, and when they forgot his order, gave him double his portion. Can't complain about that. These were tangy, dizziness-inducing, spicy wings. He really enjoyed them, and their fries are super thin, crispy, and delicious as well.  Free parallel parking on the street if you're lucky, but completely worth it. Place was packed on a Saturday afternoon, and I can see why.

Yep. That good. Really enjoyed the signature wings with Seoul Sassy sauce, and mushrooms. Busy, friendly service. Adequate seating for quick eats. Not a lounge around and drink kind of spot. Bring some wipes or something...it's a mess, but well worth the effort. Will be back regularly!

I'm a big fan of the Seoul Steak Bowl. It's bare bones meat and rice but when you throw in their hot sauce they have on the table.  perfection. Four stars because it's usually very crowded, loud, and nobody seems to pay any attention to anyone but themselves in here. The food is delicious though. Seoul Sassy all the way.

The wings aren't traditional wings (maybe everyone knows that going into the restaurant and I just was ignorant to it). So as long as you're aware that the wing is a different shape and texture than like, BWW, you probably will enjoy. I also felt the wings were not really worth the hype, especially for how crowded the place was.

What can I say about Crisp that hasn't already been said?  This is a consistently good food choice that is packed full of people for good reason!  My fave is the aptly named Foodie's Choice Crisp sandwich, make that a double please. It's two generous breasts (chicken...get your mind out of the gutter), battered and fried and slathered in your choice of sauce.  I like the Seoul Sassy.  Next is baby spinach, blue cheese crumbles, tomato, mayo, and the most excellent Atomic Sauce.  Marty's Magic Mushrooms, also with the Atomic Sauce, are an excellent starter. Seoul Steak Bowl is a great non-chicken  and is a strong competitor for BopnGrill on Belmont for the bulgogi and rice championship.  Adding the Atomic Sauce kicks it over the top! Call ahead and place your order to avoid the massive lines and don't get frustrated if you're on hold for a bit...it's THAT popular.  Staff is cool and helpful so hang in there and you'll enjoy the Crisp magic soon!

Probably my favorite restaurant in the neighborhood. Korean style fried chicken with a soul food twist. Genius. Oh and these are some big ass wings. Worth the money. My first visit I came mid day when it was empty and chatted up with the staff about what the best dishes are. The homey hooked me up with an extra wing, mad respect!  Their bowls are great too if you want something lighter. Big bowls and fresh crunchy veggies. I can't recommend the sassy sauce enough and you can increase the heat to your liking. The spiciest version has a great kick to it that builds up late. I feel like they could probably expand their menu with the concept even more. Korean pancake with a sassy sauce variant??? Please steal that idea. The only knock I could find was that the steak bowl was a tad bit too oily, I feel like it's missing something.  But that's not enough to knock a star because everything else is so good. (yelp still doesn't have half stars). Pro tip, if you're ordering take out just order from their website and pick it up. It gets very crowded in prime hours (add maybe 5-10 minutes on top of the estimate during peak hours). Save yourself the hassle and walk past the crowd like a boss.

Since being introduced to Korean wings about 5 years ago, I have been addicted. I have heard of crisp for a while now and I finally got to try them recently. The place isn't big and the tables are benches and community seating (which i wasn't a fan of at all, but I was at a table with some real rude and disrespectful people but hey). I had wings of course and I went with the Seoul sassy and BBQ. They were really good, both flavors (although Seoul sassy was a little better to me). I also had some of the Seoul steak bowl, it was good but could of been better (bulgogi wasn't the best to me)and they do offer like 5 different bowls and they all look good. Overall a really good place for wings in the city of Chicago (probably the best in the city actually), however they are nowhere near the best Korean wings I have ever had and being that I went to both Milwaukee and Chicago for this trip, they were last place out of three places I had for wings. However please come give them a try if you haven't, it will be packed but the food comes out pretty quick.

4/5 solid!! Writing this mostly for myself, but you're welcome to read. This was tasty and worth tucking into the window seat for. Ain't no shame ordering both the rice bowl and the wings, because you will eat it all. And people are staring bc jealousy. #iamwinning I can't imagine this place during weekend/dinner rush hour, but i went at a random time so I ordered, found a seat, and was eating shortly after. And man, when you are set you kinda just keep going. I can't do heat and admittedly got the #meatsweats early on. But i was determined to just eat all of it, even if i was going to the beach because the beach will take whatever beach body i give it, even if they can make out chicken wing indentations in my belly. I digress. This was super yummy, and I'd come back.

I'm not sure how I've never reviewed Crisp before. They have some of THE best wings I've had. Their whole chicken is great too. The wings though....I get 10 half Seoul Sassy and the other half BBQ which is their own special blend. You no doubt have heard of this place and are check reviews to see if it's REALLY THAT GOOD. It is, I promise. Get wings and a side or two to split with frenz. You won't regret it.

Out of all of the restaurants I have tried in Chicago, this one takes the cake & will be my #1 recommendation for anyone who asks me what my favorite restaurant was! Casual restaurant.  Friendly service.  Even better food.  Good vibes all around. Seoul Sassy Chicken Wings:  Omg, this sauce is to die for.  It is sweet with a little kick.  The wings are meaty & juicy.  Lightly breaded & extra crispy outside.  I pray that they will open a restaurant in San Diego just because of their sauce! Baby Buddha:  Rice bowl with vegetables & eggs.  Good!
Always amazing... you can never go wrong eating here. The food is fresh fast and tastes great. If your vegetarian there Korean bowls are amazing. If you eat meat the chicken wings are to die for!!!!!

Simply perfect!! My mom is a chef and she ordered another portion of the BBQ and Sassy Seoul wings for a midnight snack haha Park in the Commonwealth Plaza garage, which costs only $10 for valet parking for 2 hours and is only a 10-minute walk away.

This place is awesome. It's usually busy when I go in but by the time my food is ready we have always found a place to sit.  The food: OH. My. God. Their chicken sandwich here- the not so common- order. Is to die for. One of my favorite chicken sandwiches. Their wings are also great. I love the classic crisp sauce but have tried all of them and perfectly cover everything you would expect from wings plus they're huge!! I've also had their bowls- they are delicious but somehow never as good as they look to me..(anywhere). If you've never been do yourself a favor and go. Right. Now. You won't be disappointed.
Such an amazing local lakeview spot! The Seoul sassy sauce is incredible...would buy it by the jar! They always give extra chicken tenders with your order also which is always a great surprise!

Must I say any more about this place, it is the best fried chicken place I have ever eaten. I normally take out than dine in mainly the restaurant is small and always crowded, with a little one is not an ideal place to dine in. But it's a must try to take out at least once in your life time of you have a chance. Every visitors came and visit me in Chicago, I always introduce them to here for their first time and they can't stop wanting for more. It's a must try.

We ordered chicken strips, chicken wings, and a chicken sandwich (all to go.). First, you shouldn't take out from this restaurant because, well, everything WON'T be crisp by time you get home. Second, the chicken in the chicken sandwich was overcooked, but it was still a pretty good sandwich.  Third, what I think is a total deal-breaker for any restaurant; they served chicken wings with pin feathers all over them.  Popeye's, KFC, and even the lousy stand-alone fried chicken shacks  DO NOT serve chicken with feathers.  Disgusting!  It's unfortunate because the boneless chicken was quite good, I just question how clean it is.

I liked this place it was tight on a Friday afternoon but the squeezing in to eat was worth it. Lots of people get takeout here. The Wings are delicious and service is fairly fast for how busy they got. I wish I had ghotten the spicy Wings because the sweet bbq (don't recall the exact flavor name) was a little too sweet for me. Think a little like sweet chilli. Overall a great place. Will come back soon.

I have to say, I was very skeptical about this place for a very long time and I was very surprised how very good it tasted. I'm trying very hard to use a lot of "very" to not vary my words too much lol oh puns, gotta lov'em  Anyway, I tried 2 different kind of chicken wings, forgot which but liked both.

Got the whole chicken with the classic BBQ sauce last week. It was only a 15 minute wait, and we took it home for dinner. I can't get over how good it was. The flavor was amazing. The texture of the skin was fantastic. The chicken wasn't dry at all. The sauce was so good, I want to put it on all the chicken I eat.  The price was also amazing for how much food you good. The whole chicken could easily feed three decent sized humans.  Definitely come here. The flavor and value can't be beat.
I'm from California and I never leave Chicago without going. NEVER! I always tell my friends, imagine if Colonel Sanders married a Korean lady. Picture that for a second, Yes! That good!

I heard so many great things about this place and one day, I had a strong craving for something fried. I told my boyfriend, "Let's go to Crisp." We get there and the place was full and you could see people deliciously picking up their meal. We order a 10 piece, half Crisp sauce and half spicy BBQ sauce. It was pretty expensive. It cost us about $20 for 10 wings. When we came home, we pulled them out and they were pretty big wings. My favorite one was the crisp special sauce and my boyfriend loved the spicy one. I would come back here to treat myself.

I can't rave enough about this place! I've pretty much tried everything on the menu at this point and everything is so good. Probably my favorite kimchi around here. Short wait times are a huge plus too.

Totally overrated. Not sure why it's rated so high. The chicken in the chicken sandwich was extremely dry and tough to chew. The Baby Buddha was soggy and inedible. What a waste. Very disappointed with my order.

Absolutely lush chicken wings, with proper crispy skin and great flavour.  They are what chicken wings should be!  I liked the sweetness of the Seoul Sassy, and my husband loved the really spicy ones (can't remember what they're called) and they were indeed hot as advertised.  This place was packed as soon as they opened on a Sunday lunch time, so be prepared to wait, but it's definitely worth it.  Down with soggy, same-y chicken wings - these are something truly different and delicious.

Crisp just put me off Chicken for at least a week, maybe more. Went there w my Son and friend who claimed it to be "best chicken in Chicago", let's check it out.   She ordered the Seoul Sassy Wings and the boy opted for traditional, Buffalo Boneless.  I was feeling a bowl was in order so chose the baby bowl which is essentially Bi Bim Bap w chicken. At first, all was well and had a sampling of everything with excellent, punch-you-in-the-face flavors!  So far so good, the "3 pieces" are waaaaay more than three. Good sized portions and a great value for what you get.  About half way through here's where things went off the rails.....errrr off the bone.doh  I take a bite of my Son's chicken and look at what appears to be completely undercooked, translucent chicken. Upon closer inspection, it didn't really look to be undercooked in firmness but the color and the texture was totally off putting, I put it down and couldn't eat another bite of anything.  Really unfortunate. A final side note, while the Bowl was pretty good in flavor it was room temp at best and it had a lot of sauce just sitting at the bottom of the bowl. Not so great either. [X] A Miss for Me :/

Wandered into Crisp because my friend and I just so happened to be in the neighborhood and it had been recommended once to us before.  And let me tell you, 100% worth, 100% would go again, 100% recommend.  The area itself is rather small and all seating is communal.  We came on a Tuesday night and yet it was still packed and hard to find seating even for just two people.   We ordered the 8 drumsticks and the Seoul Sassy Sauce and 10/10 would order again.  Firstly, I thought the drumsticks would be tiny (think KFC) but no, they're HUGE.  4 of them EASILY overfilled me, and my friend and I easily split the meal between the two of us.  The sauce is amazing and the crispiness of the chicken is perfect.  Hands down one of the best fried chicken I've had ever.  Definitely worthwhile to check out.  I would definitely come back again.  And I see a lot of people getting take out too so that's a very viable option in the case that you can't find seating which is very plausible.

This place is definitely small, you may have to wait to get a seat... The Seoul Sassy wings are top-notch. I would say Crisp is the second best Wing Spot in the city, but some would say it's the best.  The best thing about this place is they serve whole wings, with a variety of flavors.  I only had one bad experience at this establishment, but overall this place is dope.

Yes, the extra spicy BBQ and Seoul sassy wings were delicious. Yes, the staff was very friendly and helpful in recommendations. Yes, THE SEATING AREA IS UNMANNED AND SMALL WHICH SUCKS IN A REALLY BIG WAY. As long as this place has been opened, as many positive reviews it has accumulated, as HIGH DEMAND and as many complaints about seating that this place has received... you would think the management would maybe consider that there needs to be more available seating or at least a logical way of getting people seated and cleared away in a timely manner. No such thing. Not only was the restaurant very loud and chaotic, people awkwardly stand around with their food in their hands because they have nowhere to sit and eat. If I actually lived in Chicago and I were reaaaally craving these wings, I'd suck it up and order some to go. I feel miserable just imagining sitting in there again. The food was 5 stars, the poor setup compels me to drop a star.
Favorite post work out meal!  Chi-town Chicken Bowl is always great!  I don't know if it's a good or bad thing that the staff knows my order and put it in as I'm walking up haha.

My girlfriend and I stayed in Chicago for spring break and had to check this place out due to the great Yelp reviews. Crisp is a nice, simple restaurant and there is plenty of seating inside. They have a few long picnic style tables and seats by the window. The staff is extremely friendly and gives great suggestions on what to order. We ordered a 10 wings basket and had half of the wings with Seoul Sassy sauce and the other half with Crisp BBQ sauce. My only complaint is that Crisp does not provide any sides with their baskets. However, $17 is a great deal for 10 chicken wings. We both thought the best sauce was the Seoul Sassy because it is a light and sweet sauce. There is a good amount of soy flavoring and it tastes very refreshing. The Crisp BBQ was also a good runner up because it had a good amount of spice and smoky flavor. Lastly, the chicken wings are huge and fried to perfection, the inside is tender and juicy, while the outside skin has a nice crisp. If you're in Chicago, you have to come here, but be prepared to wait a little on busy nights!

Amazing Korean fried chicken. The wings are absolutely huge and the plates are great for sharing. Mix and match the flavors to get a variety. Seul Sassy is my personal favorite, which is tangy and flavorful. The crisp BBQ is also excellent. I'm not a huge fan of the Buddha bowels here which I felt was mostly just rice. So I usually stick with the wings. The seating is communal and first come first serve which can be a pain on busy nights. But it is also BYOB and there is a liquor store down the street which is clutch. They will give you glasses and a wine/bottle opener so no need to bring.

For the longest time I thought the best chicken wings I've ever had was in Korea Town in LA. Hands down Crisp's chicken is a solid 5. I personally enjoyed the drumstix, but the wings were just as good. I don't like to work for my food (but will drive, lol). There isn't that much seating so don't be surprised if you're sharing the table with some other chicken wing enthusiasts. Lots of sauces available, but I don't think they are necessary.

You've gotta check this place out!!! Amazing chicken wings! This is my first experience with Korean chicken wings but these made my top five all-time chicken wings! Absolutely delicious. The house sauce is incredible, be careful it's extremely messy but so worth it! I was grateful that I took them to go so I could eat them in my room, I destroy the hand towel because of how messy they were but unbelievably delicious. The duck fat fries were nothing special but delicious as well. I wish I lived in Chicago so I could eat this more often.

Great Korean fried chicken! About ten minutes off the Belmont stop, this place is a must go for those who love Asian fusion. They're most famous for their fried chicken wings, but they also have bowls, burritos, sandwiches, etc. This place is really popular and can get really crowded. Seats are limited.  I've been here twice. The first time I got three chicken tenders (5.95) with the Crisp BBQ sauce. While a little pricey, the tenders were big and filling. They were fried to perfection with a Korean fusion BBQ sauce that is perfectly sweet/spicy. The second time I came to dine in. I ordered the five wings (8.95) with half Crisp BBQ and half Seoul Sassy, their two most popular sauces. The wings were so delicious and crispy. The Seoul Sassy comes with ginger, soy, and garlic and is subtly sweet while Crisp BBQ is a tangy sweet. They generously coat their chicken in the finger-lickin'-good sauce.  It was hard to find a table to sit at so we sat at the benches on the side. If you're visiting in peak hours I would recommend getting take out instead! The chicken doesn't become soggy.
Used to live around the corner and got it all the time. Its the one place I have to stop when I am back in town.

Biked 40mins to try it. Couldn't sit and eat because it was too crowded so we ordered takeout and biked all the way home. Ordered the whole fried chicken, half seoul sassy sauce and the other BBQ ($18 -12 pieces). I thankfully got to eat a BBQ drumstick before biking back. The meat was juicy and the skin around the ends were very crispy and flavorful. After getting home, I tried the Seoul sassy - definitely prefer this sauce. The wings were a good combo of crispy, saucy outside and juice meat inside. However, the white meat pieces (the majority of the pieces) were very dry and the pieces had more meat so the sauce was not sufficient. Also we ordered a whole chicken but each sauce flavor had 2 wings? Not complaining just confused what kind of chicken this is with four wings. What is special about their fried chicken is the sauce flavor and the thin, crispy outside. Of course making the idea meat either the wings or drumstick, but not the white meat as there isn't much skin or moisture. The white meat chunks could definitely be improved by being cut smaller so more area can be covered in sauce. Overall, this was pretty pricey for the quality. Didn't quite meet up to my expectations.

My favorite spot in Lakeview. Absolutely everything is delicious, generous portions:. I've ordered from here atleast 2dozen times, order is always correct and staff is super friendly. Kimchi is amazing. Seoul steak bowl is to die for. Highly recommend.
Solid 4. The wings are huge portions and the rice bowls are pure comfort food. It's fast casual and a good base to start the night. It definitely is messy food but totally worth it.

My favorite Korean wings are found here. The service is great and the people are nice. The only problems I have are parking and that the tables are awkwardly long for a group of 4. Other than that the flavoring on the wings are awesome

Being born and raised in the south I consider myself very well versed in the world of chicken wings. I was so excited to try this place after hearing all the hype and every time I passed the place it was packed! I couldn't wait to get my hands on some good wings up here. I placed my order online and it was ready when I arrived- good thing I got it to go because seating in this place is extremely limited!  They were hot still by the time I got home, which is good. I got 2 sauces, the Seoul Sassy and something else BBQ- the chicken was immediately kind of dry and I thought they messed my order up because the "sauces" were more like a dry rub. The flavor was lackluster and underwhelming.  The size of the wing was great, which for $2 a wing, essentially, they should be this big! But the overall wing was just okay, that's why I'm giving 3/5.  The kimchi was excellent, spicy, and abundant! I really enjoyed it. But the wings, which is what the place is known for, were really just okay. Maybe their other dishes are better, or maybe I'm just used to more vibrant wings in southern Tennessee/Mississippi area! Was it good? Yeah, would I get wings here again, no.

When I want fried chicken wings, Crisp is always in the discussion. Always. But what puts it at the top for me is their Buddha Bowls. Don't overlook them! My fattiness always goes wings + bowl. Absolutely delicious. It does get busy and packed inside. So plan your feast accordingly.
In my opinion, the wings aren't really crispy, but they're definitely delicious. Be careful to not order a lot, the wings are full size. Can't wait to go back and try their other dishes.

You heard it here first: KFC (Korean Fried Chicken) is the best kind of fried chicken out there. Or maybe you've already heard somewhere else because you're checking out this place. Unfortunately, I don't think this place delivers the high standard I expect from KFC. I got the Seoul Sassy sauce, expecting perhaps more traditional sweet and spicy sauce you get in Korea. However, it was soy-based. Don't get me wrong. I love garlic soy sauce just as much, but this one was really really salty. I couldn't taste the chicken at all but only the sauce--too overpowering. The frying was also not well done. There was not much meat on the bones, and it was really dry. They were also far from crispy.  Maybe they were originally, but they were drenched in the salty soy sauce, so they were quite soggy by the time I got to them.

Nothing makes my mouth water quicker than hearing the words "Korean fried chicken," well maybe except "12 pieces of Korean fried chicken with fries and kimchi." That's the half-meal we ordered, which could easily serve 2-3 people. Loved the Seoul Sassy sauce - it's a unique soy flavor that is delish and pairs perfectly with the green onion that's sprinkled on top. The wings are also HUGE. One wing is almost twice the size of the average skimpy HH wing at a bar. Heads up, the place gets crowded (for all the right reasons), so definitely expect to share a bench or side table with another group (it's free for all seating).

Truly amazing! love the casual interior and oh my their chicken is so delicious I still think about it.. Please do expand and please come to Austin, Texas! I will be your most loyalest customer I promise lol.. This place serves you huge portion and everything is really well priced!

I have only had Crisp Take out and it never disappoints. It is crispy, moist, and flavorful every time. The wings are huge! We get the Plain Jane for my toddler and the Seoul Sassy. Both are delicious and keep us coming back despite how far it is from us on the southside.

Korean burritos will make you die of happiness. Had both the chicken and beef versions and was incredibly satisfied. They manage to do a tremendous job of combining traditional burrito flavors with Korean cuisine. Everything is also made rather wholesomely, so you don't have to feel any regret after enjoying a delicious meal. Crisp is a great addition to the good Korea's American cuisine repertoire. Highly recommended
Yes it's as good as the hype.  Best Korean friend chicken in Chicago. Carry out doesn't hold up as good as fresh in the store.

Love love love the super flavorful juicy chicken and their huge portions of bulgogi and bibimbap! Why 4 starts? Considering this place is a tad bit overpriced, and sometimes you would find feather on their wings....it is still worth ever penny when you want to get your Korean fried chicken cravings fixed!  The guys are super chill and I would definitely understand why this place is super busy most of the time. If you are looking for an Asian, Asian fusion place, and you like juicy, moist tender chicken, I would definitely recommend checking this place out, I don't live in Lakeview anymore but every time i pass by I still reminisce about the good experience I've had at this place!

Crispy, Moist, Tender, and Juicy. All these words describe the wings served at Crisp. Don't let the small interior deter you from the deliciousness! Some may say to get the buddha bowl or the kimchi, I say skip everything else an  ave more room in your stomach for these ginormous wings! With three flavors to choose from: Seoul Sassy, Crispy BBQ, and Buffalo alongside the Plain Jane, these wings couldn't get any better! Oh wait, they can because although I have read from some reviews that the flavors were not spicy enough, they now offer the extra spicy for Crispy BBQ and Suicide for Buffalo.  I have had the Seoul Sassy in the past and they were sweet and savory, but I wanted to try something new. I noticed the Extra Spicy option for the Crispy BBQ, so I just had to try it. My friends had the Seoul Sassy and the Suicide option for Buffalo. The Extra Spicy for the Crispy BBQ was very flavorful and were actually pretty mild even for my friend that can not handle spicy. However, the Suicide was a different story. If you have had the Scorpion Rum from Bdubs, this spiciness was just a tad under that. Try it yourself! Overall, the wings were enormous, but doesn't sacrificed quantity for quality. The flavors were amazing and the service was fast. After ordering you would take a seat if you were dining in and they would call your name and hand you your order. As others have mentioned, their washrooms are very clean and necessary to wash your hands afterwards from all the deliciousness!

maybe it was because we got takeout or something, but i'm really not too sure what the hype is about. maybe i've been spoiled with the korean fried chicken scene in dallas and houston. the fries were a solid 2/5 and the fried mushrooms were definitely pre-frozen from one of those packages.  i did like the sassy seoul sauce alot, very similar to soy garlic at other places. the bbq is just a gochujang mix. definitely get the whole chicken combo; thats a good deal and you get two sides and two canned sodas. my vegetarian friend super enjoyed her buddha bowl; "vegetarians go nuts for this spot" haha.  Service was kind and answered all my questions. i guess the chicken was just hyped for me and it didn't live up to my expectations. still a very good place to eat if you've never had korean fried chicken.

Don't get the half chicken!!! It's microscopic. It's more like the size of a pigeon than a chicken but dry and with no visible meat. However if you order the wings you may like them. Service is friendly I think the employees save the restaurant. Kelvin especially is a great manager!!! The owner is luck to have him!!!!
Korean inspired fried chicken - this place is dope. Love the music, the food, and the staff were awesome as well.

Great place, friendly staff! The place is a hole in the wall, but as most hole in the walls go, it's got amazing food! It seems to be mostly carryout, but there's a few tables where you can sit if you want to eat in, plus a little window area. It gets cramped because this place is so awesome. This time, I got the bibimbap bowl - baby buddha - and it came with several fresh veggies and was pretty tasty. The tables have multiple sauces for you to try on your food and all were good. You really cannot go wrong here! Definitely recommend.

Lot of food for price which is good. So sharing is possible. Environment is good.  Food is good. Hmm 4.5 i would rate .5 minus for parking But bathrooms are clean. The people around bumps the rating up so service is good also. The wings are unique. Buritos are ok. So go for wings!!! Parking by the walgreens is usually open 50% of time hit or miss then .3 walk away woth out having to pay. I reccomend this place good price, and get to see chi town flavor in the area.

This place definitely changed my opinion of Chicken Wings.  The Seoul Sassy BBQ sauce is my favorite by far.  Also have amazing boneless chicken tenders as well if you want to avoid the mess of the wings.  We generally don't eat at the restaurant because its always packed and the parking in the area stinks.  They deliver in a pretty wide radius and it is the perfect meal for a night in.
Best wings I have ever had. Hands down. The crisp BBQ is just the right amount of sweet and spicy. The Korean bbq bowls and all the sauces are very good as well.

The fact that Crisp has over 2000 reviews and a 4.5 rating should speak for itself-- this place is amazing! I went on a weekday around 3 pm or so with a couple of my friends and we were able to get our own table. We had 10 wings between the three of us; five of the spicy BBQ and five of the Seoul Sassy. We liked both but the Seoul Sassy is by far the best wings I've ever had. This will spoil all other 'Asian inspired' wings for you, at least for a while.  I can't wait to go back. Highly recommended if you are a fan of wings!

This little spot is awesome. Everything is hot and fresh, and all the fried items are so crunchy and... crisp.  Even the rice that comes with the bowls is delicious.  Luckily I have to walk about a mile to come here.  Otherwise, I would be here five times a week, especially for the sauces.  But, the standout is the Atomic sauce.  If the only item they sold was the Atomic sauce, I would order a bowl of it.

Crisp has an "out of this world" AMAZING STAFF!!! Kalvin, Josh and the rest of the staff at Crisp is KIND, GENUINE and an absolute pleasure to work with!!  OUTSTANDING STAFF+CUSTOMER SERVICE makes the food that much better!!!   I recommend this place to everyone! You won't be disappointed greeted by their smiles and fun demeanor!  CAN'T THANK YOU ENOUGH KALVIN, JOSH and staff for going above and beyond!!!

I really don't understand the hype. This review is for the sassy and the plain chicken wings. This order must have been an anomaly. 2000+ 5 star reviews have to be correct, right? So I was expecting a lot. But the wings were dry. Not as large as others have claimed. Extremely mediocre. Not very "Korean". Definitely not to real "chimaek" Korean quality. And very subpar for traditional American wings too.

This place is great!  It was a whole in the wall but definitely the food is excellent!  We had a whole chicken with BBQ and sassy flavor with a side of rice. The chicken was very crispy and tasty.  We would highly recommend this!
Food was amazing, met one of the owners and he was super nice. Its a busy place and finding parking near there is obviously a mission, but for crisp I'll tough it out.

Highly recommended. Spicy BBQ wings were easily top 3 I've ever had. Huge portions so 10 wings was more than enough and I'm usually a big eater. Also note that Crisp is BYOB even though it's not clearly labeled on the menu or door signs anywhere.

We came here last Saturday at about 12:30pm for lunch and it was a bit crowded but service was very fast and efficient. Note that the seating is communal style so you'll just have to grab a bench alongside others. If you don't like that (since it CAN feel a bit cramped), I'd recommend you call ahead and just do take-out. In fact we saw a ton of people do that and if we lived close enough where the wings wouldn't get soggy in the process, we probably would have done the same. As for the food, the wings were AMAZING. True to it's name, they were very crispy and we tried the buffalo, crisp BBQ and seoul sassy. It seems seoul sassy is the most popular flavor but I actually liked crisp BBQ the best because I like my KFC to have a bit of spice to the sweetness. In fact I'm not even that good with spicy food and I thought the crisp BBQ could have done well with more spice (especially since seoul sassy is already the sweet option). Meanwhile my fiancé loved the buffalo and that was too spicy for me.  Other than the wings, we also got a Bad Boy Buddha w/ Beef and it was very very average. I probably wouldn't order the rice bowls again but the wings will certainly keep me coming back again and again! I can definitely see why Crisp is rated the best KFC in Chicago.

Came a long way to check this place out, but I'm so glad I did! I LOVED the wings here. They're massive, cooked perfectly, and the sauces are delicious! Ordered the Seoul Sassy sauce, a slightly sweet and tangy sauce, and a Buddha Bowl, which is essentially just a less traditional version of bibimbap. The buddha bowl was okay. Nothing really special about it. I would rather just get real bibimbap from a more traditional Korean restaurant. This place is definitely a modernized and casual spot for fusion Korean food. Don't come here looking for traditional Korean style food because they just take certain flavors of Korean food and apply it to the menu. Note that this place gets PACKED and seating is so hard to find. I recommend having a friend hold a seat somewhere while you order or something.

It's good but it didn't blow me away. If you can't live without fried chicken, you'd really enjoy this place. Korean fried chicken is known to have a crispier skin than lets say Popeyes. We got two whole chickens with multiple sauces. I wish we would have invested in just the wings because the white meat (breasts) pieces were really dry and not fun to eat. But everything else is ok. I wasn't reaching for the sauces on the table because the sweet BBQ sauce is good enough. The place is a little small but really good for a fast bite to eat. Would come here unless I was in the area because it's hard to find parking.

My favorite place to eat in Chicago. The chicken is out of this world good, the sauces are fantastic, excellent onion rings, great music selection, and it's BYOB. I can't say enough good things about this place, and the staff that works here is really cool too.

Let's start with what's good about this place: The wings are fricking HUGE. 5 of these will be enough for most people. I can eat a lot and ordered 10 of them which was too much even for me. However, the seasoning/rub on these wings were not very good. I tried both the Crisp BBQ and Seoul Sassy, and neither were spicy enough and way too sweet. If's fine if that's what you like but it doesn't do it for me. Maybe that's my fault for coming here without doing more research, but I was in the area and hungry.
Absolutely Unreal Chicken wings. BYOB! You can't go wrong with anything they serve.

Legit, one of my favorite fried chicken placed in Chicago. The tenders are so good! All of the sauces are delish too! They are a little expensive, but you do get a lot of food and it is so worth it!!!!

I didn't love it. I think part of that was bad ordering on my part, so I'd try it again if someone asked me to go there.  I got the half chicken, sassy.  First, in what I believe is an effort to create uniform size pieces for even cooking their half chicken is more than 4 pieces. So that comes down to creative butchering (and unidentifiable pieces if you're sharing) and bones in bites you can't anticipate. It does create more surface area for the sauce though, and that's the upside. The bifurcated breast was realllly dry. I didn't finish those.  I read the wings were "huge". Well the half chicken is normal sized. Like a roasting chicken. So half is about 1.25# The chicken isn't breaded- not a problem for me but good to know going in. It's also a factor in why I could eat most of my 1.25# in a basket. (I got no sides. This was a taste test of chicken as I am on the hunt for the best fried chicken in Chicago. Sorry, Eater, Yelp etc, but I don't see how Crisp ranks so high) The Seoul Sassy sauce is tasty. It's a sweet sauce. If you don't like soy-based sweet sauces, you will be disappointed. But there are others to choose from.  On the table are some sauces too, but only one of the two housemade options was labeled. I didn't try them. I liked my sassy.  So yes I'd go back if someone asked me to. I won't seek it out myself though. And next time I'd opt for drumsticks only.  To the people who say "but I only like white meat"... a) that's racist, yo. b) you probably also cook beef well done and pork to 165°, which means we can't be food friends.  But we can talk shit about people, and of course, ice cream.  So don't count me out unless you're vegan  Then I got nothin'.

Didn't think that fried chicken could get any better, try it double fried!  Instead of getting the wings, we got the Soul Sassy drumsticks, which were hugeeee. Crisp did a good job capturing the crunchy texture while keeping the chicken moist. Soul Sassy pairs well with the weight of the fried chicken, but was a little sweet for my taste. Kimchi was good. No complaints there!  If I return next time, I will definitely order less - the chicken, whether they are drumsticks or wings, are absolutely ginormous, very much a plus for the customers though!

I loved Crisp. The Bad Boy Buddha Bowl I got was a hefty size for the good price, and incredibly delicious. Was super filling and I loved loved loved it! I would strongly recommend going with someone, so that one of you can get wings and the other a bowl because the wings are awfully tempting as well, but the bowl will fill you. Plus add meat - extra delicious! The staff were warm and friendly, and even gave my friend two sauce samples to try before she decided on what wings she wanted. So helpful! And the food was out in what felt like seconds. The building itself was clean and they even had size and fake dishes set out so you could see what you were ordering and how big it was.  So, two things to note though. One, parking is not great. Actually, it took us half an hour, but we went at lunch hour. It's also a bit of a walk from the Belmont L stop so don't wear your most painful shoes if you're taking public transportation. Two, seating. Don't go in with a large group expecting them to have room - they have three very large tables that different parties share, and a long bar for groups of one or two. But neither of those things detract from my five star review!

Walking distance from my sisters apartment, so we went on a Saturday afternoon after we finished the Shedd Aquarium. It was packed (good sign), but we were picking up to go anyway. We got 15 wings (an order of 5 and 10) and split both Sassy Seoul and Crispy BBQ, and also got the steak burrito. The steak burrito is literally a small baby. It's huge. It's bigger than Chipotle burritos. If I ate the entire thing I wouldn't eat anything else the rest of the day. It was delicious though. I would definitely get it again, and also try the chicken version. It was essentially bibim bap wrapped in a burrito. Loved it. The wings are huge. It has the wing, tip, and drumette. Both sauces were tasty but the BBQ is saucier, and therefore I liked the Sassy Seoul better. They even throw green onions on top for a little extra flavor. My other sister had Crisp when she came to visit last time and raved about it and I understand why. Added plus - they were playing hip hop in the restaurant.

Flavors are on point and they truly understand how to deliver spice. This place seems like it is typically very crowded and I can totally see why. Despite the crowd, they had our food out in roughly 10 minutes. We were able to grab a seat and really enjoyed the lively atmosphere. FYI you can BYOB so that's pretty cool too! Planning to take family here when they visit Chicago!

Where do I begin. Words can't express the satisfaction or joy my tastebuds experienced this evening. Their fried chicken sandwich and wings were beyond expectations. Great spot, and remember looks can be deceiving.
This place is so good. The bowls are fantastic and great for sharing.

This is some seriously good fried chicken. The chicken wings are huge! Easily double the size of wings at other joints. I always do split sauce on my chicken orders with half Seoul sassy and half BBQ. I love spicy food and tried the spicy BBQ once and man it was soooo spicy (still flavorful and delish) but never again did I dare to try.  The place is small and sometimes seating can be tough if you're eating with a large group or it's prime dining time. Wings are much more enjoyable in the comfort and privacy of your own home so I always just place an order for carry-out.  The employees are nice and chill. Definitely check out Crisp!

Ordered takeout lunch here. Got bulgogi beef over rice (Seoul Steak bowl), a bulgogi beef burrito (Seoul Sensation) and the Crisp BBQ chicken wings. 4 stars for the wings alone! I loved the perfect blend of a little spicy and sweet (I have had some borderline intolerably hot Korean wings before at other places in the past which can also be good if you're in the mood - but Crisp's version is definitely more my speed). The beef burritos were HUGE, at least as big as the Chipotle sized burritos - they were okay, but the standout was definitely the chicken. Small-ish place that was crowded on a weekend afternoon.
This place has really delicious chicken. Pretty much enough said. The Buddha bowl was decent, but the chicken is what you really go for. You can call to order take out and skip the line.
I love bibimbap (baby) for 2-person portion and a mixed of wings (half half). Good lunch

I have been coming here since its inception. Unfort, I cannot enjoy anymore. The last two visits I had to leave after experiencing their super loud rap-type music that is truly intolerable to me. Is this really necessary? Couldn't a more chill, mellow atmosphere be achieved? I can't imagine some people don't feel the same. Sorry, love the food here but can't handle the obnoxious vibe.

Their bowls are fantastic.  Their chicken is delicious.  I love how convenient it is.  I literally crave their chicken.  The sauces are fantastic.  The price point for a quick dinner or a lunch is perfect.  Love it.

I came here with friends while visiting Chicago.  We ordered the wing- 10 Crisp BBQ Sauce and 10 Seoul Sassy, a Buddha Bowl and Fries.  When you order wings here they give you the entire wing, so 20 wings was more than enough for 4 people.  The Good ~ The Crisp BBQ wings had a really good flavor to them.  It was a good mixture of sweet and salty in each bite! ~ The Seoul Sassy wings had a good kick to it! Not too spicy not too bland. ~ The bathrooms are clean!  With all that sauce on your face that you can't lick off, the clean bathrooms were money. The Not So Good ~ It's a little bit inconvenient to eat and a bit messy.  There was a lot of licking of the fingers and sauce on the face. :) ~ The fries were just okay.  They kind of reminded me of McDonald's fries (which isn't entirely a bad thing since I love McDonald's fries) but I guess I just expected something different? ~ The Buddha Bowl was just okay.  I would stick with the wings rather than the bowl since I feel like I can just make it at home.  The portion size was pretty big though.  Would I come back again?  Yes!  If I lived in Chicago I would probably order to-go so i don't have to worry about parking or scaring people away with all that sauce on my face and hands.

Really good chicken. I got drumsticks and wings with half Seoul Sassy sauce and the other half Crisp BBQ sauce. They were both really good. The drumsticks and wings are HUGE. The outside of the chicken is so crisp and the meat is tender. Four wings or three drumsticks should be enough to fill you here. They also have a good selection of Asian beverages, desserts, and other food. Service is also really fast! The restaurant tends to be a little packed, and seating was a little limited when I was there.

I think we were expecting different wings, wings that would change our lives from all the positive reviews on here. But honestly, we took home our leftover wings and tossed them. The frying process they use here expels all of the juices from the chicken, it's almost like jerky. Methinks not next time. I would come back to try something else besides the wings.

Came out here with a Few friends on their recommendation and got All cold pieces of "fried chicken" had to send it back for another and even then just refried the pieces.  The entrees were garbage. Cold entrees from store tastes fresher  This is a place for college kids to get a cheap meal that means crap quality.  Chicken and steak pieces was all endosed in a stir fry sauce to hide actual taste  The worst rice ive ever tasted basically mashed rice Utterally disgusting. Kids could better than that. You can make better asian food at home when these people take advantage of poor college students and people who dont know food and just want to fill their bellies Never never coming back

Not Korean fried chicken. It's decent, but it's just wings with Korean sauce. Haven't tried the other dishes but I assume they're good. Pick up is good, they're always busy, never gotten delivery. They've got a couple Korean drinks and desserts which is nice.

Really great hole in the wall feel Korean restaurant in the heart of Lakeview. Definitely a big to go business, but they also have 4 or so communal style "picnic tables" inside to eat on. Had some really good looking wings that I will have to go back for, but our table all got the Bibimbap bowls. I got the Big Buddha Bowl with beef in it. A HUGE amount of tasty food, and lots of different veggies. Well seasoned beef as well. And to top it off, a couple of great sauces to put on. Will definitely be back.

This place is ALWAYS busy but just goes to show how good the food really is right?  The wings here are totally WORTH THE WAIT and the staff is excellent at having it ready fast.  If it's your first time here the size of the wings will definitely impact you. They are gigantic!  The only issue you will encounter is finding a table to sit down to eat. This place is also BYOB and what goes better than beer and wings together?
Best wings I've ever had. These hot spots almost never live up to the hype, but damn. I mean... damn.

Oh wow, these wings are amazing. If you've ever had korean style chicken wings before, you know what to expect, but if not it's a bit different than your usual wings. The wings come as whole wings, so you have to break off the drumsticks and wing tips(which is fine, it's kind of fun to do). Don't expect your usual sauce flavors, they have a bit more zing to them, and are overall fantastic. I tried the BBQ, Seoul Sassy, and the Buffalo, honestly the Buffalo was my least favorite of the bunch(though not to say it's bad), the other two are 10/10 sauces, get those! The chicken quality is also fantastic, juicy and just meaty enough but not overgrown steroid chicken, and they are fried perfectly. The place isn't too big and is pretty busy, but if you grab a table(it's potentially shared first come first serve tables) it's a fun experience eating there, and not too loud or anything. These definitely compete for best wings in Chicago but note again that it's a different style of wings and not everyone will like it.

This is a small, intimate spot that u must try asap.  They took wings to another level.  These are not normal sized wings.  They are mega seasoned delicious wings.  Even eating 5 is too much for 1.  The fries are delish.  Salt free!!!!!!!! Yea.  One of the reasons I never order fries but theirs are flavorful. The sauces are heavenly.  I tried the Seoul and BBQ today.  Oh my what a party in your mouth.   Friendly staff.  Clean spot.

Crisp has been bookmarked for a long while, but we decided to make the trip out to Lakeview to give it a try. Because it is located in such a busy area, parking can be really tricky. If you find a spot, grab it especially when it's on the weekend.  This establishment is small, limited standing room, and the tables are huge so you are bound to sit next to a stranger or two.  The wings are HUGE. It's also the full "L" wing as well. I had a hard time even finishing 10 wings. The sauce was pretty much. Sweet and stick. Spicy and hot. You really can't go wrong with the sauces. Plus, the wings are cooked perfectly.  Service was friendly as well. Originally we were going to order 25 wings, but the gentleman behind the counter mention how that is a lot between two people so we just had two orders of 10 wings. I would love to come back, but it is extremely crowded majority of the time I was eating. It was really unpleasant to be packed like sardines in there.
This is AWESOME food! Korean fried chicken and other specialties. Super tasty and very reasonable prices. If I lived closer to Crisp, I would probably gain 50 pounds, but I would be smiling.

LOS ANGELES TOURIST REVIEW.  I took an Uber here for a pickup bin a rainy, Chicago evening. I ordered 36 wings (IMPORTANT: wing and drumette counts as one whole piece).  2 flavors: original and sassy Seoul sauce.  Crispy/original is my favorite of the two. It's very reminiscent of Korean bar food. It wasn't overly greasy and pretty crispy -- hence the name of the store (amazing. See that full circle?)  Seoul sassy sauce wasn't over bearing. The wings weren't drenched which is great. I hate overly saucy wings. Unfortunately, these wings didn't hit home for me. Mildly sweet and salty wings, there's a tang. Not much to it for me. Try them out but don't order a large quantity unless you like sweet wings.  Would I go again? MAYBE FOR DEM ORIGINAL WINGS only! Mmmmmmmmmm
Best wings in Chicago, hands down. I just wish they'd hire delivery drivers instead of the bike guys. I always feel too bad to order delivery when it's cold or raining!

Best korean fried chicken!!!! Cannot rave more about this place. Their chicken wings are huge and their seoul sassy sauce is amazing. I can't get enough of their sauce and wish they would just drown their chicken in it. Even with the delicious sauce covering the wings, the wings aren't soggy at all but hold true to their name- CRISPY. You'll never find any seating here just because it's always crowded which means it's a popular and amazing place.  If you come here, you won't regret it!

Some of the best wings in the city. You can either do wings, chicken tenders or a whole chicken. They are known for their wings so I would try that over anything else. The Buddha bowls are pretty popular too and healthy as well. Super quick and a must try in Chicago.

The first time I tried CRISP about 2 years ago I knew I would never have better wings again. 2 years later I stand firm on that prediction. Forget the parking hassle, forget the long line, forget the limited seating, the moment your taste buds are exposed to the abundance of flavor in the classic or Seoul sassy (my two favorites) everything else is a distant memory. Now, let's not let the wings get all the attention,CRISP offers a variety of food from Korean burritos to rice bowls that  are just as flavorful and food coma inducing. The steak bowl mixed with their homemade atomic sauce(which is simply amazing) was the perfect blend of flavor,spice,and kick.  I may only live 30 minutes from Crisp, but I would go across the country for it's delicious menu.

GOOD EATING.  Forget about parking, forget about high quality serving.  You order your food, you get your food. You enjoy your food and you leave with full intentions of being back  the next day.  I got the wings- I didn't regret it. It was amazing, still is amazing.  I came back the next day. lol  and that's that.

This place!  The Seoul Sassy sauce!  The chicken is so yummy and juicy!  Definitely worth it if you haven't gone before.  I'd recommend picking up since it gets pretty busy pretty much at all times, but if you call ahead, your order is generally ready in 10 minutes and is hot and delicious.  The veggie side with rice is perfect with the chicken wings or tenders.

This place is a KOREAN FRIED CHICKEN JOINT. Need I say more?  I was craving some wings and Crisp popped in for the "must go to places" for wings in Chicago.  This was on a Thursday night and it was a full house! There was literally no seating left.  I decided to still order my wings because I love wings.  I got the 10 piece whole wings order assuming they were going to be small...I was wrong the wings were HUGE. I could only eat 4-5 pieces.  With the 10 piece order you can get two flavors so I got the Seoul Sassy and Crisp BBQ. By the time I got my wings there was still no seating so I was standing while eating my wings..the struggle was real.  One word YUM. I was so happy with my choices of favor because they were both off the chain!The wings were so crispy and full of flavor! I think the crispness of the wings was because they fried it twice! Sometimes at night I dream about these wings wanting more!
Simply amazing. My personal recommendation is wings with the Seoul Sassy sauce. Wish Crisp was closer to home so that I could come more often. Definitely will return.

There has never been a time that I've denied the opportunity to eat fried chicken, and Crisp's KFC is the best I've ever had.  It retains a crunch that rings in your ears even when it's drenched in their gochujang and soy based sauces and has been sitting on the table for an hour.  I always get it with a tub of their vegetables which are nicely blanched or pickled.

Always stop here when I'm in town. Whether it's the wings or the steak bowls, it's always a top notch filling meal. The spice level is perfect and the sauces add a real nice touch. It can get packed and seating is limited but it's communal seating so don't hesitate to ask to sit next to people.

Don't get the "burrito" it's really just very poorly put together salad wrap. Like airport news stand wrap bad. I can't speak for the fried chicken, which must be fine given this spots other reviews. But this was a very expensive, messy, sad salad wrap. And I felt you all should be wa

You know a place is good when you walk in 10 minutes after they open for a Wednesday lunch and there are people at every table. I had the beef bowl, which was delicious, though as I looked around me, the fried chicken with fries definitely looked like the choice meal. The beef was perfectly seasoned, and came simply with rice and green onions. When I pass through Chicago again, I'll be sure to try out the chicken!

I love their chicken.  My only complaint is that it is so hard to make up my mind.  Everything is delicious.  The staff is friendly and helpful.  The ambience isn't that much but I think of it primarily as a take out place.  I've had other Korean style chicken wings in Chicago and they are all very good but Crisp is absolutely the best!

The wings are what I originally came here for. But ever since I tried the steak bowl, that is my go to choice here. You really can't go wrong, anything you order will be good. Also their wings are the WHOLE wing, not just half of one.

I can't stop coming here, although I still would never want to eat inside.  The Seoul sassy sauce on the boneless tenders is so freaking good.  I'm not a wing person in general, but this is the only place I'll eat a wing from- these are high-quality meant and really like three wings put together.  I don't mess with anything but the tenders anymore though, they're so perfectly crispy I cannot get enough.
The food here is amazing! I highly recommend this place to everyone. The communal seating arrangement take an it to get used to, but it's really cool. Service is fast as well. Can't wait to go back!!
I was mad I only tried two wings, they were really good, I should have gotten more, but I had got a rice bowl also, when I go back, it will be for the wings
LOVE Crisp. You can't go wrong with the wings, but if you aren't feeling that the Buddha Bowls are amazing. The hot sauces and spices they have available at the table are also fantastic.

"Wow..... How did you do that?!" That's always the first line of any audience witnessing a cool magic trick. In this case, Crisp is the magician and you're the audience or "victim" to this trick. Some part of me deeply regrets coming here because nowhere else I go would ever be as good as this place. I know Koreans are good at fried chicken, but this place combines organic chemistry, calculus, and biology into their food. The result is acceptance by the toughest chicken wing critic. We ordered the buffalo spicy wings and sassy Seoul wings, the buffalo spicy wings was really good but the sassy Seoul created a flashback of the happiest time in my life. Suddenly, the noise level stops and a calming classical music plays behind your ears. The Sassy seoul crispy wings is perfectly infused with the sauce that hits you with a perfect seasoning which later is balanced by a slightly sweet after taste. Fingers were licked and maybe sucked off by your neighbors as you continue to eat the next wing. I hope this helps you in finding the perfect chicken wing joint.

I'm gonna keep this simple, Crisp is a great spot for chicken wings. I don't do spicy, but I do enjoy the milder, sweeter, sauce option that the offer. The wings are big, which is always good, they're delicious, which is even better. The serve the up quick, so if you just want to drop in for lunch you'll have plenty of time to eat and run.It's a wee bit more pricey than other chicken wing spots around town, but not too expensive. If you love really good fried chicken come check Crisp out.
Seoul sassy wings are my favorite.  Right up there with Great sea for best Korean wings in the city.  Big Buddha bowl is our go to.  Place never disappoints

O. M. G. That's pretty much all you can say. Go here..... you will not regret it. By far THE BEST wings in Chicago. They have amazing chicken sandwiches... and the sauce... my gosh.. came in with 5 friends and we all ordered a plethora of food. None of it was even close to being bad. Very filling. Very tasty.  5 stars. Don't change. Simply amazing.

I used to love Crisp.  Came in for lunch today.  Busy, but service was good.  Ordered a half chicken and onion rings.  The onion rings were as good as always.  The chicken was way over fried and dried out and tasted old.  The only thing in the way of dark meat (my favorite) was a couple of dried out bones.  I am not sure I will be back.

Great chicken in whatever form...bone-in, strips, whatever. Great rice bowls with very generous portions. Huge selection of canned sodas/sparkling water. My favorite meal is Chi-Town Chicken Bowl w/ brown rice and fried egg on top + a small order of boneless chicken strips + soda. Two meals' worth of delicious food for under $20. Dining room is mostly communal table/bench style with stools/counter along walls. Quite busy whenever I've been there. Employees are friendly and helpful and food is ready pretty quick. Honestly, one of my top 5 Chicago restaurants.

I'm not a fried chicken type of gal, but wow, this was absolutely delish! Had the boneless strips with Seoul Sassy sauce and it had just enough kick! Tender white meat fried just right with plenty of sauce. Small inside and busy on Saturday during lunchtime. Three picnic-type tables to fit six people and about a dozen stools. Seemed to do a good to-go business.

Ugh! My wife invited me to have lunch at her office the other day and surprised me with CRISP! I've never had them before but have heard amazing things from friends and colleagues. Well let me tell you....I was NOT disappointed. I was infact, extremely pleased! It's​ a great fusion of Korean and American food. The wings are cooked to perfection but the baby Buddha bowl and Seoul steak bowl are phenomenal!!! The flavors in the marinated steak pull my pallet in many different directions (all good) and challenge my taste buds in the most amazing way. If you're a huge fan of bi bim bop, like me, then the Buddha bowl is where it's at. Get a side of kimchi and expect to have a lot left over because they give you a nice size container of it! My only negative would be that they don't deliver desserts because they say the ice cream melts too fast but since they have already won my heart, I'm willing to dine in so I can give them a try!
The baby Buddha bowl with chicken added to it is to die for. So flavorful! I love the atomic sauce on the side as well. Great spot in Lakeview!

I used to like this place until I had the following experience. The website says it opens at 11:30 so I got there then, but wound up standing outside until 11:45 and it was a very cold February day. I called while I waited because I thought they might be closed. No answer. Food is good, but took off a few stars for not opening on time, saying nothing to me as I waited outside, and for not taking Discover. I don't recall them offering me a copy of my receipt either. I think this might have been the only restaurant I've ever been to that doesn't take Discover. It's the 21st century?
Very good chicken, and reasonably priced, but I would recommend eating it in store instead of getting delivery (it took a long time for the delivery to come).

Quality of chicken sandwich has been slipping. Once a staple of my diet now no thank you as the chicken has been just weird looking the last few times I've ordered from here.  Should've taken pic the breast was larger than the bun and super thin w/ barely any meat. So sad. I will miss the old Crisp.
Very good and fast bi bi bap. Jam packed but all smiles. This place is located in a cute section of town. I highly recommend this place for a less than traditional Korean food experience

Brought my friend who was visiting Chicago since I knew she would want wings and I could have a buddha bowl. However, Crisp made me go from vegetarian to flexitarian... the wings are just so delicious, especially with the spicy bbq sauce. 100% would recommend!
Rice is just ok, but the wings are far more better than that.

Finally came back to try the wings, last time I was here, we got the whole chicken. Wings are definitely better, but still find the wing meat to be a bit dry. They sure fry those suckers! Anyway, Korean chicken wings, I think are always pretty good and rarely a disappointment. I prefer the candy coating that I've found at some places. Seoul sassy vs BBQ is a tough toss up, but luckily, even just ordering 5 wings, the place will sauce both for ya. BBQ has a bit of the red pepper flavor that I enjoy and isn't that spicy and the Seoul sassy is sweet soy garlic. Both are delicious, but BBQ has a stronger flavor. Wings are very seasoned, I almost found it to be on the salty side. Crisp is great for the neighborhood and places like this makes Chicago a wonderful local food scene.

Damn. So sticky, finger-licking good!!!!!  Definitely grab a basket and some fries. The kimchi was a really great way to cut the fat. Not a lot of seating - but this time a restaurant so there you go.  Moist towelettes are available for use as an FYI they are up by the cashier.  Check for daily specials.

Way more impressed by my second visit than the first one. Yes, yes, yes to their juicy, tender wings! Love the Seoul sassy and Crisp BBQ sauce. The extra spicy sauce is really not that bad and you can always ask for it on the side if you're not ready to commit. Reason why I liked the second visit better was because the last time I came here, I got the half-chicken and the meat was really dry, the fried skin almost completely separated from the meat. I guess their wings are the better, safer thing to get here. Definitely one of my favorite wing/Korean fusion places in town.  The chicken tender strips are a solid O.K. - the breading is on the thick and crunchy side if that's your thing, and the chicken breast meat is pretty dry. The side of fries are pretty large and should totally be split among friends.

Seoul sassy and Crisp BBQ.  Jaysus, where have you been all my life!? Hands down one of the best chicken chicken wings I've had- and I've had a good amount!  The wings are served hot and delicious, and best to be devoured using your hands. Get ready for the inevitable mess, but it's worth it, and Crisp is ready for you. There are various sauces on the table, along with rolls of paper towels. I don't like that they don't offer mu (korean radish) along with the wings for palate cleansing, but these are so good that I can overlook it.  Crisp also has a great selection of drinks, which is a huge plus, sealing it to be a staple in my life.

My first try was a carry out for a group of friends who came visiting at our place. I was not impressed but thought maybe it would be better if I dine in. Nope! The best I could say was my burrito was very filling! For some it could be 2 meals.

I've had Crisp a few times now and it's just fantastic.  The sassy wings are great but even better is the bim bim bop.  The large one comes with 12 different veggies, a protein (+$2), rice and the BEST spicy sauce.  Need to start picking up from here more often!

The best wings I've ever had in my entire life!! The 5 piece is so filling you could honestly split it with someone. The sauce is so amazing, and I'll definitely keep going back just to try them all. Unique array of soft drink choices, and I also really liked the music they played

Crisp is one of those spots you will never be disappointed with, the food is really good. The take is on par with dining in. I will say they need to find out a different seating area. The table was sticky which is nasty to me, the bathroom wasn't as clean as I would expect it to be. The bathroom door handle managed to have chicken sauce all over it. Besides the few cons that I've pointed out, I will be coming back for some amazing wings and sauce..

I have a HUGE weakness for chicken wings. There is no shortage them in Lincoln Park but I keep finding myself coming back here to order Seoul Sassy wings even after I've just gone grocery shopping down the street. Their O-rings (onion rings) are great as a side when I'm dining in, but when I take them home I like eating them with some brown rice to make it a "healthier" meal. The ambiance of the place is nothing to write home about, just long communal tables that are usually very crowded during meal times, but the food makes you not pay much attention to your surroundings anyway. If you want to avoid the long wait, I'd suggest always calling in your order ahead of time and just run errands nearby until it's ready.

By far the best wings in the area. The Buffalo wings are good and the Seoul sassy wings are great. The various bowls are flavor full and are easily enough for two meals. The staff here is friendly and very accommodating. The parking can be tough. Street parking in this neighborhood is a pain but the food here makes it worthwhile.

This place is phenomenal.  It's the best Korean home-style I've had in Chicago, and delivery is always on time.  I personally go with either the wings (with Seoul sassy sauce) or the steak bowl.  My only complaint is that I didn't discover this place until 5 years after moving to Chicago!

Ordered pickup for their wings. The restaurant was small and packed with people, yet service was fast. I got the 5 piece wings in the Seoul Sassy sauce, which were huge (it's technically 10 wings). It was more than enough for me and I had leftovers. The wings were super tasty and packed a punch. Not as crispy as I'd like it to be, and not as good as "Seoul Street" back in Ann Arbor. But still very good and I would come back again. I also had fries as a side and they were mediocre. I'd skip those.  I look forward to coming back here and trying their other foods. Excellent wings though!

Ordered a whole chicken and got a bunch of random pieces, mostly breast pieces. It was all so dry. I think this place has changed the chicken wasn't this dried and fried to a crisp (haha). It's no longer juicy deliciousness. The sauce they use though is good, chicken is over cooked.

I just received my delivery order from Crisp. Normally I have a great experience ordering from you but today I received my food and the styrofoam container holding the chicken was so smushed and had sauce dripping out of it and it was a huge mess to clean up. Then I opened the chicken and there are only 7 and I'd say a half pieces of chicken when I ordered the 9 piece meal. Lastly, one of the pieces of chicken looks like a bite was taken out of it which is very off putting and concerning. I love your food and the delivery is usually great but today was just not a good experience.

Best Korean BBQ wings! Full of flavor, right amount of heat, and the meat is oh-so-tender! Their bulgogi bowl satisfies two and is very yummy as well! Place gets packed and is very small, so plan accordingly.
Amazing place for vegetarian Korean bowls. Everything you've heard about this place is true. It's a staple of Lakeview East. It's also very busy! Therefore, I'd recommend ordering pickup.
My favorite place for Korean food. My girl and I bike literally 10 miles during the summer just to eat here. Staff is super chill n awesome music. I recommend this place to anyone!!!
This is my favorite place to carry out from! The sassy Seoul is the only sauce I will ever need!
Been here a lot and every time It is better than the last! Stopped in today and ordered 3 boneless Seoul sassy wings (so tasty and fresh). Can't wait to come back!
What can I say? This place is the bomb! The wings and the sauce are beyond delicious. Their bowls are also very good. I recommend it to anyone who's new to Chicago.
Best chicken ever... amazing sauces. I will always love Crisp! It is go to delicious food. Atomic sauce is the bomb :)
Good spot for Sunday night delivery. The fried chicken are Korean style - sweet & tangy. I recommend the Seoul sassy style. Also, get a Buddha bowl and ask for extra sauce. Enjoy!

I've been hearing about this place for such a long time! And I loved it. They're known for their wings but since I'm not a big chicken wing fan (I know ) I was happy that they had other options. My friend however got the chicken wings and they were not only HUGE but also super good - as she told me.  I got the baby Buddha bowl which comes with 4 veggies. I also added beef and asked for brown rice which raised the price a bit but made the meal complete. The bowl is similar to the Korean dish bibimbop. Complete with an egg on top and chili paste sauce to mix in. Even though it was the baby bowl it was actually very filling. I can imagine how filling the big bowls are.  I'm taking one star off because the tables were super sticky and dirty. Which is kinda gross but I didn't really mind wiping them myself.  I definitely will come again!
Excellent big "healthy" wings..even better sauce..and the kimchi was a winner...the atomic sauce(Fye)..mix the kimchi in with Buddha bowl...#thankMeLater.

A small Korean fried chicken + Buddha bowl joint nestled in Lakeview. Chill, cool vibes here, with picnic table-style seating and speakers blasting hip hop.
