It was busy when I went, and I get the feeling it's busy often.  Everything looks good, but I opted for a Buddha  Bowl, Buffalo chicken strips and fries. The Buddha bowl left a lot to be desired--it essentially tasted like nothing. The chicken, however, was a highlight and definitely worth returning for. (The fries are probably not the best side to choose, here. I'd recommend picking something more interesting like Kimchee or Mushrooms). I'd love to return, try something else on the menu, and potentially give this spot a higher rating. For now, they get a middle-of-the-road review for a middle-of-the-road eating experience. I'd say, if the menu interests you and you like fried chicken: stop in here and try it.

Really fresh tasting food. The portion sizes are HUGE and reasonably priced, and I haven't yet tried anything I haven't really enjoyed. The bowls, burrito, and chicken are all really flavorful. I will warn anyone that wants to eat in that the seating is benches so be prepared to make some new friends!

Small spot. If all the seats are taken you have to stand around and wait for someone to leave. I expected the wings to be amazing but they were just ok. The steak and chicken bowls were really good though.. especially the rice in them. There's a few different sauces to try too that were pretty good. I was really hoping the wings were as good as everyone said. I'm glad I tried it at least once. But yeah I know it's nothing I'll crave again. Except the bowl. I'd go back to try another bowl.

SEOUL SASSY!  The fried chicken here is full of flavor and at an amazing price too! My favorite is the "Seoul Sassy" fried chicken. Tangy and sweet! For days I'm feeling to go for more heat, I like to order five of each (They do allow you to mix within your quantities!) of the "Crisp BBQ" and the Buffalo flavors and request them to be as spicy as possible. The BBQ sauce they use on the Crisp BBQ ones is smoky, sweet, and has a deep spice mix flavor. The Buffalo sauce they use ranges in heat from mild all the way to "suicidal." They don't lay on a ton of sauce (More on the dry side on the outside), but still have those napkins ready! I like to get the fries and onion rings as sides if I go for the Whole Chicken Deal. You get two sides and two cans of soda with that. Fries and onion rings always come hot, but are made extra awesome if you use that "Alison's Atomic Sauce" on them. Not sure what's in the sauce, but it would honestly go great with anything here.  There's also bowl-type and burritos on offer here, but I go here for a craving for wings, so haven't tried those.  The place is a small shop with a very hole in the wall feel. They prop up soda cans to display what they have and they have a bunch of mirrors on the wall to take up space on it I guess. I feel the mirrors can be ditched. Definitely opt for carry-out at busier times, as seating is very limited and long lines make the place feel way too crowdy to actually eat comfortably. Great place for wings if you're in the area!

The Buddha bowls are amazing , pretty pricy for what you are getting I feel like my bill added up fast. The service was wonderful and the prepared the food super quick. Food doesn't do well as leftovers !

This used to be the best thing ever, straight up ambrosia! The biggest juiciest wings I was basically eating every other week but the quality has gone down a lot. So tragic. Now it's so bone dry and tasteless because they put exactly 1 and a half thimbles of sauce per 10 wing order and I can never eat it again. Imagine with me if you will, a degeneration from the finest purest cocaine to dirty crack. And crack is whack! (RIP Whitney)
Chicken tastes like candy! Very filling, great portion size. Friendly staff, communal seating, orgasmic flavors. I want hot loads of crispy chicken meat in my mouth! Would dine here again.

Can I say WOW!  I had high expectations because this place was referred to us for having great Bibimbap and they do.  Everything taste so fresh.  We tried quite a bit of food; the Buddha bowls, Chi-town Chicken Bowl, Hot Wings, and Chicken Strips and Fries.  This place serves great food at a reasonable price. Be forewarned it is small, and gets packed.  Seats are hard to come by but they try and get people with food seats instead of people who are sitting waiting for food or to order still.  Great job Crisp!

Well, it took me a while to get here but boy, was it worth the trip (and wait)! Crisp serves easily the best fried chicken I've ever had. Hot Chicken Takeover - Columbus, OH? Check. Hattie B's - Nashville, TN? Yep. Revival - Minneapolis, MN? Easily. Bonchon, Popeyes, Zaxbys, KFC, Publix, and everything else - Crisp easily tops them all. But you didn't need me to tell you that! 2000+ reviews have already put Crisp on the map for the not just the best fried chicken in Chicago, but probably the Midwest and perhaps in the nation. What makes Crisp above and beyond the rest? For one, they are served Korean style, which means little breading - all the flavor is in the sauce and the seasoning. The lack of breading means no mouthfuls of grease that is typical of fried chicken. I got the Crisp BBQ sauce, which was EXCELLENT with just the right amount of sweet and spicy. Going back tomorrow before my long drive to get the famous Seoul Sassy, because why not? Also got the Baby Buddha Bowl which was decent but nothing exceptional (other than the price - a bit under $7!) These wings are HUGE - 5 is more than enough for a normal appetite. The place is tiny so take out might be the only option unless you're a fan of standing.

It's always been crowded when I've been there, which is usually a good sign. It can be tough to get a table though. I remember being not really impressed by the Chi-Town Chicken Bowl, so I wouldn't recommend it. The Not So Common Crisp was really good and it was about the right amount of food, but I paired it with fries, too, which was probably a bit more than I needed for one meal. The fries were really good and really fresh, as were the mushrooms. The only thing I remember that was weird about the menu/the place was when I ordered I asked the guy behind the counter about a few items first and he was pretty honest about not liking any of the dishes I asked about. The honesty was nice, but I wasn't expecting to hear one of the employees didn't like half the menu.

Good Thai food with great service in an awesome location!  The restaurant was pretty small so seating is limited if you plan to go during busier hours. Street parking was easy to find.  We got our food fast and everything tasted great!

I had to go! And the Original Bad Baby Buddha bowl was simply amazing! I have been wanting to come in for quiet some time but always made an excuse due to distance from my home. No more, I really had to come in.  I came in specifically for the Big Bad Buddah Bowl that I have heard raves about, but I wasn't quiet ready for what was put forth! Are you kidding me? The bowl was as big as my head and filled with tons of vegetables. Even though it is best known in other countries as Bi Bim Bop (I hope that's how it is spelled), it is a treat amongst the bowls anywhere in Chicago. Are there any? I choose this size because 4 veggies seemed like a tease and this one consisted of 8 from bean sprouts, carrots, I believe zucchini, mushrooms and cucumbers, corn and Chinese radish. I mean serve it over their rice and BAMM you can't ask for anything better.   I've been wanting to come here since I heard of it quite a while ago, and I am so glad I finally did. The taste of the Buddha Bowl with its bed of absolutely awesome rice is by far one of my new all time favorite dishes. I so am going again today! And the chicken, we ordered 1/2 a chicken and let me slap you now! IT IS AWESOME!  So if you want to taste something totally different in the Chicago area, try them out. You will definitely not be disappointed.

Wings here are huge! It's not just a drum or a flat, you actually get the whole leg! Order 5 wings (pretty much 10 pieces) and got two sauces on them: Seoul sassy and BBQ crisp. BBQ crisp was decent, Seoul sassy was good! Atmosphere here is cool, workers are cool, throw back songs playing in the background was dope. Seating here could get difficult if it's busy.

The two of us shared the whole chicken, which only cost $17.50 including tax.  The chicken came out very quickly, but the meat was quite dry, and honestly we're not sure why this place has such high ratings on Yelp.  There also isn't a huge amount of seating, but that wasn't a problem because there weren't a huge number of people here.

I love Crisp! I've only ever gotten the chicken strips with Seoul Sassy sauce, and they're amazing. I order the 3-piece chicken strips, but they usually give you 4 or 5 strips in the order, which is a nice bonus. My boyfriend and I have noticed that you get more food (more strips for me, more/bigger wings for him) if you order and eat in the restaurant than if you order to-go or use a delivery app. Try it!
for their delicious chicken wings and rice bowls!! The place is pretty small for a big crowd and it gets really packed but service is fast and employees are very friendly.

This place is awesome! The food tastes really good (both the wings and the bowls) and what you get for the price is pretty amazing. I've been coming back here again and again; this is one of those places that you end up craving every few weeks. I would recommend getting a sauce with the wings though even if, like me, you enjoy wings on their own because they're a little plain without sauce. Pro tip: order ahead and carry out. It's often full and crowded and it's a small hole-in-the-wall.

Crisp is famous for a reason. It's good. It's quite good when you're hungry, but after taking a few bites of your food, you start realizing something is lacking.  I tried the Seoul steak bowl ($8.95) which was a generous portion. As an avid eater of Korean cuisine, bulgogi is one of my favorite items. Although the bulgogi with the Seoul steak bowl is marinated in Crisp's sauce, I didn't find any essence of bulgogi in it. It was merely beef and rice. The pieces of the bulgogi were not cut thin enough, and the sauce should at least have that sweetness bulgogi does.  I did enjoy the crisp bbq sauce and Seoul sassy sauce with the wings ($16.95 for 10 wings). My only gripe is that the wings were too large. They should be cut smaller so they can be eaten easier, especially when there's an abundance of sauce.

This is one of my favorite neighborhood spots. It is always busy, so you'll want to try to either order ahead or go during a non-peak time.  My three stars is due to my latest visit. I ordered a Not So Common with sauce. Unfortunately, they forgot to put any sauce on the sandwich. Although good, it was not at the standard that I'm accustomed. Hopefully this is not a trend.

Ok by now you get the drill. 2000+ reviews, you don't need mine to know how good this place is. Well I'm going to gush about it anyways. Best Korean wings you can find in Chicago. Two main flavors you should go for: Seoul Sassy (tangy and a little spicy) and Crisp BBQ. Yes there are other flavors but really you only need to try these two. At first the prices seem pretty hefty, until you realize that each "wing" is AN ENTIRE WING (see pictures). My husband and I got 10 wings and the steak bowl, and we split that into 2 meals. Side note: the wings reheat pretty well too! Food aside, you need to be mentally prepared going in. It is CROWDED, tight, loud in the store. During meal times, count yourself lucky if you're able to get a seat. My advice: either take out, or be prepared to fight for a space at the table (literally). People clearly know how good this place is. Hope it expands to other locations!
Amazing wings and solid BCS. The seoul sassy wings were delicious and the atomic sauce was addicting. Guys we're really nice that worked there, too. Definitely will try the bowls next time.
This is easily amongst top 3 of the best wings I've had thus far.

Always love Crisp. I think this is one of the best Korean Chicken wings in town. My husband introduced me to this place, I was so awed by the foods, and so surprised when the first time I came there that none of the staffs were Korean. I mean, it does not matter, but the spices that they use for the chicken, that's pretty authentic. This place is definitely my togo place, even now we are far from this place :'( - we still make an effort to pickup when we crave for it, which is very frequent. LOL
The wings were awesome..some of the best flavors.  My 12 year old loved the sassy seoul.  The budda bowels are delicious, basically korean bibimbop.
Really good food. A little bit pricey and the seating wasn't too bad. I got in before it got really packed.

Excellent fried chicken! All the sauces are good. Another standout for my is the fries - super thin and crispy. I haven't had the Buddha bowls but they look really great.  I only recommend this place for takeout. There's limited seating and if you do get a seat, you'll walk out smelling heavily of fried food.

This place is a little inconsistent for me. The first time I went there, the wings were big and juicy, perfectly cooked, and well seasoned. I liked the Seoul sassy sauce. I also tried their bulgogi burrito. It was ok.  Their side dishes like the radish kimchi and marinated veggies were good. They were authentic and reminded me of my mom's.  Since this visit I have ordered delivery from them. Two times, and the only two times, I ordered delivery, the wings were scrawny and overcooked. They were so overcooked that the meat under the batter was chewy and dry, like if you picked up wings that sat out overnight for 2 nights. It didn't taste like chicken, but just chewy chicken-flavored plastic. The sauce was also scantily put on the chicken. They weren't covered in the sauce, as if someone just sprinkled it, or tossed them in a bowl with very little sauce so it didn't cover everything. I saw that Bon Chon was coming into Chicago into Chinatown, and I love that place. It's a nationwide chain and Chicago is finally getting one! I'll probably have that be my go to for Korean chicken wings.

This was on my husband's list for a long time as he loves his wings.  We got the buffalo wings which were cooked great nice and crispy- very messy!  I think maybe the korean sauces are more popular than the buffalo sauce- I'd try a different one if we went again.  Don't get the fries, under seasoned and not that crispy.  You order at the register then wait for your food- very casual dining.

Sauce is great! Wings are very Crisp!!! Lol and overall delicious. The staff was very helpful as it was my first visit to this restaurant. The place is very small and after seeing all the reviews I thought I'd pop in 8 minutes after they opened, so needless to say I was one of the first customers. I had the 4 drumstick special and wound up with 5 so I was happy! I will definitely come back

Wow this place has one of the best wings that I've had in a while! I came here on a Sunday night and it was packed which means their food is good! Parking: street parking in the front Ambience: it was a chill restaurant where you order at the register and they will come to you and bring your food. They were playing good throwback music. As I mentioned, it was crowded and packed on a Sunday night, with a long line as well. Try to grab a table or share a table with other people, which is what I did since there were no other seats! Otherwise, you can just order to go which a lot of people did. It was a small restaurant space so it was kinda cramped in there. Food: I ordered 5 wings ($9) of the Seoul Sassy (ginger, garlic, and soy) and I also ordered 10 wings of BBQ wings ($17) to-go. The wings are freaking huge! These are not your baby wings that you get from B Dubs. They are double the size of a regular wing and they're filling! I only ate 3 of 5 wings because it was so big. I absolutely loved the Seoul Sassy sauce, which was sweet and sticky. The chicken was so juicy and the breading to chicken ratio was perfect.  Verdict: the space is small but it's okay to share a table with other people or take orders to go! The chicken wings are bomb and I recommend you try them if you haven't already. I already can't wait to go back and eat more wings! I want to try their Buddha Bowl which looked delicious.
Honestly? You don't need my review. This places has thousands of reviews and it's still rated at 4.5 stars. Just go already.
Only had the Buddha Bowl, but it was great! By far the best bibimbap I've had. The veggies and the bulgogi tasted very fresh. Next time I'm there I hope to try the wings, which seem to be popular.

I read a lot of reviews before going to this place and what I was imagining was different from a reality. This is a small busy place, very casual that offers great food at very affordable price. It's first come first served and get your own seat kinda place, which I like and don't at the same time, since sometimes line is huge!  I know most of people come there for chicken, but I'm a Buddha bowl kinda girl! Ha! I tried almost all of them and I have to say non were disappointment.  Great friendly stuff who tries to do their job as best as they can in such a busy place.

OMG this place has the biggest most delicious wings ever! They use organic chicken whose wings look like they're on steroids. We ordered 10 wings (split Korean BBQ sauce and Seoul Sassy sauces) with a side of homemade kimchi cabbage. Both sauces are delicious, but Seoul Sassy is my favorite. Their homemade kimchi was ok - I prefer mine with more vinegar and this version did not seem to have vinegar. The dining area is small so be prepared to share tables with strangers. Parking was a pain because this is Lincoln Park so take the train/bus.
Awesome Asian American Fusion food! Highly recommend the Steak Bowl and pair it with their wing selections!

You know how I know the food here is good? I'll get it to go and we'll run a bunch of errands while the food sits in the car. Finally get home and eat it, and it's still f**kin' delicious.  You know how I know you're gay? You like Coldplay.  I haven't tried everything, but here's what I can say. Wings: dope. Seoul Beef Bowl: delectable.  You don't need ME to sell you on this place. 2k-something reviews at 4 and a half stars, so I'll just stop here.  If you're near it, try it.
My favorite delivery. I long and hunger for those wings. But omg try the Buddha bowl it's to die for,,, fast delivery,, my sat night go to

Stopped into Crisp for lunch per the recommendation of a friend and loved it! The same friend recommended the Baby Buddha and again, was not disappointed! The cheapest of the rice bowls, it came with 4 veggies and I opted to add chicken for $2 more. Flavors erred on the sweet side so I added some of the Atomic Sauce to kick it up a notch and it was perfect. Portions are pretty large so I'd recommend sharing. A couple of the tables around us got the wings, which appeared to be a big hit. We'll definitely be sampling these next time we stop in!
Yes, the chicken absolutely rocks.  My only complaint is that I wish that the place was bigger and could accommodate more people for seating.
Delicious both in the restaurant and as a take-out/delivery option.  Have ordered this to-go many times and can never put the chicken down.  Crowded on Friday and Saturday nights!

Oh man lets talk about Crisp. As the name suggests, everything is extremely crispy, great for your own hot sauces or one of theirs. My favorite item on the menu has recently been added, the drumsticks. The dark meat is tender, the skin crunchy with every bite, and absolutely delicious with any of your favorite sauces. Go. Eat here. Enjoy.

Luckily, the specific day I went around lunch was not packed like all of the other reviews say. I ordered the half a chicken with Hot BBQ and Seoul Sassy sauce. Both were very flavorful and the wings were huge. I needed something to eat it with so I ordered a side of rice but they definitely loaded up one of the same bowls they use for the budda bowls with rice, so it was great they gave me so much. The only thing I will say is that I wish there was more meat itself on the chicken wings, and I wish they had a meal deal where it would come with a side and drink because I found the taste of the wings to be tiring just eating it by itself.

One of my favorite places in Chicago. The food is amazing, the restaurant ambiance is great, it's a great value, and it's BYOB. I could eat their Buddha bowls every day for the rest of my life.  My advice, order half of what you think you can eat. Every time we get food from here we ALWAYS order too much and leave being painfully full.

I miss Flingers wings downstate, and have been looking for good wings for a bit.  These are very good but remember that they are huge, and are served with a twist.  This is not your breaded deep-fried neon orange buffalo wings with blue cheese and celery--this is another step in Asian flavor influences and it's good. Bring Wet Wipes, you'll thank me later.

Great place for Korean Fried Chicken! I can't say I've tried much of their other items because when I come, I come for one thing. Their Korean Fried Chicken wings. The smallest order you can get is 5 wings. Doesn't sound like much but 1 of their wings includes the 3 sections drumlette, wing section, and the tip. More than enough to fill up for one meal or to get these to split with someone and add a side or two with it.  The skin is nice and crisp with a variety of korean sauces or more traditional american BBQ sauces to go with it. not a great place to come with a large group since the seating area is pretty small. This place is also BYOB and there's a liquor store down the street for those interesting in indulging!

Since I live in the hood I go here quite a bit. A friend turned me onto the place and it is very tasty. Been here probably about 10 times but only get the Big Boy Buddha since I figure why fix it if its not broken. Now it is kind of dumpy place, but the place is always packed.

My cousin said this was a must have when I went to visit him in Chicago. He kept talking about Korean Fried Chicken and I was like what? There's such a thing?  So we went, and OMG! MIND BLOWN! SOOOO Good. We got the crisp BBQ and the flavors were amazing. IT was so crispy. It was quite busy and everyone there is so friendly. You end up seating community style if you dine in. It's quite small. We ended up finding a spot right away. We got lucky?  But omg! It was so worth every bite. I definitely recommend it.
Always delicious food from here. I usually order for pick up or delivery since this place gets so crowded. But it's always great!

Visited this place for the first time today and will definitely be back. It's a Korean BBQ fried chicken place and my god it is delicious. The restaurant is cozy with seating for about 25-30 people. You place your order at the register and they call your name when your food is ready. The staff is friendly and there is a lot to choose from. We tried one of the bowls and the fried chicken and we were not disappointed!
Crisp is the kinda place that makes you want to get beaned with a 90 mph fastball so you can experience the food for the first time again

As a referral, Crisp was my choice for dinner on a cold Chicago night. I was so happy to have taken it. I got basic wings. No sides or dipping sauce. Just their famous house style wings. OMG to die for! Oh yeah, they also sell Fresca

A true Chicago gem. If someone asked me what my favorite spot for delicious but affordable food in the city would be, answer: Crisp. Crisp. Crisp! Every time. The Seoul Sassy sauce is ambrosia in liquid form. You could probably slather it on bird turds and achieve positive results, it's just that good. Luckily the chicken itself is also fantastic, served as wings, tenders, or on a delicious sandwich. Their fries are not my favorite, but the Atomic sauce more than makes up for it. Refer to my comment about the Sassy for possible applications of Atomic. The restaurant is small and cramped, but the abundant paper towels are convenient. I usually order ahead to go and the food is always ready by the quoted time (usually less than 15 minutes). I can't imagine the 2900 block of Broadway without Crisp.
Speedy service, easy ordering, and absolutely amazing! Couldn't be happier when I step in the restaurant.

CRISP is AMAZING!! I've basically had everything from the Seoul Steak Bowl, the wings, and even the tenders.  Most importantly: Crisp is consistent.  When you go on and on about Crisp to your friends or family, you don't have to worry about a disappointing visit.  If you haven't been there yet...put it on your list..NOW!

Mark Twain wrote, "When one has tasted it, he knows what the gods eat." Twain was not referring to Crisp, but he could have been.  Crisp makes the best chicken wings you'll ever eat. If you find a better place, let me know. I've been looking all over the USA for better wings and am always disappointed. I like for red Korean BBQ ones, but some others (erroneously) like the Seoul Sassy more.  Not sure how they get wings this big. I don't want to know, but I'm pretty sure these wings come from chickens on the Russian Olympic team, if you get my drift. Anyway, huge wings over at Crisp.  We always get the bibimbap too, not sure why. Maybe so I don't eat my weight in wings. Maybe to eat some vegetables. In Korea, bibimbap and wings may well be a rounded meal!

Not thrilled because the wings were dried. I ordered 5 wings with the sassy sauce cause that seems to be the highly popular kind. However, when I got my order it was dry out and wasn't tasty. Disappointed.

Omggggggggggggggggggg, had to write a review because my full belly told me so :) Came in on a Friday evening - Ordered for pick up and they said it'd be ready in 15min, stopped by and the food was ready for me.  A handful of people inside. After coming in once before (ordered the SEOUL SENSATION BURRITO, not yummy due to it being overstuffed with veggies making it taste like a salad burrito), I was unsure what to expect .... Ordered: SEOUL STEAK BOWL: Korean beef served over steamed white rice with green onions and a side of Alison's Atomic Sauce, added an egg. Sooooo good and sweet, the sauce was awesome almost like mayonaise/thousand island dressing. You know it's good when your co-workers walk past and comment: "yeah Crisp!" "where'd you get that?" "smells so gooood" The portion was actually too much for one sitting, looking forward to having it for breakfast ....... Total price a little over $11 without tip, sooooorry!

Literally EVERY TIME im in Lakeview I make it a priority to stop here because it is that good! Simply some of the best wings I have ever had and I am saying that knowing I've eaten at JJs fish and chicken which is very tough to compete with. It is a bit pricey BUT you get a great amount of wings which are HUGE! I always get the 5 traditional wings with seoul sauce and every single time they are good! Sometimes they give you an extra wing which I am more than okay with.  Seoul sassy is sweet and is unique. I cannot comment on the other sauces but I am certain they are great as well. Their boneless wings are great and pretty big as well. At any rate, you would think that 5 wings is nothing but I can assure you by the 4th wing (if you get the 5 piece traditional) that you will be full and only eating that 5th wing because it tastes so good.  The shop itself is medium sized but small given all the people that come in. You can almost gurantee you will not be getting a seat if you come at peak hours which are like 3/4 til close (I think 9pm). You are probably better off walking to Crisp as well since its Lakeview and parking is as scarce as a great white in lake michigan.....ignore that sad attempt for a joke and COME TO CRISP, you wont regret it!

I love this place!! but this review is different, this is because I actually ordered delivery from them. The service was quick and the food came just as I imagined. I ordered over $65 dollars worth of food. When you order a bimbibop, they even separate the rice from the veggies which its great because the veggies are cold and the rice is hot, overtime having them together can make the combo taste gross. They came within the time indicated and the food was just as good as it was if I ate it there. Best of all, no peanuts what so ever!! this is great because I have family who is deathly allergic and they do not even use peanut oil!
Wings are delicious and a must-try  y'all! Be prepared to stand and eat though or do take out as their space is very small and cramped.

Great buffalo chicken, and BBQ!! Very simple menu. This place works very well. Very busy when I went in around 2 pm on a Saturday, but I was able to get a seat immediately. Seating is family style, so there are 3 big tables, and you sit next to someone you might not know. I like the concept. Would def recommend this place to a friend

Mmmmm this place is the bomb for wings! I hate when the chicken skin is gooey or soft in places. Crisp cooks them just right so they are all crispy all over! Tried two different sauces and they were both tasty! I'll come back for another wing fix !
When they say chicken wings, they mean the whole chicken wing. Including the tip. So you actually get more than twice you think you're getting. Best asian style chicken wings I've had. No complaints.
Crappy website. After a good 15 min of making the order, their website tells me that they don't deliver to my website. So stupid

I was so excited for my friend to come visit so I can have a friend to eat some Korean Friend Chicken (KFC) with. When the time came, it was kind of a disappointment.  You order your food/drinks at the register and then cross your fingers that a seat opens up for your party. Generally, I usually like this type of set up, order, pay, sit down. But for this establishment, this place was way too small to not have the anxiety of getting a spot get to you.  Anyhow, I was disappointed when I was told that they're no longer doing the yelp deal (then why don't y'all take it off instead of giving people false hope) but they are doing a similar deal (exactly the same actually) but the deal was just like $3 more than the yelp deal. Go figure. Anyway, the chicken itself did not live up to the name as it wasn't really crispy. The sauces itself were good, though got tiring after a couple bites. All in all, you're not missing much if you don't stop by here.

Usually I wouldn't bother writing a review for someone with such a high rating and so many reviews already. But their wings are legit and i'de only put them equal but different than pok poks wings, but regardless of taste maybe a step above b/c it's more casual as a somewhere where you go to wings should be. Also got some chicken tenders b/c it was my first time but next time i'de go only wings .
Honestly one of the best chicken places in Chicago! The sauce, Seoul Sassy, is absolutely amazing and has a nice sweet and savory flavor.

First and foremost, this is NOT a Popeyes style chicken place. That being said, the chicken is pretty good. But order sauces or the chicken will taste extremely dry. Fries are out of this world, as are the burritos. Pretty cool atmosphere, I recommend eating in cause of the sauces that are offered on the table and cause they play cool music. Fun place to sit and eat and people watch. Relatively easy to park. Friendly and helpful staff. Prices are reasonable. My only qualm was the lack of actual fried chicken. But then again it is a Korean fried chicken place.

I like the atmosphere but the food just wasn't great. I had the Buddha bowl and it just didn't really have any flavor. The rice was clumpy and had clearly not been made recently. The sauces available on the tables just caused you mouth to burn no actually add flavor. I wanted to love it but was just left disappointed.

Look- I know your partner or friend or whoever mentioned this place and you were like "let me check Yelp first", hoping to dodge a bomb. This is all you need to know- this place is amazing, it's super tasty, the wings are killer and the bowls will give you life. If you eat inside it can be crowded- they have cafeteria seating. If you dislike this but ignore my statement- that's your fault- don't downgrade your stars.... just remember that the wings made your mouth orgasm and get over it. You're welcome.
My favorite wings in the city! The spicy flavor is super spicy and the wings are huge. Casual atmosphere and fairly priced.

The wings here are so good, I don't get wings anywhere else. The Seoul Sassy sauce is the way to go. Not feeling Korean fried chicken? Get one of their bowls. They all come with a ton of veggies and an egg on top.

Found my new place for wings. Their wings are whole (drumstick and drumette) and are large. I order the 5 piece in both Seoul sassy and crisp BBQ. I asked for the spicy BBQ and they do not mess around with spiciness. It was delicious but hot enough that I had to pause and let my mouth cool off between wings. I'd be afraid to try their hottest sauce! Delicious, crispy, tasty, and seeing as it's about $10 for a 5 whole wings which would count as 10 wings at most places, you're getting 50 cent wings! Friendly staff and my pickup order was ready super fast. Looking forward to trying out their other flavors and bowls.

WOW. Would have never expected chicken wings could be this good. Come with your appetite because these will FILL YOU UP. Definitely check out the sassy sauce and the bbq... both are great... and top them with the creamy orange ones from the table. YUM. Will dream about these wings.

I cannot even complain!!! The only thing they don't have is alcohol:/ however, the wings are sooooo amazing!!! We got the BBQ ones and licked the sauce off our fingers, lol. Definitely recommend(:  10 wings are good enough for two people.  Promise they will fill you up!

I freaking love this place. Love. It is insanely good. We had a basket of tenders with all the sauces, and some additional bone-in wings and they were literally and figuratively the best I've ever had. Hot, spicy, crispy perfection of chicken, bone or no. The sauces were amazingly rich and flavorful, with the right combination of Korean marinades and fire to liven things up. Honestly, I am always a little hesitant to try these (sort of) modernist takes on Korean food. Like bulgogi tacos or kim chi fries or Korean bbq burgers (and wings are a relatively new phenomena, by the way). But of the places I've tried, I've been blown away by the sheer deliciousness of the flavor combos. Crisp is no exception and they truly excel at making excellent wings. In addition, we got Baby Buddha bowl and I was very very impressed by the authenticity of the flavors and setup. And the gochujang is spot-on in its flavors too. I can't say enough about how good Crisp is. Five stars plus.
seriously. so good. get the seoul sassy flavored wings they will seriously change your life. i wish they had a crisp in la, i would be there all the time. what're you waiting for, go go go.

One mile from Wrigley Field in Chicago's Lake View community you will find Crisp. My father and I headed to Chicago seven hours before my flight back to Houston to ensure I had time to get popcorn from Garrett's and go to Crisp.  Their whole wings were amazing, big and crispy! To my surprise my dad even liked them, which is very rare and made the trip worth it. He decided to dip a few wings in their Bud's Buffalo Suicide sauce which was flavorful and he started sweating immediately. My favorite thing besides the wings were their unique Korean Mom recommended sauces. If you've never tried Korean Fried Chicken, Crisp is the place to go!   Also, if you're like me you automatically think about how many calories you're consuming every time you eat fried chicken and look for something to make you feel better. Well I found the "something" at Crisp, their chicken is cooked in zero trans-fat oil and is hormone free. I may fly to Chicago instead of Milwaukee more often just to make sure I can stop by Crisp before heading to Wisconsin!
Yum! This place is great! The only problem is the seating isn't always enough, but that's just really more of a testament to Crisp's excellent food than anything.

Came here and got the Buddha bowl and chicken bowl... big mistake --- very bland, looked unappetizing and there were only a few sauce choices. Probably ate 1/3 of it but the saving grace here was the hip hop they played in the background. HOWEVER, we didn't realize the popularity of this place came from the wings so we plan to return to try those!
Awesome place. Awesome food. Great spot.  Would highly recommend. Bring your appetite because portions are huge.

Don't expect tiny wings because these are huge! One wing is basically the wing and the drumstick or thigh.  For wings, there are four choice for sauces but the only two that matters are the first two which is the Seoul Sassy and the Crisp BBQ. The Seoul Sassy is a non-spicy soy garlic sauce that tastes like a sweet honey glaze. Even though it is technically non-spicy, there is still a little kick to it which might be coming from the ginger. This is typically my favorite flavor at any Korean chicken restaurant. It's less saucy but mildly addicting. The Crisp BBQ is a sweet and spicy sauce that tastes like gochujang (red pepper paste). This one is definitely saucier and you might have extra spicy sauce at the bottom of your plate if you feel like dipping your fries into it. Speaking of fries, I love their Atomic Sauce which tastes similar to a thousand island dressing mixed with sriracha mayo.  Everything was super delicious but it can get quite messy eating especially since the Crisp BBQ leaves the sauce sticking all over your fingers. They have paper towel rolls on the table to wipe down your hands and they also gave some moist towelette wipes. There are two single bathrooms in the back to help aid in the washing hands department. Water is self-served and you get it from the water dispenser by the counter. Fun fact: they have bendy straws! The place is quite small and there are only about 3-4 bench tables as well as seating against the counter wall. You order up at the front and then grab a seat wherever you can. Most likely you will be sharing your table with other customers. Even though it was snowing outside, Crisp is quite popular and there were a lot of people coming in for both take-out and sit down.

From start to finish you'll be in . Kick off your meal with some in bone wings va the boneless wings because let's be honest boneless wings are just adult chicken tenders.  You just need the 6 piece  After the wings, move straight into the Buddha bowl. Size of the bowl depends on if you're eating with someone else.
I can write a huge essay about Crisp, but I will not, instead, I'll be upfront with you and keep it simple. This place is basically right next door to heaven for the chicken wing lover.

Hey ! I have nothing special to say about this place just stop by to have a quick beer and relax a bit after a long day drive . I have got to go Upstairs to find a confortable sit at the bar cuz too full in the main room . The lady who took care of me was very nice and hot ! The beer I had tonight I never drunk it before so it was very exciting to me trying some different taste . I usually drink Heineken ( were not available) . Overall , great service for my first time In and I will definitely come back soon for more !

5 stars for making everything up big time after a rough take-out experience. I was in town visiting the BF from Florida for a weekend & was too scared to venture out in the frigid cold for a night, so he suggested staying in & ordering Crisp. He raved about the wings so we got an order of those along with the Seoul Steak Bowl. Mind you, it was a Friday night on one of the first very cold nights of the year, so their phones must have been going crazy. They first quoted us about 45 minutes. After an hour went by, we knew something was up. We tried calling back to see if our delivery was on the way yet, but couldn't even get through after multiple tries.  After 2 hours and severely rumbling tummies, we were ready to cancel the order and order from elsewhere. Our call actually goes through the minute we decided to cancel the order. Crisp immediately apologized & decided to make our order free-of-charge & deliver it immediately! We finally got our food about 15-20 minutes after that call. I have to say the 2 hour wait was worth it for how absolutely delicious everything was. My Seoul Steak Bowl was dripping with sauce & I never wanted it to end. As for the wings, they were hands down the best Asian-style fried chicken wings I've ever had!  Amazing food + amazing customer service = me requesting to eat Crisp wings every time I'm visiting Chicago.

Had an opportunity to have the wings with SS sauce. It's been about a year since the last time. Seems to have changed a little. Chicken wasn't as crispy and although the sauce tasted as yummy as ever, it was a lot less of it. Definitely a fan and will try again soon.

I was visiting from Los Angeles this past weekend and had the pleasure of finding this spot. Hands down the best wings I've ever had. Beats any place I've had in LA. I will always make sure I come here when I visit Chicago again. 5 stars doesn't give this place the recognition it deserves. 10 stars for sure

Ordered the drumsticks with Seoul Sassy and the Little Buddha bowl.  Enjoyed the flavor of the drumsticks...after I pulled off the outer layer, which was overcooked and extremely tough.  Buddha bowl was extremely delicious...will definitely be going back on my next trip to Chicago for the Buddha bowl, at least...
This is probably the best fry chicken that I had. Simply amazing. Their sauce is fantastic.

I came here a bit skeptical even with the sheer volume and positive reviews on yelp because Korean style chicken wings are my thing. I like to say that I am a Korean chicken wing connoisseur since I've tried them everywhere in the US and in Korea.  It was a little slower on a late weeknight so we were able to find seating easily on the benches they have inside. The wings were HUGE. I am glad that we ordered 10 piece wings with two flavors (crispy bbq & soul sassy) because it was filling. We also ordered a side of kimchi and I was surprised with how big of a container that we got. My really like the crispy bbq because the chicken was moist and was a little easier to eat and not as messy. The soul sassy was my favorite and I love that it had a little spice and a nice kick to the sauce and it was messy to eat which I LOVED.  We also ordered a side of fried mushrooms which were tasty! I highly recommend to place because it is affordable, the quantity and size of the wings are great and it's a fun finger lickin good time! I'll be back again this weekend!

Came here after exploring Lincoln Park. I was excited to try this place after seeing all the great reviews of the place.  LOCATION: The place is quite small. There are about 2 long tables and some lining the wall with stools.  FOOD: My BF and I split an order of 10 wings - half plain jane and half crisp BBQ. We split an order of 10 since we thought that they would be the small typical wings you would get at wingstop, but were we wrong. The wings were HUGE! So basically instead of 10 we got 20 so we ended up having a lot leftover.  They were perfectly fried and completely covered with sauce but not to the point that it made the wings soggy. I preferred the plain jane wings since I thought the BBQ flavor had a weird aftertaste. However, my BF preferred the BBQ over the plain wings.

Best wings in the city and very fast delivery service. Eating in can be a bit stressful and suffocated because it's very small. Lots of time I felt like I had to eat a little faster because it was pack and so many people waiting. I call for delivery now because it's fast and I can relax more. All wing flavors are super delicious. I tried the rice bowls many time but still not a fan.
Everything is amazing! A must have for yhe best chicken EVER! I would drive 100 miles for this place. Can't believe it hasn't been on tv yet! This place should br on Diners Drive-ins and dives.
Mehh. Aesthetically pleasing but the veggies were cold and it was pretty flavorless. Wouldn't get again. Chicken sandwiches and wings looked good!!

Absolutely amazing chicken! It was my first time here and I thought it was fabulous :) I had the sweet and sassy sauce and it was just as wonderful as I anticipated :) It was so packed but obviously it's a neighborhood favorite :)

I had the chicken bowl and had heard great things about it, however I was not impressed. It did not have much flavor and we were only able to choose from two sauces. The size of the sauces were not nearly enough to add flavor to the whole bowl. One thing I do want to give them credit for is that they do not mess around when it comes to chicken wings. The size of these here were massive, probably the biggest chicken wings I have ever seen!

Was hesitant at first; the price is pretty high for fried chicken. But damn, this is good stuff. Absolutely recommended, get a couple different sauces and 12 tenders. Most all of the sides are solid too.

After reading so many positive reviews, I was excited to finally try Crisp. We came during dinner time on a Saturday and were lucky to snag a table. Another group decided to join us (shared seating) so it was a bit snug. The establishment is a tad small and it was awkward to have people hovering over our shoulders and watching us like hawks while we gobbled down our food. The Seoul Sassy wings are definitely the best. I was not a fan of the buffalo wings...they were way too sour and vinegary in my opinion. We were ambitious and ordered 40 wings to split amongst 4 people and there were still many leftover (the wings are big). If it wasn't for the atmosphere, I would have rated Crisp higher.

I owed my friend "all you can eat" wings for a lost bet. He got to choose the spot, and he chose to go here. It was my first time, but definitely not my last. The guys at the register taking orders were cool. It was busy on a Tues night around 7pm, but I was able to place my order and my food came out in timely manner. I got 20 wings (full wings so really 40 wings if we are counting like most places do) and an order of onion rings. It was all delicious. Nothing special about the onion rings, but really, I cant ever remember eating special onion rings before. The chicken wings were amazing. I love chicken wings. I eat chicken wings multiple times a week. I've had them everywhere. These are some of the best wings I've ever had, and the two sauces I tried (Seoul sassy and Crisp bbq) were excellent. Above all, these wings were something new and different from the thousands of wings I have eaten before. My only personal negative about these wings is they are breaded. I eat a ton of wings because I tend to keep my carb intake to a minimum, but these wings are definitely worth indulging every once in a while.  Seating is limited!

Food was good but definitely not a 4.5 star level. Tried the seoul sassy and bbq flavors. Both tasted overly sweet and not my favorite type. The beef bowl was no surprise either. One thing to note: be prepared to share table with parties if you wanna dine in during peak hours. Don't come here if you feel uncomfortable doing so, otherwise this is a good Korean comfort food place.

The chicken strips were beyond amazing, I had the crisp BBQ sauce which had a sneaky little kick to them. The guy at the counter was pleasant and the good came out pretty quickly. My only complaint were the O Rings which were sparse to say the least. $5.95 for 5 rings effectively. Cmon fellas don't be assholian about the portion size.
Wings all the way! Always friendly service. Seating is a little tight but everyone is having a blast chowing down.

Holy smokes. The wings at Crisp are arguably the best in the city. They are whole wings which normally I don't like but I overlook that to eat Crisp. They are juicy and the sauce options are fantastic. You can't go wrong no matter what you choose. I've never dined in here- the space is small and the place is packed. I also highly recommend the onion rings. The only complaints I have are that 1- I don't live closer and 2- Crisp isn't on every delivery service.

If my rating was based solely on the Korean chicken wings, it would be 4 stars. However, I also got the chicken burrito which was underwhelming to say the least and only redeemed by the liberal application of the delicious mayo-like "atomic sauce."  My boyfriend and I split an order of 5 wings which really is more like 10 traditional American wings because each wing has both the flat and drumstick parts (which are separated in American wings). With 5 wings you can get two sauces. We got the ones the cashier suggested- barbecue and "sassy"- and both were delicious. I think I liked the barbecue a little better but honestly it was hard to choose.  If I return, I will just get the wings and nothing else- because it was more food than we were expecting and I found the burrito underwhelming, I only at half of it. I didn't even take the other half to go, knowing I wouldn't probably eat it.

I'm still going to give you a high rating, Crisp.  BUT when I ordered a Big Boy Buddha Bowl and it came without the gochujang sauce, my heart just sank.  It's like ordering fried rice without soy sauce!   I'm butchering the bowl with what I have in my fridge; sriracha and hoisin sauce.  It's not the same, but it will do.
this place has the best wings in town!!! must try!! must visit. not hard to find. location is awesome. food is amazing. price is ok. ambience is legit!

When I'm craving bulgogi, I come here since it's right next to my apartment. The Seoul Streak Bowl is good, but I'm not a fan of the sticky rice which always make me feel sick afterwards. I feel like it would taste better if it was hard rice (like the type that's in Chipotle). The bulgogi and the sauce that comes with it are good and the bowl is a pretty decent size.  The wings here are phenomenal. Usually 5 wings feed 1 person (honestly, I get full after eating 3) so when I come here with my boyfriend, we order 10 wings - 5 Crisp BBQ and 5 Seoul Sassy or 10 Seoul Sassy. We love the Seoul Sassy more than Crisp BBQ, but both are good. Getting a combination of the two is ideal because the Crisp BBQ is on the spicy side for taste (I am very spice intolerant) while the Seoul Sassy is a little more on the mild/tame side for taste. The drumsticks are decent (they come in 4 or 8), but the wings DEFINITELY taste better! The O-Rings are also aaamazing..especially the dipping sauce it comes with. I usually order to-go because this place is more on the smaller side and it's usually crowded.

This was by far the most disappointing off my list of foodie adventures for my first Chicago trip. Not sure if this place was just overhyped, but I've definitely had better Korean fried chicken else where. The prices are pretty good and the chicken was alright. We order 15 pieces and the Buddha bowl. Very underwhelmed by the Buddha bowl - the entire thing was cold and the veggies were underseasoned. I'm sure that they meant to make it as a cold dish, but it would have been better warmed. We ordered 5 each of the Seoul Sassy, Bud's Buffalo, & Crisp Bbq. My fave here was the soy garlic - good combination of sweet and salty. The other two were just alright. The crispy layer was very nice. It was crunchy but not overly battered.  This place is very small so either come in off peak hours or expect to take it to go. My group got lucky and we ended up sharing a table with another couple. Overall the food here is alright.

Every, every, every time I eat here, they're packed.  And that's a good thing because their food is great.  This place has a million other reviews, so I'm not going to write too much.  Suffice to say I like Crisp a lot, especially the Baby Buddha Bowl.  Introverts beware: this is all communal table seating, so this isn't a first date place nor a place to have a private conversation.

We live pretty close-by so w gave it a try a few times. The wait was always long - at least 30min if you go during busy time. I didn't really get the hype - the chicken is really dry and overly salty. Bibimbap is meh and too Americanized (not served on a hot stone bowl, to my memory). Overall there is really nothing that special. If you like Korean style fried chicken you try the one at H Mart in Niles.

Horrendous service. I ordered food for dine-in and I saw at least 3 dozen people order after me and get their food before me. Not to mention all the orders that left for delivery before mine. I ordered the Not So Common Crisp Sandwich and it was soggy. The chicken was tasty but the bread was way too watery and their sauce had virtually no taste. Not a fan. Definitely won't be back.
Crisp has the best chicken I have ever had! It is always busying so I recommend calling ahead for pick up. It's a must try!!
The chicken wings and the Buddha bowls are amazing. The only thing I dislike is the cleanliness of the dine-in section.

Normally one of my favorite restaurants in the city, I ordered a bowl while my friends ordered wings. I saw my bowl sit under a heating lamp for 25 minutes. Shockingly, my bowl showed up cold. Bad form, Cri

This place could be a solid 5 star food joint. If you're a foodie & in the area, you MUST try this place. The only downfall is space is VERY limited, but if you're ordering to-go, it's easier. We ordered the Seoul sassy & BBQ tenders, Seoul sassy chicken wings and chicken & beef burritos. The burritos were just ok. Waaaay too much rice and not enough flavor. It was really good when I added the BBQ sauce and removed most of the rice. The BBQ tenders were my favorite. I think I was just in love with the BBQ sauce because everything I added it to, I fell in love with it. The Seoul sassy wasn't as bold, but it was good.

Came here for the wings after reading good reviews and being a huge fan of friend wings. I got to try both their buffalo spicy regular wings and their Seoul sassy which is a mix of soy sauce based. The wings came in pretty big portion. The Seoul tasted very bland and I had to dip them in the atomic sauce they had on the tables to enjoy them. The Buffalo was much tastier. I got their 2nd level which is called spicy...it was mild I would say. Their next level is called suicide but maybe you should get that if you want real spicy. There is also one level of crispness to the wings. Overall they were good not amazing, they felt different from other korean wings I had prior. The place is small, they have a couple of large shared tables and some seating by Windows. The staff was friendly.

I LOVE THIS PLACE. They have single-handedly changed my craving for hot wings into a craving for korean hot wings. The sauces are so good and the wings always crisp.  I like the cummunal tables though I usually take-out. I unfortunately havent tried their bibimbap, but will have to soon!

Love my wings and these semi sticky unbreaded whole wings...and now drumstick options...are well worth it. If you like wings, then you need to try these. Its still a battle between Crisp and Great Seas for best wings on the Northside.... In terms of seating, there are no reservations, just a line that moves quick, so it might make sense to secure yourself a place to sit before you order. Food takes about 10 mins to be ready

Get traditional wings over boneless, because they are so good, especially the "Seoul Sassy". French Fried are a good addition, otherwise sharing a "Baby Buddha" is a good option too! The Seoul Steak Bowl is huge & delicious. Great spot for something quick!

Stumbled across this place today, and I'm so happy I did! I got the chicken bowl, and originally thought it looked a bit bland, but I was definitely wrong! The seasoning on the bowl was sweet and flavorful, and there was plenty to save for leftovers. You absolutely need to have Allison's Atomic Sauce on it, it's the perfect kick that pairs well with the bowl seasoning. A great carry-out spot that I'll be frequenting a lot more often

I got the baby buddha bowl with beef. It was good, but not great. I feel like this is a place that relies upon their large portions, cheap prices, and easy going vibe to make up for their relatively tame flavors. I'd go back to try something else (maybe their sandwiches are good?), but I'm a little skeptical as to whether I'd walk away from that experience as a Crisp fan.  Also, yes, per other comments: the restaurant is small and loud, and you will most likely be eating at a table with strangers (I like this vibe, but I know some folks don't).
Crisp is definitely my fav!!! Have had no chicken ever like theirs!! And i love how they bring your food to you. Crisp is super COOL!!!

I tried this place with a friend after hearing good things about it on Yelp, and we were not disappointed! We split an order of 10 wings and a small Buddha bowl, plenty for two people. The bowl was large enough and had enough veggies to make us feel like our meal was not just protein. They recommend 5 wings per person and that felt like a lot (depends on how much you eat I guess). We got half sassy Seoul sauce and half crisp BBQ. The sassy Seoul was sweet and more liquidy but still delicious. I would really recommend the crisp BBQ though because it was a little thicker and stuck to the wings better, so more flavor. Asked my friend and we both agreed--would definitely come back. Only down side is that there's limited seating, so it may be tough to accommodate a large group during busy hours. It seems pretty popular for delivery though since we saw at least 5 different batches of delivery go out while we were eating

YAS finally- the KFC I was looking for! Crisp even though drenched in sauce, the chicken is the closest I've gotten to the type of sauce I fell in love with when I visited Korea. They had delicious yangnyeom [Crisp BBQ] (which is a gochujang-based sauce that is sweet, salty and spicy). Best of all, the chicken pieces are HUGE. I also got the bibimbap (Baby Buddha - 4 veggies) which was similarly HUGE. I was only visiting Chicago for a bit, but I'm glad I made it out to this area just for Crisp!

This place was on my list of must-dos upon visiting Chicago after six years.  Still the same awesomeness.  The portions are large and tasty.  I still love the Seoul Sassy sauce.  Each chicken wing includes both the thigh and the wing, so compared to other wing joints you are getting double portions.  We ordered a ten piece for our family of four which was essentially a twenty-piece.  Fried perfectly so it's crispy on the outside and juicy on the inside.  The Seoul Steak bowl was on point as well.  It was essentially boolgogi on top of rice that was marinated well without being too salty.  It reminded me of just how my mom used to make it.  The thing that I found the most interesting is that after six years, many attempts to copy Crisp's concept have popped up around Chicago.  We tried a few of those places but in my mind they fell short.  In my recollection Crisp was the first of it's kind in Chicago.  Perhaps this is why I had the best experience here, or maybe they are just that good.  At any rate, I think this place definitely is worth a try.  BTW don't be surprised by it's community style seating and slightly divey look.  I could say more, but suffice it to say I will be back whenever I visit Chicago.
This doesn't compare to the Korean fried chicken you can get in NYC, but it's about the best Chicago has to offer. Counter service, communal tables, no frills.
Yum! I don't have much new to add than what people have already said- but it's delicious! You gotta get the bbq wings and Seoul sassy wings mix!

Been here a couple times. LOVE the Seoul Steak Bowl, especially with the Atomic sauce. I need to buy a bottle of that stuff next time I go, because it's addicting.  I decided to try the wings last time. I've constantly seen it as the Best Wings in Chicago, so I was pretty hyped up. Slightly underwhelmed, sadly: the wings lacked a lot of flavor. The chicken was cooked very well, but some bites were indistinguishable from plain fried chicken. Maybe I should have gone for the Atomic there as well. Great place.
Best chicken tenders ever. The perfect amount of spicy, and always cooked to perfection. I don't really like chicken wings myself, but my family devours the ones from Crisp like there's no tomorrow.

I did not want to go here. I wanted a Portillos hot dog. But boy, was I glad I had FOMO and went with my friends instead. We went to TOWN with baskets of wings, fries, and seoul steak bowls (granted, there were 15 of us). As much as I wanted non Asian food that day, I am glad to have tasted the deliciousness that was seoul sassy wings. Perfectly *crisp* (had to) and sauced. Steak bowls were also very flavorful. Worth making the trip out of the city.
Not much to be said. Souel sassy is excellent. Love the wings and the bites. Can't wait to return again.
Great flavors, but the bowls seem more rice than veg. Still, probably the only way a bibimbap is so inexpensive! Everything also appeared quite fresh.

Coming from a Korean who lived in Korea who loves Korean chicken wings, in the popular and standard way that they enjoy it there... Crisp fell pretty short for me, unfortunately. The chicken quality itself is great. Meaty, not dry, standard for what should be good. HUGE pieces. But the breading and coating were quick to get soggy. Breading was thin, no body. The sauces were also pretty thin, albeit still sticky; the soy based sauce was way better than the spicy (and that in itself is just... wrong). What should be the star, the sweet spicy sauce was way too heavy on the gochujang flavor-- just too much straight up gochujang, that really strong earthy flavor was too prominent. I could almost taste the clay pot. That sauce needs to be tempered with more garlic and sweetness to balance it out. On top of the chicken falling flat... they don't serve white radish?! What? That's like a staple, all you want while you're eating delicious sticky crunchy chicken is that crisp, sweet and tart, acidic white radish to cut the fatty and then make fried chicken sex in your mouth. Seriously, it was so sad, I got zero of any of this. I saw that they offered korean banchan but for $6 on the side, and uhhhh, no. We got the fried magic mushrooms instead and there was nothing magical about them, just your standard fried button mushrooms. Decent, nothing special, they don't give you any special magical sauces with it either, which I think would kick it up a notch, so we used the sauce that was on the table. The service was great though, the guy at the counter was very helpful and friendly. He even suggested I order my carry out order later as to prevent longer sogginess of the chicken (I understood very quickly what he meant after I started eating my made-to-order there, and decided against ordering any more to take home to my parents bc I knew they wouldn't enjoy it either). So... I'm a little surprised their name is Crisp bc I was lacking way too much of that at my first (and prob last) experience there. Still on the hunt for that bangin Korean fried chicken and beer (WITH RADISH!!!).

Fantastic wings. Still not as good as the wings I had in Korea, but beggars can't be choosers. Prices are a little high for wings, but there's little competition. I'd recommend the spicy wings. They're more of a sweet and spicy... Really mild.
Love love their wings!!!!! Delicious place never had it before. Their is other dishes you can order but I think the wings is a must to order.

The wings were great, and the bowls were good as well. I will be coming back for more food. However, the people behind the counter forgot about us, and it was only after we saw other people who came in after us get their food, and we went up to ask, that they discovered the food was just sitting there. Apart from that, the food was tasty and everyone was quite nice.

I don't get what all the hype is about. The wings are good and the sauces are tasty. The wings aren't different from any sports bar that sells decent deep fried wings. However, what turned me off was the feathers on the wings. Seriously gross.
Huge and delicious wings! The Buddha bowl is to die for! Tons of veggies with lots of flavor! Its always crowded but its worth the wait! Staff was friendly just great!
Best tasting chicken wings, ever!!!  Both the Seoul Sassy & the Crisp BBQ were outstanding.  Very small restaurant. Actually walked passed it and had to backtrack a block.
ATOMIC SAUCE ALL THE THINGS. Seoul sassy tenders are also amazing and their bowls are to die for. GO THERE NOW.
While the space is small, the flavor is huge. You might have to sit with some people you don't know, but it's a fun, bright, clean place, will definitely go again!

Crisp is tucked away in the bustling DePaul area, but it is definitely not one to be underestimated: The place was packed when I came in for dinner. I know they're known for their fried chicken (odd. But I'll go with it) and I decided to go with the strips since I'm more of a boneless fan. They have a lot of different sauce options, from plain (although I'm sure it's anything but) to super spicy. I went with the Crisp BBQ, which is described as their Korean BBQ sauce with a kick. I only had to wait 5 minutes for my order of fries, and there were a ton! I actually wasn't able to finish all my food I was so full.  The chicken strips were good, but be warned, the BBQ really does have a kick to it! I'm not super into spice, but a little is nice, and this sauce was right on the border between too much and just enough for me. The chicken was cooked great, although mine seemed to have a lot of breading on it. But it was a good meal and the service was great. Just get there early to grab a seat!
This place is so amazing. Even if I moved out of Chicago, I'd visit Chicago just to eat at this place

One of my top places to get wings in the city. That sassy sauce is the absolute truth! I'll put that on a slice of bread and eat it like it was filet mignon. The wings are large and they are, like the name, perfectly crisp. I've had wings from Daks, which are delicious as well, but Crisp gets my vote.

Tell me a better spot to get wings in Chicago. Don't worry, I'll wait . The wings are awesome but the fries are basic and over priced. The service was phenomenal . This is my spot! Thanks guys. Keep up the great work!

Highly recommend!  These aren't your typical wings but in the best way! Try the seoul sassy for a delicious flavor. My boyfriend and I shared 5 wings ( they gave us 6!  ) and the steak baby buddha bowl. Don't be discouraged at the price for 5 wings til you see the size. We left stuffed and with some of the bowl left to share for lunch the next day! ( I say share because we both were dying for more! ) We will definitely be back for more & to try more of the menu!

These wings are  bomb.com . We ordered the Seoul Sassy and the BBQ flavors and loved both. The Seoul Sassy reminded me a lot of San Tung's wings in San Francisco, except the portion is bigger and it is a little less crispy. In this case, you won't need to ask for flats or drumsticks because you get both per wing! This venue is a small spot, so it may be hard to find a seat at times. Their sauces also compliment the wings well along with rice. The workers are so friendly here too!
i'm korean! it is not korean chicken but it is in really good sauce. i visit here couple times a month for wings. bibimbap is decent.

You need to come here! It is so SO good... I want to bathe myself in the Seoul sassy sauce. Even if there wasn't sauce on it the chicken is so delicious and juicy you really must just come here and try it for yourself!

Awesome Korean wings!! And mind you it's the whole wing, when you order...my husband and I ordered 10 wings and a bowl of bibimbap. We're from the south, so we're used to just either the drumstick or the actual wing part...not altogether! That was too much food. We hardly touched our bowl of rice and veggies.  We got half and half of the top 2 popular sauces (forgot the name). They were both awesome! I was licking my fingers for sure. the bibimbap was ok, nothing extraordinary. But the wings though were so full of flavor with each bite and they were crispy for sure. It was tender and moist, and not too dry.  Seating can be limited though. There was bar seating available and a couple of long picnic tables. Hope you're ok with sharing a table with other people.  You order first and then you get a number where they come to you with your food.  Will definitely recommend these awesome chicken wings to friends back home. Thank you YELP community again for an amazing food experience for my hubby as well as my tummy.

Best Korean chicken wings in my opinion. Idk if I'm missing out elsewhere because this is the only place I go for korean chicken. The fact that it's close to Molly's cupcakes makes it ten times better. Hellllllooooooo
This place was super .  I got the Big Buddha.  There's tons of veggies and the chicken was well seasoned.  The red sauce has addictive qualities.

We got here right before they opened so we were second in line. Glad we got there early because it got crowded FAST on Sunday. Our group shared a combo of Seoul Sassy and BBQ wings and a steak bowl. Everything was pretty good, although I think the hype created a small sense of disappointment. The Seoul Sassy didn't quite have enough flavor and wasn't super crispy. I think the BBQ ones were slightly better since they had more flavor. Favorite part of the meal was the Atomic Sauce. It tasted so familiar, but I couldn't tell what was in it. I guess it will remain a delicious mystery!
Love the chicken bowls!  Not a lot of room to eat-in, but I just bring it home.

If Crisp delivered to my address, it would be dangerous.  This is the best chicken in the city.  My go-to is a whole Seoul Sassy chicken, with a split of Sassy/BBQ tenders for my wife.  It's likely the most delicious chicken I've ever had, and I eat a lot of chicken.  The bowls are also very good. Tip:  Pre-order your meal and park for a minute with flashers to run in and pick it up.  The inside is super small and unless you're not there at a meal time, you'll have trouble grabbing more than a couple seats.

Just like the name, their wings are perfectly crispy. You can hear the crunch when you bite into the wings. Soooo good! They come in many delicious flavor. And I loveeee ordering the Bibimbop here. Healthy veggies with rice bowls. I always Ask them to add the beef in with the bowls. Cuz I love my meat lol

This place CANNOT BE MISSED. Don't let the communal tables and small interior fool you, this place is the diamond standard for wings in the city! Seoul Sassy is my flavor of choice, I can't speak of the rest. I find myself dreaming and craving these wings like a crack addict. I'm leary of even leaving a review to make the place busier than it already is, but I'd love for them to open other locations.

I wanted to try out a new wing place with my girlfriend and came across this place.  I usually don't mind traveling a bit; however, she does.  After about an hour and half, we finally arrived at Crisp...both very hungry (maybe a little grumpy).  We ordered 10 wings, spicy, as well as a baby Buddha.  It was worth the ride! The wings are actually the entire wing!!  There is not a single piece I don't enjoy eating (unlike the drumsticks elsewhere).  For me, wings cannot get any better.  The baby buddha was great too!  lots of veggies and rice with a  delicious fried egg.   Ever since then, I have gone there a few times and have brought new people with me as well as recommend it to others.  I would travel an hour and a half any day for these wings!

This place is really great! Fast and friendly service, large portions, and delicious food - just don't expect it to be very authentic. I ordered the Seoul Sassy with five wings and the vegetable plate, which turned out to be around $15. I also tried the Crisp BBQ wings. The flavors were strkng, the meat was tender, and the skin was crispy without being soaked by the sauce. The vegetable plate was okay, nothing special, not very flavorful but well cooked. Also the portions were quite large - took me two sittings to finish the wings. Order the Crisp BBQ wings if you enjoy spicy food! The spice isn't uncomfortably strong but the flavors are much bolder. Also, the shop is quite small so expect communal sitting!

The wings here are pretty good- the house sauce is spicy but the good kind of spicy- but it's not as authentic as I thought it was going to be so I was a little disappointed. Also they were really hard to eat because the tables were kind of awkward and limited so eating in can get weird since you kind of are expected to share a table with strangers. Honestly, I think the wings are Del Seoul are better! However, the sandwiches here come with a piece of their fried chicken smothered in their sauces and was delicious!  They didn't have whole chicken the night I came and I would go back again to try the whole chicken!

If I wasn't already just two blocks from Crisp, I would move to be closer to Crisp.  Absolutely incredible fried chicken in all its forms, amazing take on Korean fusion food. I would definitely come back enough to try everything on their menu - it's a small but great selection.  They get through their line really quickly, even with how busy they often are, and the food is amazing. I've actually started getting mason jars of their signature sauce, Allisons Atomic, to take home.  Communal tables are fun to eat at with a group as well, you'll just want to either wait or come at off times to sit together.

Ordered takeout, the wings were a full three piece wing! They were cooked alright and tasted ok but I like them a little more flavorful. Ordered Seoul sassy wings and BBQ, maybe they needed to apply it a little thicker.

Buffalo wings are huge and amazing! Guaranteed recommended spot to go try out new wings if you're a wings person like myself. Travis the cashier is awesome and can help you out with anything you need. Overall this place will not disappoint you!
Such good chicken that's cooked to perfection. The crisp bbq sauce was also fantastic
Well... Crisp was alright. Not out-of-this-world amazing like everyone else claims it to be. Yes, the fried chicken was enjoyable. But I've had much better and with plenty of seating as well.

We came here mainly because the first place we went to was suffering a power outage so maybe we weren't seeing them at their best with the surge of people who couldn't go to the restaurants nearby because of the outage.  It was a long wait, it was hot, cramped and uncomfortable. Looked kind of dingy on the inside and all could have been forgiven for some good food but my chicken sandwich was just okay, nothing special. The wings were flavored well but the pieces were small and when I order twenty wings I expect twenty pieces of chicken, not ten pieces of connected drumstick/wings. Highly disappointed.

The food is definitely worth your time, finding a place to sit is not. If going here, I suggest ordering to go and eating at home. I love this chicken, I usually get the chicken tenders with the crisp bbq sauce. They let you pick if you want 3, 6, or 9 pieces. But honestly they give you more than that. I always have left overs which still taste great the next day. The only downside is that when I'm in the mood to sit down and eat out, I do not think of Crisp. I understand their space is small, but the picnic style tables are not the greatest. It's always hard to find seating when I've gone. That's actually the only thing that has stopped me from going the past couple months. I like sitting down outside of my apartment and enjoying a meal, but it's hard to do that when there is nowhere to sit.      That being said, the food is really great and if you love chicken you need to try Crisp.

The bird is the word! declares the awning of Crisp, your new go-to place for Korean fried chicken. One of the most memorable meals I've had near Belmont was the Korean fried chicken from Crisp. Only a 10-minute walk from the Belmont Red Line stop, Crisp is ideal for Korean fusion, whether that's the Korean-Southern fried chicken I had or one of their Korean-Mexican burritos, which all sound daaaank. On a Sunday afternoon, Maddy, Jeremy and I were having trouble finding seats, but the employees were genuine and courteous about helping us find somewhere to sit. They even gave me a free carton of sauce at the end of the meal, when I went back up to the counter to inquire about their miraculous Seoul Sassy sauce (more on that later). Maddy, Jeremy and I split a $16 whole Korean fried chicken, sitting in silence as we ravenously ate our meal. The whole bird was cleaved into pieces small enough to handle without me looking like a complete savage, piled on top of each other in a plastic basket. The chicken was fried to near perfection, gloriously crispy and well-coated in the Seoul Sassy sauce, made with the perfect balance of soy sauce, ginger and garlic. ASIDE: People seem to have mixed opinions about Crisp, comparing the restaurant's fried chicken to that of Dak, which I reviewed a few months ago. I've had both, and here's my verdict: Dak wins over Crisp for the texture and consistency of the fried chicken. Crisp's has repeatedly been a bit overcooked, resulting in a drier food product. However, Crisp is still absolutely worth going to because that Seoul Sassy sauce is BOMB. The flavor is 100% there, the perfect balance of sweet and salty. Read the rest of my review on Cat the Critic:  catthecritic.wordpress.c…
Global seeker of fine wings- so glad I found you crisp. Don't plan on sitting with a big crowd as limited seats and not exactly cozy. Get it to go!

10 piece, Seoul Sassy flavor. Be satisfied! I always forget when I get KFC (Korean Fried Chicken) that they use the WHOLE wing. Not just the tiny little wing you would get at Wing Stop, but the entire wing attached to the drumstick. Believe me the 10 piece is more than enough for 2 people to share. Interestingly, their kimchi fries weren't what I expected, because they only provided plain fried fries which you then poured their signature orange sauce all over. The signature sauce was addicting, and my husband proceeded to dip his share of the wings in the sauce as well. Solid food.

A few friends and I went here for dinner recently and I was pretty impressed. The wings were good, perfect amount of spice balanced with the right amount of tanginess that made it tasteful. I ordered the Seoul Sassy and aside from the sauce being delicious, the size of each wing were enormous. After eating about three wings I was full, I had to pack up the rest to take home. The only downfall about this restaurant was that it's small, with limited seating my friends and I had to sit separately because there wasn't enough I room to accommodate us all sitting together.  Line was long when we wakes in, but to my surprise, it Nieves fairly quickly.

Amazing wings, both non-spicy and spicy (we tried 30). Also not your normal wings, it's the entire wing (drumstick, wing, and wing tip). The bulgogi burrito was a pleasant surprised and had freshly cooked white sticky rice (cooked just the right amount).
