The chicken bowl unfortunately was disappointing and the chicken was a bit overdone/dry.

Get the chicken wings! There rest is not important. I've been a customer here at least 3 times now and after finally trying something else other than the wings, feel I can write a better review. As far as their wings go, it may seem pricey...$8.95 for 5 wings?? But what you actually get is 10 "wings" if you count each drumstick and wing as separate so it's a fair price. All three times I've come the wings have been consistently crispy, tender, juicy and flavorful. I don't really do spicy so I've always gotten the soul sassy flavor which is like a soy sauce based bbq sauce. Tried the big boy buddha bowel (essentially bibimbop) but felt this was off. The flavors were too sour/vinegary and despite looking like a classic bibimbop, did not taste like one. Minus one star. Overall though service is friendly, wings are amazing. Would definitely recommend checking them out for this alone.  Be warned though, space is small and it's communal seating. At peak times it's packed and seats aren't guaranteed.

Hype: 10/10 Value: 5/10 Time waiting on line: 0 Day visited: Sunday  Time: 8:30 Seating: very limited. Shared it with 4 other people Time waiting for food: about 10 minutes Food ordered: 10 seoul sassy 10 bbq wings 1 order of fries and a bulgogi plate Best dish: Seoul sassy wings Wing size: huge Bathroom factor: 9/10 aka I almost pooped my pants on the way home Price out the door: $56!!  Atmosphere: fast food Could you bring a date here: I mean you could but I wouldn't recommend it. Super messy.  Holy batman Korean fried chicken is my jam. The hype is real. Get yourself over to crisp for some delicious wings. They were oh so finger licking good. The Seoul sassy sauce is legit. Would order again.

Delicious wings... big too IN fact.. the soy wings were awesome.. also got the crisp BBQ wings.... they were good but not great.. need a more kick to it.. it was a lil more on swt side... and they could a been crisper. Overall the place is great.. wings are awesome...

Been here a few times.  The chicken wings are good as well is the kimchi.  This time I tried the budda bowl since I was craving bibimbap.  I should have just stayed with the chicken.  Although the chi-town chicken bowl was good, it definitely not anything like bibimbap--the rice was soggy and not crispy on the bottom and it lacked the veggies you usually see on bibimbap.   Overall the place is good, esp for the chicken wings.  Not as good as bonchon in NYC and in Asia, but since we don't have that here in the Midwest, this will do.

I LOVE this place ... but they stopped selling whole or half chicken and are only doing boneless. WTH!?! The bone is what helps give the chicken flavor, not to mention that the boneless 9 piece is the same price as the whole boned chicken was. Sad day for me as I loved the whole chicken with seoul sassy sauce. BUT in all fairness their other stuff is good, I'm just disappointed that they stopped selling half and whole chicken. Hey Crisps, if I brought in my own chicken would you could prepare it for me ... LOL.

Been here a couple of times with friends for lunch.  The place is always packed. Order and pick up if you can. Seating is limited. But the food is amazing. I haven't had anything here that I didn't enjoy. If you are looking for something quick and good stop by.  They also have vegetarian options.
Despite the almost 5-star reviews, I don't enjoy the food here at all... the ingredients are not freshly prepared, meat and wings are dried-up.

Delicious & affordable! Love their chicken wings (all flavors) and rice bowels.  Not much for atmosphere tho w/communal dining and cheap rolls of paper towels laying around instead of individual napkins.

This place has been on my list of places to try for over a year now because of all of the goods things I've heard and the great reviews I've read. So glad I finally go to try it! I came here with my dad and we ordered the Seoul Sensation Korean Burrito and 5 Seoul Sassy chicken wings, along with some fries. The best part of the burrito was the meat, which was seasoned perfectly. Other parts of the burrito were just meh. On the other hand, the chicken wings were great! The wings were huge and super filling! Was not entirely sure what to expect of the sauce since I ordered it based on what everyone recommended and it was tasty! At the end of our meal, both of us were super full. The amount we ordered probably would have been ideal for three people.

This is hard review to write, considering as of 8/7 they are no longer selling whole or half chickens. I am pretty upset, and wanted to give them three stars on those grounds alone, but in all good conscience, I can not, because this place is amazing.  A Korean fried chicken place no longer selling whole or half chickens..... ABSURD I have lived in Lakeview for 5 years and have ordered out and ate in here many times. Its absolutely fabulous. I always get a whole chicken, half classic crisp BBQ, half sassy seoul. I have never been disappointed.  But upon getting lunch there with my finance on 8/6, i saw the sign in the window which stated what i mentioned previously, no more whole of half chickens. I was genuinely shocked and confounded. How can a Korean fried chicken BBQ place, as well known and as popular as Crisp, stop selling their best item? When I inquired, I was told it was a "supply" problem; that they cannot secure a steady supply of the quality of chicken that they want, free of hormones, antibiotics, etc. I found it odd the person i spoke with didn't mention pricing as a factor. What he probably should have said was, "we can't get the chicken we want at the price we want to pay."  As a result, their solution is to stop selling their most well known, most requested item, which to me seems absolutely trump-esque debacle of an answer. Their menu online still list whole bird $15.95 for a 12 piece (with tax and tip it is usually $20); so I am not clear on what their profit margins are, but you would be hard pressed to find another bird in the city that costs $20. But many people, including myself, happily pay it because it is or was so good.  RIP Whole and Half Bird.
I come here every time I'm in Chicago!  Love the wings so much.  Delicious!  I recommend the Sassy and BBQ, and the fries!  I didn't like the bowls as much though.  Stick to the wings.

Got the 5 Chicken Wings, 3 of them with  Seoul Sassy and 2 of them with BBQ sauce. I would recommend both sauces. Ordered for here, took about 5 minutes. I have to say the best chicken wings I ate in Chicago. Nice, cripsy and the sauces are really really delicious. Although both sauces are very good. I like the Seoul Sassy sauce just due to personal preference. I haven't tried other things on the menu but I would definitely recommend this to anyone new to this restaurant.

It's a fast food place, they've got benches to eat on so not much for decor. If you're looking for chicken wings in the lake view area, Korean BBQ is the way to go! It's even worth the drive from the burbs.

Sauce was great- good stuff. I tried both the sassy and bbq (as recommended). Although, I don't know how I felt about the whole chicken (not tender.. over cooked). In my opinion, stick to the wings and you wouldn't be disappointed with the hype!

Of all the places we ate in DC, this was my favorite. We got chicken wings and their steak burrito. Chicken wings were cooked perfect. Each wing comes with the flat and drum as one compared to places that split them. We picked BBQ and sassy sauce. I preferred the sassy sauce more. Steak burrito was huge. Could have had half and save the rest for later if I really wanted to. Steak was seasoned well and just the right amount of ingredients. Each bite contained everything. Allison sauce is great, located on the table and could definitely put that on everything. Must go!

Let me just start by saying how much I LOVE CHICKEN WINGS. It's an obsession of mine and I get super annoyed when people order boneless because I feel like that takes away all of the tastiness and juiciness of the wing itself. With that said, I was soooo happy to see that they serve the entire wing here, as in the tip, mid-section, and drumette. :) We ordered them the Seoul Sassy way and my oh my, my taste buds were tingling. These were also decent sized wings unlike the dinky ones at Buffalo Wild Wings or Hooter's. I am now officially torn between Crisp and KyoChon in LA when it comes to Korean wings. However, another one that's part of the my all-time favorite list, although not KFC, will be San Tung in SF! Gah for the love of wings. *insert heart emoji*

Good food in a strangely frenetic atmosphere.  The menu is limited; the marquee item is the fried chicken.  We had wings with the sweet and spicy sauce and one of the bowls, essentially bibimbap.  Everything was tasty if a bit temperature-odd: the wings are crispy but because of being doused in sauce, they're sort of at room temperature; in the bowl, hot rice, meat and egg are dancing, in a friendly way, with chilled veggies.  The chicken is unbelievably messy.  The place is mobbed, and the procedure for managing that adds to the frenzy.  You wait in line to place your order and pay.  Then you loiter around trying to find a place to sit so you'll be able to eat your food when it's finally delivered.  There's a lot of hovering and spot-saving.  Everyone's pretty amiable about everything and the eavesdropping that such tight quarters makes possible is entertaining, but it's all a pretty intense experience!  Maybe takeout next time.

Great sauce! I lived in Korea for a while and fell in love with KFC(Korean fried chicken) and Crisp does their chicken extremely well. The sauces are tasty, the chicken is extremely crisp, and the size of the wings are larger than average brining good value to your dollar. The space is small but that's part of the vibe. Be prepared to wait during the typical peak times, but always a good time eating here.
Crisp had some great wings, but the fries could've been a little better. Overall five stars because there was great service and Allison's atomic sauce was amazing.

I might be a little late to the Crisp Party but i'm SOO happy we randomly stopped in here for quick dinner before seeing a movie at the Landmark theatre. I had the beef bowl and my boyfriend had the spicy chicken sandwich. YUM YUM YUM.  My only complaint is 100% on me- I didn't exactly read the description of the seoul beef bowl and I didn't realize it came with no veggies. It's literally a bowl of white rice with bulgoli beef. DELICIOUS bulgoli beef, but not exactly a balanced meal.  The chicken sandwich was incredibly crispy. Incredibly. I'm confused by how crispy it was- in a good way. It comes with bacon, lettuce, tomato, spicy sauce and all on a big, fluffy white bun.  Service was great, and this place was quite busy for a Monday night. The people who took our order were super friendly and helpful to us newcomers.  NEXT TIME I want to try one of the Buddha bowls that come with all sorts of veggies, and I want to save room for spicy crispy chicken wings, which other people were eating and looked AWESOME. We'll be back!

We ordered online on Friday and I honestly don't know why people are so excited about this food. It was not at all what I expected. The chicken was very dry, overcooked, and didn't have much meat at all. It reminded me of bar food. When I think of the word "crisp" I think of crunchy coating over moist succulent meat. This was not that at all.  I suppose some people really like the sauces, but I found them unpalatably firey.

I thought it was almost misleading to call this a Korean chicken wing place... not much about the food or the place itself seemed Korean to me; if anything, calling it "modern Korean" might be passable. That said, the wings were super super tasty, especially with the Seoul sassy rub. Firstly, they were huge; if I were only eating wings I'd probably fill up on 4 or 5. Every part of each wing was fried uniformly--not too dry but also not overpowering. The sweetness of the rub was just perfect, and the skin was just crispy enough to give way when bitten into the meat inside.  I didn't think the Buddha bowls were all that special. They were like glorified salads with rice and a fried egg. Which isn't to say that they were bad, but I didn't think they were very worthwhile given the contents. It didn't taste much like a traditional bibimbap, so I wouldn't call it that--not all of the contents were cooked, and the majority of the vegetables were Western, not Korean. The bulgogi bowl would probably have been closer to an authentic Korean dish.
Delicious little gem in Chicago! Highly recommend the brown rice and chicken to anyone who is looking for alight delicious meal.

4.5/5 Seriously conflicted about writing an honest review and encouraging people to come here bc I want it to be less crowded for me next time I roll through. But fine.  Only the dankiest of chicken is served here. I got 6 pc boneless chicken strips in the Seoul Sassy sauce, lowkey regretted not getting more for later cuz that shit was killer. Be sure to try Allison's Atomic sauce, get the creamy rich texture that the chicken needs and deserves.  I really dug the vibe in here, too. Everything was wood, Indie-pop was playing from an old-school boombox, and obscure sodas stocked their fridges. Hipster, but not overwhelmingly so. A+ Pretty upset that I had to dock them half a star, but the place was pretty congested. The long tables and bench seating leave little room for walking, and many guests seemed unsure of whether or not to clear their own tables, which left some quite messy.  Bottom line: come here, but not while I'm here pls.

Your search for wings ends here.  These are the biggest clucking things you've ever seen. And the sauces? You've got a choice between seriously satisfying Seoul Sassy or a flavorful, spicy BBQ. Mix in BYOB and I'm surprised you're not leaving right now to get these wings already!

Amazing wings!! Have always heard about Crisp's incredible chicken wings so I was excited to finally give it a try. It's a pretty small space right near Wellington and Broadway so I wouldn't necessarily come with a large group. Tuesday night seems like a good time to come though! I opted for 5 wings with the Crisp BBQ sauce and an order of onion rings.  SO MUCH FOOD In hindsight, I probably didn't need that much to eat, but I'll be damned if I didn't polish off that entire tray. The wings are enormous, to the point where smaller folk might not be able to finish 5 of them. The Crisp BBQ sauce is really tasty (gives you a bit of Asian twang) but is not that spicy. Onion rings were super solid, nice and crispy without any of that crappy "cheap" fast food onion ring taste. Can't believe I've been in Lakeview for a year and hadn't been to Crisp yet. This place is the shit!

Seoul Sassy, baby! Order anything here (as long as it includes meat) and just ask for it Seoul Sassy. You will not be disappointed. If you are, you have infantile taste buds!  Place is cramped, but that's because of how incredible the food is. Also, BYOB! You gotta be slick to find seating, but it's well worth it for the meal. Or just take-out! Must also compliment the exquisite kim-chi. Much larger portion than I anticipated and I'm still snacking on that pickled cabbage goodness four days later!  Crisp food, Crisp. May you forever remain a Lakeview staple!

This chicken was dry as ****. My jawline is mad swole right now. My neck is stiff. I tried microwaving my leftovers and the white chicken breast turned silver, had the texture of a belt. I thought to myself, if I was camping under the stars this would make some tasty jerky. I ate the rest of the chicken cold. It's easier on the neck. That spicy mayo is bomb.
Still as good as always.  Consistent quality.  Seating is still difficult.  We moved to Boston two years ago.  This is the spot we always visit when we are back to Chicago.  We dream of Seoul Sassy.

delicious fusion foods. great bang for your buck. wings, fried and sauced well. onion rings were fried to crispy perfection. Seoul steak bowl that would rival any korean restaurant. great place to share a meal. only downside is that the restaurant is small and tables are limited to a first come basis.
We had a whole bird with bbq sauce. It was by far the best fried chicken I have ever had.

Since moving into my new place about 1.5 months ago, I've had Crisp about 5 times already. I've had the wings and the steak and chicken bowls, everything is consistently great. The atomic sauce is a necessary addition no matter what you order. Service is always very quick and friendly, prices are very reasonable considering the amount of food that you receive. I always order to-go but the dine in atmosphere is very casual and laid back, although it can get a bit cramped depending on the crowds. Some of the best and most unique wings around town, highly recommended if you're in the area and need a quick bite!
Best chicken I've ever had. We got the six piece Korean bbq---huge pieces, great value, incredible flavor.

Unless I caught them on a bad day, I consider the $9 I spent on 1/2 chicken the same as buying a Lotto ticket:  worthless.  The chicken was so overcooked and dry I thought I had swallowed a bone when instead it was just a piece of the breast meat.  I wound up spitting out at least 3/4 of the chicken.  Forget about the wings and leg, where I couldn't even find any meat to even chew on.  Sure the sauces were ok, but nothing inventive or memorable. Who are these people who are raving about the food.  I think that they must have no discerning palate at all.  I would much rather have a piece of juicy and cheaper Popeye's chicken than the  poor excuse for chicken I was served here.  I gave them a second star only as a gift, in the event that I did indeed get them on a bad day.  A restaurant these days cannot have mistakes as this.  The industry is just too competitive.  If they burned the chicken, it would have been much cheaper to throw it away, than to serve it to me, as not only won't I return, but none of my friends will.   Shame too, cause I would have tried the other items on the menu another time.  Not now.  Cooking channel:  Shame on you.

A friend recommended Crisp to me and someone else visiting. The place was clean, and the staff was friendly and polite. It took me forever to decide what I wanted. Everything on the menu sounds delicious.  I decided on 3 Seoul Sassy and 2 Crisp BBQ wings. They were the largest wings I've ever had. I considered getting a Buddha bowl and the wings, but 5 wings took me 2 sittings to finish.  I think I like the Crisp BBQ wings a little better. They were saucier, but both were fantastic! Both of us loved our meal and couldn't stop talking about it for the rest of the afternoon. If I lived in town, Crisp would be my regular spot. Can't wait to return!

Oh, Crisp.  2 years ago I would've given you 5 stars.  A year ago I would've given you 4 stars.  Now you're down to three. My boyfriend and I used to live close to Crisp, so we never got delivery.  We would order in the store, wait, take it home and never have an issue (except for the one time my friend got raw wings, but the staff did a great job at remediating the issue...hence the 5 stars to 4).  We have since moved a little further away and have been ordering online.  I usually order the buddha bowl with brown rice, which has an extra charge of $1.50.  The last 4 times I ordered the bowl and paid extra for the brown rice I got white rice instead.  I was forgiving the first 2 times, but 4 times in a row?  Not cool.  The last time we ordered, my boyfriend got a half chicken and three of the pieces had almost no meat on them.  Again, not cool. When your order is right and you get good pieces of chicken, Crisp is great!  I hate to say it, but, given the last few delivery experiences we've had, our household is going to be taking an indefinite Crisp delivery break.

Third time here! Love the Seoul Sassy and Crisp BBQ combination for chicken wings, topped with their atomic sauce. There's not a lot of space inside the restaurant and it's quite packed during peak lunch/dinner hours, so avoid these windows if you don't want to wait in line.

If you and your group of friends are looking to eat some quality wings, Crisp is the right place to be. If you are planning to stop by Crisp for dinner, I would definitely recommend getting here as early as possible to save a seat for your party. There is not a lot of dining space inside of the restaurant: there are only a few picnic-style tables and a couple counters on which you can dine. Their wings are enormous and packed with tons of flavor. My favorite sauce would have to be the Seoul Sassy. It gives the wings a sweet flavor that is not too overwhelming or headache-inducing. In addition to wings, Crisp also offers rice bowls; however, I would not recommend getting them here. In my opinion, these bowls are not very good. There is simply too much rice and not enough vegetables in these bowls that makes them not enjoyable to eat. Stick to the wings if you ever stop by Crisp and you won't be disappointed.
FOOD POISONING: I went with five friends on July 3, 2016. Shared a variety of chicken. Within a few hours every person was suffering from vomiting and diarrhea.

My friend loved this place so much, she insisted we Lyft from river north to this spot in Lakeview by Lincoln Park. Crisp is your classic Korean chicken wing spot but entirely approachable for those not too familiar with Korean food. There's counter and communal table seating stocked with rolls of paper towels (it gets messy), and bibimbap sauce. This is what we ordered for two for ~$20:  Half order of wings (3 Seoul Sassy and 3 Crisp BBQ)  - The Seoul Sassy is gochujang spicy and sweet. My favorite. This is what I came for. Original Bad Boy Buddha Bowl - This riff off of a bibimbap (without the fancy bowl) is served with 8 varieties of vegetables and a fried sunny-side up egg. Squeeze on some of the bibimbap sauce and mix it around for full effect. It wasn't my favorite, but it was a nice accompaniment to the wrings.

Fried chicken.. more like dried chicken.  Beyond dry! Seoul sassy tasted nothing like described. If you like soy sauce then there for you.  Plain jane fried chicken is exactly what it says. Not even salt lol. Steak bowl.. smh. Disgrace. White rice with ultra thin sliced steak and scallions that's it.  A whole shitty chicken and a steak bowl $30 bucks.    Never again.

The oversized wings were no joke! You could see the consistency in what others ordered versus what I got and that's huge to me. The Seoul Sassy and Crispy BBQ both had rich flavor and relatively low heat for the Crispy BBQ. There's an atomic sauce on the table which is similar to a fry sauce that's worth a try. 10 piece is a little pricey running for $17. Small dining room pick up or delivery seemed to be the choice but waiting for a spot to sit was pretty fast rotation of people. BYOB just like most of the restaurants near by. Would highly recommend this if you're looking for wings and want something new or love teriyaki style sauces.
Pricey but worth every bite. The sassy flavor was good but the suicide spicy was on point. It hit every taste bud just the way I like it. The wings are gigantic and enough for leftover.

I've only had the Chi-Town Chicken Bowl from Crisp, but it is both excellent and HUGE, especially for the price!  Although my appetite is on the smaller side, it is certainly at least two meals' worth of food.  The restaurant itself is small and nothing super special, but I'm looking forward to coming back and trying more of their offerings!

Hands down the best fried chicken I have had in my lifetime. I take everyone I can here. Go across the street to Dry Hop and get a growler then chow down on chicken and share a buddha bowl. They have the best of everything. Their atomic sauce is off the hook and almost wanted to buy it until I found out its like 90% fat, which is what makes it so freaking good. Throw it on everything though and I promise you will be happy. The spicy bbq sauce is the best but they have so many to choose from on and off the menu, ask for what you like and you wont be disappointed. You will thank me later!

Not as good as I expected We ordered 15 wings, 10 Seoul sassy and 5 BBQ. We liked the Seoul sassy more than BBQ;however, the meat was very hard to chew. The not so common crisp chicken sandwich was very hard and burnt. Seeing the reviews, i expected better tasting food. Disappointed.
The beef bulgogi is really good!  Their kimchi is also delicious.  Prices are good.  I am bummed I didn't try the chicken wings because they looked soooo delish...next time though!

Good.  God.  I have a love affair with this restaurant and their food!  Best wings (Korean-style or otherwise) you can get, hands down.  I have been here time and time again and it always is delicious. My go to are the whole jumbo wings, split between Seoul Sassy and Crisp BBQ.  Both are great flavors, perfect mix of spicy and sweet.  I'm not going to lie, it is a lot of food.  But I usually finish it in a sitting.  Could realistically feed 2-3 but my appetite is huge. The best way to get Crisp is to either have it delivered or do take-out.  The restaurant is very small and there is not much seating.  It is typically very crowded as well. Fairly priced, amazing food.  What more could you ask for?

Just purchased the huge chicken wings on the menu which turned out to be extremely hard fried and difficult to bite into. I really do not understand the rave reviews about their so called Korean chicken. The Kimchi was delicious and the fries were quite tasty, and I was pleased to find they were lightly salted and perfectly fried. However I don't think I will order again.

Yum yum yum yum yum yum yum yum yum. I never want the meal to be over and could always go for more. Food is fresh! Employees are respectful and kind. I've only been here a few times but I don't think this place can do wrong.

The wings here are amazing! Casual environment with communal seating. Can be kind of hectic during peak hours so I always prefer to take mine to go. Seoul sassy and bbq are my favorite but they're all pretty good.  Growing up in New York with the abundance of Korean food, I've come to develop high standards for Korean fried chicken but these are as good as Bon chon and the like if not better.

Delicious fast and hot  I enjoyed my chicken cutlet sandwich w buffalo sauce. It was slightly spicy and delicious. I also enjoyed my French fries they were thin cut and served sizzling hot I had them w BBQ sauce and also some ketchup. Lastly I had 5 crisp chicken wings and they were totally delicious. I had em w BBQ sauce. Their sauces are bomb great tasty  Come here you will enjoy

The restaurant in the area my friends and I were trying to eat at decided to take a day off. I quickly turned to yelp to help find something to quell our hunger. Crisp was close and the photos surely looked delicious! Quickly made our way over and ordered. Between the 3 of us we ordered 15 wings (5 Seoul Sassy, 5 Buffalo, 5 Crisp BBQ) and the Bad Boy Buddha We came on a Saturday so it was pretty packed.. after ordering we waited around 10 minutes before being able to sit.  After we were seated, the food came out pretty quickly. Upon first glance, it looks pretty good. The Buddha bowl is basically a bibimbap with lots of veggies. My only problem with the bowl was that the rice was very soggy... it wasn't the normal sticky and glutinous rice that I'm used to in bibimbaps.  On to the wings! Crispy skin, perfectly seasoned, moist and juicy. Seoul sassy is such an appropriate name.. The sweet soy base with garlic and ginger really make it delicious.  My favorite wings were the Crisp BBQ though.. the bbq sauce had formed this sticky glaze on the skin which surprisinlgy was still crispy even after all the sauce was layered on top. Smokey, sweet and a little spicy. For those who know Korean cuisine, there I would assume that this base is gochujang (red pepper paste).. we also asked if they could make it a little spicier since we all enjoy some good heat!   The most disappointing thing and the reason why it gets 4 Stars is because of their buffalo wings. I'm a lover of classic buffalo flavored wings so I had to get some to try.. surely they could not be bad right? I found the wing sauce to be too buttery and acidic from the vinegar. Also, the wings were SOGGY! Don't know if it was just our order. Hey.. what should I expect ordering buffalo wings and a Korean fusion wing shop right?
This chicken is delicious especially the Seoul Sassy. So tasty and different.

Not really worth the hype. I ordered a whole chicken and was rather disappointed. The chicken was so dry that it was difficult to swallow. When i eat fried chicken i would like it to be crispy, but the skin of this chicken was hard. Would not come again.

It may not look like much, but this place is a gem. Really good chicken wings, and amazing chicken bowl! I love the sauce that comes with it. Like really. I had to wait a little while because it was so busy, but worth it! And service was super friendly :D
Love this place. Great big wings! Very flavorful. Parking is a disaster around this area, but if you make it here, you won't regret it.
Seoul Sassy wings and fries are my jam. I LOVE this place and wish I didn't live so far from them so I could eat it more often!

Their fried chicken was amazing! It packs a punch of flavor! I ordered to Seoul Sassy and Crisp BBQ and would definitely go back for more. Their service was also great! The man who took our order gave us some advice on ordering and helped in providing a nice atmosphere.
Love this place!  The service is good and the food is excellent.  Definitely something different.   Order the wings!
Hidden gem when it comes to wings, fried chicken sandwiches and noodle bowls. This place is great and worth s stop-in
5+ times here. Definitely a gem. Btw, don't be deceived by the humble out-front. It is the FOOD that counts ;)

Love love love this place! The fried chicken is delicious and the price can't be beat. And their bulgogi bowl is wonderful!  The restaurant itself is kind of small so if you plan to eat here oh may have to wait a bit. And they are all mostly communal tables. But if you want to take away it's perfect.  Seriously, cannot find better Korean place in Lakeview!

Next level sh*t, fam. There's obviously a reason this place has over 1,976 reviews. If your girlfriend doesn't want to eat here then leave her at home and bring her a salad back from Walgreens. You're probably better off anyway.
Thumbs up to the previous "crisp nom nom nom" comment. Agreed. I ONLY like crispy chicken tenders with black letter and this place owns it. Crunch crunch yum yum!

Decided to finally try something other than the wings and went with the Seoul Steak Bowl - this was absolutely delicious.   I've now tried almost all of their wings over time and found that I love everyone.  This place is crazy busy all the time.  The neighborhood definitely knows where to find a great meal!

I got a small order of 5 pc chicken wings in Seoul sassy flavor. It was very good. The chicken was nice and Krispy and the sauce that it was in was delicious. It's slightly sweet and tangy but not spicy. I'd definitely recommend the chicken wings. They have condiment stations at every table and paper towels as well.

I don't know what to say that hasn't already been said, but this is the best chicken I've ever had. The Seoul sassy sauce lived up to the hype. The wings were so big that I brought some home and had them the next day. Even being reheated in the oven, they were still as divine.  On a weekday around 2 PM, it was still packed with hungry chicken lovers but these wings were well worth the wait.

Crisp is a place you absolutely must try. My friend and I shared an order of 10 wings and a beef bowl for lunch. EVERYTHING WAS OUTSTANDING!!!!! Yes it must be written in all caps. The wings are large and worth the price and so is the bowl. I'm definitely returning.

Crisp is THE spot for Korean food. I miss it so much. I have never had anything bad on the menu but the wings are revolutionary and will probably change your life. Easily one of the best spots for chicken wings in the city.

dayuuuuuuuum daniel! el fuego en fuego.  as wu-tang most definitely would say, this place brings da ruckus I went with my brother and his wife and we basically just didn't talk to each other during the meal bc we were too drunk off this chicken to actually form words.  Seoul sassy touched my soul and made me whole again. GO THERE AND GET IT If you like chicken, why aren't you here now? Thank you, crisp. I love you so much.
Best chix wings I've ever had! OMG! BYOB is always a plus too!

OMG! The best fried chicken ever! The sauces are all crazy good and finger lickin good! I seriously don't understand how they make them so crispy. Amazing! I drove an hour to try this place and it was well worth it.
We tried the whole chicken a while back, and I think we love this even more than the wings! There is a much better sauce to meat ratio, and we love the mix of white and dark meat.

Two words. Asian. Fusion. Two more words. Atomic. Sauce (highly recommend this sauce, btw). This quaint joint was BUMPING on a Friday at 9:00 p.m. with not a seat open in the place, which can only mean one thing...the food is the real deal. I'll be the first to tell you the food was delicious and the staff was awesome. Hipsters who love their job and dish out an unlikely combination of deliciousness. Next time, those wings are mine!
Just plain and simple these are the best damn wings I've ever had, they are huge huge wings and every bite is heaven

I usually love the food here but tonight I was very disappointed. The chicken was dry and the sauce was very sparing. The pieces were cut quite small and so probably got over cooked. The Buddha bowl was very good.

Amazing. Seoul Sassy sauce is a must. Atomic sauce is a must. I usually get the Buddha bowls, but the Seoul steak, Chi-town chicken, and BURRITOS are also amazing, but this place thrives because of its wings. They aren't your standard little wing, where after 2 bites you're done. These are MASSIVE. Pretty sure 10 wings is like 7 chickens.  If this were out of 10, I'd give it a 9.5 due to the picnic style seating in the restaurant...the space could probably be utilized better. But what do I know...all I do is consume their amazing chicken, so I probably shouldn't be questioning their wisdom.
best chicken wings ever!!  can you guys open one in the bay area?

Mighty mighty wings!  5 pieces of wings for $9 maybe sound like a lot, but these wings are double the size of normal wings.  You can get them plain or in one of the 3 flavors: Seoul Sassy, BBQ, or Buffalo.  I tried all 3 flavors and can't decide which one I liked best.  The Seoul Sassy was pretty awesome with the combination of sweet and salty.  The chicken was cooked to perfection.  These might just be the best wings I've ever had. Original Bad Boy Buddha Bowl $9 - This is a bowl of rice served with fried egg and vegetables: spinach, bean sprouts, carrots, zucchini, cucumbers, mushrooms, moo (Korean radishes), and corn.  Seems like a nice healthy lunch. If you want to dine in, you'll probably end up sharing one of the bench tables with someone else.  You have to make sure they're willing to share the sauce that's provided at the table - spicy mayo and Buddha sauce. They're open on Mondays, even if it's MLK! We were able to find street parking a few blocks away.

I decided to stop in here one day after work - so happy I did! The Seoul Sassy wings are amazing! Easily my favorite wings in Chicago. I recommend sizing down from your normal portion size or bringing someone to share your food with. My bf made the mistake of ordering 10 wings (what he orders at other wing places) and practically had a whole chicken left to take home. We also had a buddha bowl stuffed with veggies that could easily feed 3 people!

Had this place bookmarked for a LONG time. Was so excited to finally try it out. It's a small store overall, but the people who work there are very friendly. Shared tables are thing here, so either take t to go or be comfortable with listening to others speak while they do the same to you--I definitely didn't mind this part. We got 5 of every wing they had and I just wasn't that impressed with any except the one that resembled buffalo sauce. The other two sauces were relatively odd, but more than that the chicken tasted odd to me. One of the set of wings was crunchy to the point of being too hard to eat. Another set of wings had pieces of chicken that were cold and hot on the same piece which I didn't understand. They're not the worst wings I've ever had, but certainly not my favorite. Fairly priced and something you must try bc maybe I caught them on an off day.
delicious sauces. my favorite is the Seoul Sassy. got the boneless but should've gone for the bone-in going off of seeing the other orders. will be back again.

Split 10 wings and the Big Boy Buddha bowl (vegetarian bibimbap) with a friend. We were totally stuffed- the portions are very generous and I think they threw in a couple extra wings to boot. Others in our group seemed to get 1-2 extra wings as well. Thank you, Crisp! We tried the Seoul sassy (no heat, sweeter) & BBQ (mild heat). I liked the spice in the BBQ but thought the Seoul sassy tasted a little more interesting. The sauces (spicy creamy mayo sort of sauce and a hot sauce) at the table were on point. The place was pretty packed- seems like a commonplace occurrence. I'd go back!

Seriously how many chicken wing selfie will it take to convince you to try this place? Tried half & half basket of Crisp BBQ and Seoul Sassy, and it was delicious! We dined-in so wings were freshly hot and crispy. Not sure how wings would be if we did take-out. Place is a bit small and can get crowded. Decent price. It's a great go-to place if you're ever craving for some awesome crispy chicken wings!

Massive amounts of super crisp chicken  for the price. A double sandwich, at $11, will feed two. The $4 kimchi was superb, and massive as well. Only the Buddha bowl, similarly humongous, disappointed; rice was stale, and the egg  overfried. But cheap, filling, and fast. Go.

This has become a go-to for quick weeknight dinner. The chicken is out of this world (particularly with the Seoul Sassy sauce)!  Pro tip: Call ahead and get takeout or have it delivered because the dining room gets packed.

The crispy and delicious chicken wings are the main act here at Crisp. 3 unique sauces to choose from that make these whole wings sticky finger type of good!!   Since this was our first visit here, we made the most of it and ordered 10 wings, half Seoul Sassy and half Buds Buffalo. Also orders the steak bowl and the chicken bowl.  Our favorite by far were the wings, and we both agreed that we can skip the bowls next time we visit.  This place is definitely non stop busy, and the communal dining tables do make it hard to sit and enjoy the food.  This is also a BYOB some tables stay occupied for longer then normal. Have a back up plan if you find seating unavailable

Be ready to throw down with other customers trying to find a seat. Chicken was really good but was room temperature when I bit into it. The Buddah Bowl (Bibimbap) was a little watery from not draining the veggies thoroughly. Overall, I'd go back but hopefully during a less busy time.

Best fried chicken I have ever had. This review is long overdue. I bring everyone here that I know and they always love it.  It has been 2 years now that I have been a patron of crisp and not once have I had a bad meal. The place is small and on a Saturday it can get packed. My favs are: Boneless tenders with Seoul sassy on the side. Crisp bbq half chicken Chi town bowl Super fries You will not be disappointed! Just get there right when they open to avoid the rush and you'll enjoy your self.

Small, cute little shop with limited seating, but GREAT chicken wings! Their atomic sauce is reason enough to make the trip!  They have a great deal that's enough food to feed at least 3-4 people that has a whole chicken (you can choose two sauces), a side and two drinks.  The chicken was perfectly fried, there the outside was crisp and crunchy but the inside was moist and delicious. We ordered the kimchi as a side, and surprisingly, they complemented each other so well!  Their onion rings are above average, but a bit too battery for my taste.  Overall, I would definitely choose this place over BWW or Hooters any day!

I will come here with my BF if we craving for a whole chicken wings Korean flavor style! It's amazingly good! We always get the mix flavor of wings Seoulsassy flavor and the hot flavor it's a great combo and with fries! It's SOO fulling! You won't regret visiting here! Even though the place is crump it's still clean! The workers are nice! It's gets too crowded on a specific day so get there early! And for dessert we always go to Molly's for there yummy cupcake!  GO TRY THE CHICKEN!! YOU WON'T REGRET A PENNY!  I won't rate it 5 becuAse of the restaurant space but all in all they have the best Korean whole chicken wings!!  Try going to Great Sea Chinese restaurant! They also have the best lollipop chicken Korean flavor style! GET THE SPICY FLAVOR! My mouth is watery thinking about it!

Crisp was rated highly on must eats lists in Chicago so I wanted to check it out. I love Korean fried chicken so I had high expectations. We ordered half Seoul sassy and half spicy crisp bbq wings. The wings are pretty big so don't expect those small ones you get at Buffalo Wild Wings. The place is small with limited seating but worth the wait. I wouldn't say it's the best Korean chicken I've had but still up there.
Still fire as hell! I tried one of their burritos today and it's just as great as their famous wings. This place is amazing.

Really good Korean Chicken wings.  We wanted to know how the original wings (i.e. without sauce) tasted, so we ordered some plain wings in addition to some of the other flavors.  The BBQ and the Seoul Sassy wings were much much more flavorful and tasted better than the plain ones.  The prices here are really high, but you get a lot of food.  All of their wings are full wings, not what you think of as typical sized wings.  Definitely come with an appetite because like I said, the wings are big.  The fries are really good too.
BOMB! Love this spot... I mean what's there not to like? Maybe a bit overpriced but the wings are fire and I absolutely love their radish Kimchi. Don't miss out this is a must try!
I would fly from New York to Chicago just to eat here. That's how amazing their chickens are. Sassy Seoul is my favorite. I wish they had a store in NYC.

These are not your ordinary Korean Fried Chicken Wings... Our local friend recommended us trying out this spot, so we got the Crisp BBQ sauce and split 10 wings between the 4 of us. They gave us more than 10 wings, btw... I don't think the description on the menu fits the actual sauce. It's described as, "a little spicy, a little sweet and a little smoky. Prepared with fresh herbs and spices," on their menu. They should basically say that it's got crack in it that'll make you keep wanting more!  I would love to try the other dishes on their menu the next time I'm in town!
THE BEST Korean fried chicken. Get the spicy BBQ. It's awesome. They give you so much for your $$. I'm not as big of a fan of the bowls though. Stick to the chicken.

Crisp will never lead you the wrong way. Some of the best fried chicken in the city. Whatever you get, get some Jenny's Atomic Sauce on the side. It's like a chipotle mayo, but with a real asian inspired kick. It is so damn good. Crisp has limited seating inside, and is always busy, so I recommend getting it to go. Regardless, it is worth checking out for some of the best chicken in the city. Korean inspired flavors make chicken a whole new thing altogether. Flame.

Came here after reading an article saying it was one of the best fried chicken place in chicago. Don't come here looking for fried chicken however be prepared for great wings. I tried the plain jane, crisp bbq, and Seoul sassy.  The plain jane would be considered fried chicken however out of these three I don't recommend it.  It was plain... like the name says but nothing special.  The crisp bbq was good but I'd have to say the best was definitely Seoul sassy.   My tip is try to come at an odd hour if your dining in because it's a small place with not a lot of seats so be prepared to sit near strangers if you can even get a seat that is.

I was really excited to try this place, but was surprised when I got my order. I got the half chicken with the BBQ sauce, and it was terrible. The chicken pieces are cut weird with not much meat and very dry. I also ordered a bowl...and it as well was terrible. It was ice cold veggies with a cold poached egg on top with a container of Hot rice. it was too weird to make it past three bites. I will though give the place another chance because my buddy ordered the wings and was very happy.

I'm still searching for better asian BBQ wings and have not been able to find anything better than the wings at Crisp! The wings are unbelievable, the bowls are very good, the food is quick, the seating is convenient and the staff is friendly. This is one of those places I took good friends from out of town.

I had the biggest and best chicken sandwich ever at Crisp.  The Seoul Sassy sauce is sassy, but not spicy.  The perfectly fried chicken breast was hanging off of the edges of the bun and was so big it felt like it took an eternity to finish it. You don't need fries with this, the chicken sandwich stands on its own.  Also, the fries suck.  Imagine McDonald's fries, but soggy and with no salt. My husband had the wings and said the Seoul Sassy and spicy buffalo sauces were equally good.  He didn't speak much while devouring the wings.  The wings are on the large side, and the guy working the counter recommended 5 per person (Crisp sells wings as 5 or 10-piece).  If you've got a big appetite, you'll be able to eat more than 5. We were here on a Saturday night, and it was uncomfortably crowded.  There were so many people packed into this tiny space that you couldn't tell who already ordered and was waiting for food, who was waiting in line to order, and who was just standing there.  There are a few tables, but they were all occupied.  We ordered our food to go and ate at a brewery nearby. Crisp may be far from perfect, but the food is damn good and was worth a little discomfort.
The crips bbq chicken wings were better than the seoul sassy wing IMO. awesome crunch for big chicken wings...they just need to offer some beer!

Chicken wings were dry on the inside but crispy on the outside. One would hope for more in a fried chicken wing. Was displeased with the vegetables- soggy, not fresh. Where's the pickled radishes usually found in KFC places? Place was really dirty and there is limited seating. meh

3.5 stars Having come from a location with more Korean restaurants than gas stations, I have been thus far pretty disappointed with the Korean options in Chicago. Heard good things about Crisp and wanted to see if it could fulfill the Korean fried chicken craving. Have had Korean Fried Chicken at the classic Bonchon among other KFC locations, and comparatively Crisp is good, but not any better I'd say. Additionally, ordered the  1/2 lb. of Korean vegetables and an order of onion rings to pair with the chicken. The Korean vegetables were essentially classic banchan, and included beansprouts, cucumbers, carrots, chilled spinach. For some small portions of vegetables we paid $5, which we probably we do again. Same can be said for the onion rings, which while tasty, at $6 an order were probably twice as much as I'd expect them to be.  In retrospect, would stay away from the sides next time. But what about the chicken? Got the full chicken which was  1/2 sassy Seoul flavor and  1/2 Classic Crisp. The Sassy Seoul we thought tasted better, but it could have been spicier. The classic crisp I suppose is their variation of a sweet soy ginger, but it seemed as if the sauce didn't permeate well through all the skin, and some pieces were clearly blander than others. Especially with the whole bird, some of the pieces of white meat can actually be surprisingly dry, though another dip in the sauce seems to remedy that.  Verdict: Good chicken, though the Seoul Sassy could be spicier and the Classic Crisp wasn't as flavorful as I thought it would be. Additionally some pieces of chicken weren't as crispy as as others, though that might also be partly because we did takeout and waited a bit for the sauce to soften things up. Pricey sides that probably aren't worth it, though the Monday-Thursday Chicken Combo special might even those odds($22 for a full chicken + 2 sides + 2 sodas)

Really tries to emulate Korean fried chicken but I found it to be a little far from the OG than I would have liked. This is a very fusion based restaurant so expecting the OG would be unfair. The sauces are good however, the chicken was a little too dry for me. If you are looking for korean fried chicken, I would suggest the fried chicken joint in the food court of Hmart in Niles. Order: Sassy Seoul/ BBQ sauce half a bird (feeds 3) Side order of fries

I've been hearing about crisp for a while from many people but have never been. Well, after a day of relaxing by the lake we headed over for some chicken wings and stopped to grab some beers since its BYOB! We were in need of some comfort food to take away the Sunday afternoon blues (thinking about going back to work Monday). You know a place is good when it's jam packed during off hours. We ordered and then waited for some precious tables to open up. Food came after about 10 minutes and then science... From chowing down in fried chicken bliss. Yum, this place is amazing. The wings are fresh and huge! 5 wings is about the max I can eat. The bowls looked good too, maybe next time! Everyone was happy and full! Success.

This place is small but a great place to eat. Ive had Korean barbecue and this is as awesome, or even more awesome. The food was filling, there was meat on the bone, and a sauce for every taste palette. Do you like sweet? They have it! Mild? Oh yes! Spicy? That too!! They have it all! And  they definitely deliver on the crispy! I love the tender chicken! Well cooked, but never underdone! If you want a filling meal that satisfies your tummy, go here!

I ordered 10 wings with the crisp BBQ sauce. Wow, was this fantastic. The portion is very large and even days later these wings still tasted really good.  I will definitely be back, I'm interested in trying a whole chicken!

I went here yesterday and the BBQ half chicken was amazing! The chicken was crispy, "well seasoned" (I asked for spicy) and a zing of flavors delighted my palate!  Definitely a party in your mouth! Loved every bite!

Always a go to. I usually get the super strips and they are just as they sound....SUPER. Bring your appetite because you usually get a strip or two extra. The chicken itself is phenomenal and cooked perfectly, but it is the sauce that really stands out. You can't go wrong with any! I also LOVE the Chi town chicken bowl. No matter what you order you will always leave full, the portions are amazing. One of the best spots in Chicago and a must visit.

Definitely top of the line wings. Its one of the few places where you are getting the WHOLE wing, so take that into consideration when you order. You're getting more than double what you are expecting when you are trying to imagine how many wings you are getting. The BBQ and Seoul wings are really tasty. The Buffalo wings are OK. That sauce on its own is nothing too special, but there's nothing wrong with it either. As others have mentioned, the seating is really limited so at busier times you might want to take them to go, or plan to share one of the big tables with others. Definitely great chicken for the price.

I was told by a friend that I absolutely had to try this place and that I absolutely had to eat in because I'd miss the incredible taste experience if I did carry out.  So I went in on a Saturday afternoon.  Upon walking in I noticed that the place was very small but packed.  There was no place to sit. I didn't let the crowd stop me, I went up to the counter to order and asked the counter guy what the protocol was for ordering here particularly if I wanted to eat in.  He told me I should order and then wait for a seat.  He recommended the half and half sweet and sassy wings and I ordered and waited. A seat finally opened up on the bar against the wall and the counter guy bought my food to me... Let me just say this is the best fried chicken I've had so far in Chicago.  You can take that statement with a grain of salt though since I haven't been to a bunch of korean bbq spots but it was really GOOD.  My favorite wings are the sassy wings but the sweet ones were good too. I thought the people working the counter were very helpful and very friendly.  I also liked the vibe of this place.  It felt like a small neighborhood spot where people could hang out.  The counter guy told me they were actually slow due to the weather so I'd hate to see what this place might be like when it gets warmer.  My guess would be to prepare for a wait. All in all, this was definitely an experience that defines the Chicago experience.  This place is a must visit in my book.
I had the Buddha Bowl with beef.  It was huge and amazing.  This is a great place for a quick lunch.

I do not get hype of this place. The wings are at best average. I could understand if the prices were a steal and hence the popularity. But, again, this is chicago. This place cant even compare to something that is just mediocore in new york like bonchon. Great sea has much better wings in my opinion.

EAT MORE CHICKEN. Wow I went here upon a recommendation of a friend. I was a little blown away by price of 8.95 for 5 wings. Until I received my plate, WOW! They were the whole wing and they were BIG. Amazingly big. They were tasty and juicy.  Defiantly a must. Staff was great,  service was prompt.  The rest rooms were clean  Eat more chicken!

Crisp is an amazing place. The chicken wings alone could be worthy of a 5 star rating.  The space is small and it's very hard to get a seat during regular dining times. Their delivery range is also a bit limited for such an accomplished place. These two factors are why I went with 4 stars for Crisp.  The dishes aren't very traditional but that's not why you come here. The chicken wings are so good they are in a category and league of their own. The kimchi is pretty good too. It's a win win!

My boyfriend was researching the best korean places to eat in Chicago and this place popped up along with the claim that Crisp has the best chicken in town. Obviously, we had to check it out.  No lie. It was the best chicken I have ever put in my mouth. The meat itself was cooked to perfection, but it was the sauces that just pushed the flavor through the roof! One of the sauces definitely seemed to have gochujang base. The heat was intense, but I couldn't stop eating it!  The cashier was very friendly and chatted with us while we waited for our order. He made us feel very welcome. I will definitely go back the next time I am in town.

I'm a huge fan of Korean inspired chicken wings so I was excited to try Crisp while in town. The restaurant is a bit smaller than we expected, but luckily we were able to grab stool seats on the side. My friends and I decided to share half Seoul Sassy wings, half of spicy Crisp BBQ wings and a side of fries. So much flavor and sauce and soooo delicious. The BBQ wings are a bit spicy so make sure you have an acquired taste for that. I would recommend tons of napkins by your side because you're going to want to wipe your hands after every wing (unless you're a finger licker like me). I really enjoyed the wings here and would stop by again if I'm in Chicago again.

Bad boy buddha bowl- come to mama. Very delicious (but a little modernized) bimbimbap bowls. I haven't tried the chicken yet but I'm sure that I would love it. (Fried chicken gives me life.) Both sauces they have also give me life. Atomic sauce and then the traditional regular dark maroon sauce are both great additions to the bowl. Don't eat or drink ANYTHING PRIOR to coming here. I promise you, a bowl will be more than enough. You can honestly probably just share with someone but people will stare and judge you if you do (like me, kinda). Prepare to sit at a picnic style table next to strangers. It gets packed. The only problem was- I got a bad stomach ache that lasted the entire following day including the next day after I ate my leftovers. (I tried to say it wasn't from this, but it may have. EXCEPT IT WON'T STOP ME from still coming here.)

I don't know why all the positive reviews here? this place is so mediocre, the BBQ wings ($8.95 for 5 pieces) were just ok nothing so special at all, the fries ($3.50) were nothing but greasy crap that i ended up throwing in the trash, the red sauce they have on the counters that looks like ketchup taste so nasty.....i mean come on !!! .... if you are a kid you might like this place but if you know what real good food is you wont.

Causal small place in the heart of Lincoln Park. The wigs here are the best in the city. They come with the drumlette and wing so when ordering, keep in mind 5 wings really means 10.  My favorite is the Sassy Seoul. Some people like the BBQ but I always go back for the Sassy. Everything else on the menu is just ok, I never order anything else after making this mistake the first time. The only exemption to this is their Buddha bowls, they are large bowls with rice and vegetables and meats and are larger portions.  This place is BYOB, communal seating can make it hard to find a seat at times, but you can always take it up Broadway to a bar and eat it there.  Pair this with their amazing wings and sauce, and we have a winner on our hands. Word of warning, they deliver, but I kept hearing that this makes the wings not as crispy so I have only eaten at their location.

One of my favorite Korean wings places! Huge chicken and delicious sauces! Usually really busy but since the turn around is quick you can usually get seats pretty quickly. The bim bim bop is pretty typical and not too special. But you go here for the chicken wings anyways! Small and can use a little update on its interior but food is one point!

The absolute best wings I ever tasted, I was not a fan of jumbo wings until I tried this place. Though the place is small, and you may have to wait a little while for you food, It is worth the wait. The staff is very friendly and they give you very good portions, it's worth the wait and your money.

This place is great. I usually get the Foodie's Choice Crisp sandwich. You can't go wrong though, everything I have had has been delicious. It is BYOB, but they also have a huge/interesting selection of sodas for purchase. The service is always friendly. Delivery is slow, but usually the food comes in about an hour. Eating in can be a gamble during peak hours since it gets very crowded, but to go is always a safe bet.

Hands down, most delicious wings in Chicago. I mean seriously, I've never had anything better. If I could have crisp wings, wing stop ranch, and a margarita from Cesar's killers that's down the block, I would be in heaven!
Not a fan of chicken but their sauce is really good (Seoul Sassy) and they have Melona bars ^_^ their bowls are so amazing (Seoul bowl) but it's a little pricey when you're on a budget.

Crisp is amazing! I've visited this restaurant a couple of times and I have yet to be disappointed. Even though the restaurant is small in size it's still big enough to accommodate an adequate amount of people.  The food here is really great! The employees are very nice and give you great advice on what to eat. The chicken is definitely delicious and they have a variety of different types of Korean fried chicken. (I recommend either the crisp bbq or the Seoul Sassy)  they offer oriental styled sides like "Bon chon" and regular American sides as well like fries and onion rings.  I'd say this restaurant would be a great place to try for lunch break at work or a small date.  Crisps is great and it gets two thumbs up from me  I highly recommend this spot and if you don't like it you probably have issues.
These wings are the best.  My favorite are the Seoul Sassy, but all of them are awesome.  The buddha bowls are always great - lot's of fresh veggies.

Constantly packed through out the day and for good reason! Their portions are great for the price and quality and perfect for sharing to try many different menu items! My boyfriend and I ordered the 5 wings with the Seoul Sassy sauce and the Baby Buddha bowl. The sauce was very delicious and the chicken wings were moist on the inside and wonderfully crispy on the outside-perfect combination! The Baby Buddha bowl was a good call as it helped to balance out all the meat with the rice and Del opus veggies. Both items were fantastic! I will definitely be back to try the other sauces and bowls!

Take me back to Chicago! It was my first time trying Korean Fried Chicken and I love it! I tried the Seoul Sassy and Crisp BBQ, but Seoul Sassy was my favorite. It was so crispy and delicious. The place is extremely packed, we had to go our order because there was only 3-4 tables.  Ugh I wish I could eat it right now as I type this review, but there's no Korean Fried Chicken in Portland that I'm aware of.
All the yes!! Huge portions, tasty gigantic wings, awesome concept, and reasonable prices. Definitely ordered more than we could eat but it was totally worth it

Their sauces are one-and-only in the world. The tiny restaurant is packed seven days every week. It's CRAZY! The only downside for me is the location. It's just too far for me. Otherwise, I will go and dine there every single day!
Pretty delicious fried chicken. The spicy korean variety is great.

BEST KFC (Korean Fried Chicken) EVER! It's a rather small restaurant so you may have to wait around a little in order to snag a table or take your order to go...but I honestly don't know if I could resist digging into these wings for that long! Our party of four ordered the 10 whole wings (half Seoul Saucy and half Crisp BBQ), boneless wings, rice, and a side of fries. The wings were HUGE. Definitely felt like it was a bargain for the price we paid. The wings were extra crisp/crunchy and flavorful. The fries were pretty good as well! They were crispy, thinly cut fries. My favorite kind of fries. Nom. Oh! The bimibap (rice bowls) also looked quite delicious and rather large!  If I were to come back to Chicago, this definitely would be one of the top places I would make sure to revisit!
One of my favorite Korean Fried Chicken joints in town. A little pricey but worth the trip. My favorite is the barbecue chicken.

I don't usually eat wings but I am always down to have Crisp's wings. They deserve all the hype they get, the place is almost always packed. The chicken is cooked very tender and the sauce is amazing. I almost always get the Seoul Sassy. The buddha bowls are a tasty way to get some veggies with your wings.  Two thumbs way up!

Can't believe the high marks that this restaurant has. The chicken simply does not compare to even chain restaurants like Bon Chon. To top it off, the rice was extremely mushy and the sauces were not impressive. Overall, can't believe that this place is in business let alone has a line out the door when they can't even nail down cooking rice! Extremely disappointed and a waste of time and money. If you are from anywhere with a significant Korean population (ie. Northern VA, New York/New Jersey, Los Angeles/Orange County) prepare to be disappointed!

It's Crisp, what else is there to say. By now, this place is a local staple and it's pretty much a must-try for anyone who eats meat. Their Bi Bim Bop + Soul Sassy Fried Chicken are epic and second to none. Stop in for some seriously delicious food - you won't regret it.
Five Stars! By far the best korean chicken I've had. Great spot. Average price. Big servings.
It was good!  I liked the flavor profiles.  Good for fast korean BBQ!
The wings here are so flavorful. Maybe a little bit too salty but they have the homemade ranch that balance it out. They called it the atomic sauce or something

I've only gotten takeout from here because it's literally SO crowded anytime I pass by. The environment is a little off-putting because of the hoards of people but don't let that scare you away. These people know what they are doing when it comes to chicken. The fries were overly salty (which I didn't know could be a bad thing, but it surprisingly was). The buffalo is not overly spicy but it is pretty heavy on the breading.

By far one of the best fried chicken wings meals I've ever had. Got the 10 wings (plenty for one person) and had it made half sassy and half bbq. Try the fries with the pink sauce on the table and it'll make a great combination with wings. Can't wait to return.

I could have sworn i had reviewed this place before. Its a great spot. My wife and I moved to the area from Florida and on our first day of looking for an apt we stopped in and fell in love with Crisp (no we live just down the street on diversey). The wings are sooo good. I always get the sassy seoul and they are delicious.  Remember to order 5 if you want 10 because they come as a whole wing. Its messy but so worth it. The only downside is that its always crowded but if that is the worst you can say about a restaurant then thats pretty good. all the tables are community style but even then they are always packed.  definitely worth checking out.

This is my second time back to Chicago and my second time getting the wings here.  They are just that good.  10 Wing don't sound like much but they are huge and it's the entire wing so it's really 20 wings.  The sauces are great, especially the sassy seoul.  They come out super crispy and they are delicious. I am not a big fan of the bimbimbap though.  However, I do live really close to true korea town in LA and have the authentic stuff anyday.  So my idea of what bimbimbap should be like is of a much higher standard.

5 stars for the FANTASTIC wings. The wings are positively delicious. I've brought friends & family here & they all unanimously love them. The wings are large and perfectly sauced. Gotta love the Seoul Sassy sauce! If you're craving wings this i

Love their wings. I like how they give you the whole wing (including the leg). The flavors they have is pretty bold but good. I got the 5 wings plus a baby buddha (Small bibimbap) this was shared between 2 people. We were both full.
It's a little expensive for wings, but the flavor is good.  Sauces are the best part.  I wish the wings weren't so big, not a fan of huge wings.  The bi bim bop is ave
YUM!! I love the chicken wings!

The spicy BBQ is the best sauce for sure. Just the right amount of sweet and spicy. The wings are so ridiculous, perfectly crisp and the right amount of seasoning. Portions are huge. One "wing" is basically 2. Love this place

When I was visiting my friend in Chicago a few years back, she took me here. Now every time I make it to Chicago, I make sure to come back to Crisp.  This place has the BEST Korean Fried Chicken, I've ever tried. The Seoul Sassy fried chicken wings are soooo good, I sometimes daydream about them when I'm in San Diego. The wings have this amazing sweet garlicky sauce on them and they are fried to perfection. Also they give you a good portion sized wing, which I greatly appreciated.  If you need a little veggies to round out your meat overload, try the original bad boy Buddha!  Seriously wish they would open up a restaurant in California!
I love their crispy wings, it's always crispy never greasy. Pair it up with a veggie rice bowl for a very satisfying meal for 2.

Crisp is where it's at! Love getting the buffalo chicken sandwich. Chicken is always juicy and the sauce is always on point. The atmosphere and people are great as well! Only flaw would be the wait time and crammed seating. Just make sure to order ahead of time to pick up.

Holy moly! What can I say that hasn't already been said? The bowls are phenomenal, as are the wings, but the sandwich is probably the most delish thing I've ever eaten! The only bad thing is, I live in Orlando and will be craving this for months to come.

Been waiting to have crisp for two years! I am a total wing person. So happy I was able to satisfy my craving after two years of waiting. They absolutely did not disappoint me.  My favorite flavors were the Seoul sassy & Bbq. We also tried the bad boy Buddha added steak & substitute white rice for brown rice. Thanks crips !

YES. BEST KOREAN FRIED CHICKEN WINGS EVER. My boyfriend and I were in the neighborhood a couple of months ago (okay, we're not from here--we're from California), and our lovely Airbnb hosts referred us to this place which is right around the corner from their apartment. It was the first meal we had within a couple of hours of getting off the plane. I can't even begin to tell you how extremely flavorful the wings are. It's so crispy, so good--so juicy. I'm salivating just thinking about them now. Also--very generous portions! They don't skimp out on the sizes. I thought I could handle 10 wings or so and fries, but I was so wrong. I would've been happy with just the wings (which I was).  I dreamt about these wings for the next week during our stay in Chicago. So the night before we left, you know we had to come back. :)  TL; DR: I'm writing this review back in California, and I'm still dreaming about the day I'll get to have these chicken wings again. That's really all you need to know.

Crisp! What happened?! I'm hoping this was a fluke...I got some Seoul Sassy wings to share with my cousin who was visiting and they were soggy! Definitely not "crisp" like they usually are. I really talked up the wings and my cousin was like, "Umm, yeah, these aren't very good." Like I said, hoping it was a fluke!
This place rocks - get the wings and the bowl and you won't be disappointed. Seating is tight so try and find a spot when you get in. Also, I can't believe it's byob. Definitely a must go

This is my go-to place when I need to bring food to a function, and they're always a hit. Seoul sassy sauce is perfectly sweet and salty, and the Buddha bowls help me feel like I'm staying healthy. 1 "wing" is actually all 3 pieces of the wing, so it's like you're getting 10 pieces when you only ordered 5. Overall, great bang for your buck! Word to the wise, seating area is small and tables are communal, but they make for great take out and/or delivery.

Great food and service. Plus its BYOB! Friendly staff. Easy to order and despite how busy were when we came on a Saturday at 6pm, food came out quick.  My 2nd time there and I got the SEOUL STEAK BOWl again.  Meat is very tender and generous portions.  This time I tried the wings- very food flavor and plenty of meat on them.  Food was enjoyed by all. Cons -cramped interior space.  I was whacked in the breast by someone as I stood in line.  People don't pay attention to limited space, I.e. 2 people walking side by side toward me in very narrow aisle. Lack of manners from other patrons! Very limited seating, 3 of us had to stand to eat by spot meant for one person.  They surely need to expand to another building soon.

Came here with a friend for dinner. We both were craving comfort food and few things are more comforting than korean fried chicken. Especially chicken wings drenched in seoul sassy sauce!! I had ordered 5 wings with seoul sassy sauce and a baby buddah bowl. First off, the wings here are HUGE (they keep the wing and drumette parts attached)! I could only eat 2 of the 5 had had to take the rest home. The wings are very greasy, but that's not a bad thing. The seoul sassy sauce is delicious- savory and sweet! I personally can't justify only eating wings as a meal, so the baby buddah bowl was a welcome addition. I had four different types of veggies in my bowl (bean sprouts, carrots, spinach, and zucchini) and a fried egg with rice. Not the best bim bim bop I've ever had, but it's decent.  I would not recommend coming here with a large group as seating here is hard to get, especially if you come here during peak times. I had ordered my food to go, and sat in the waiting area until I saw some seats open up. The staff here are super friendly and just generally a happy bunch, which I think brightened an otherwise cold and dreary day. For me personally, BonChon in NYC is the standard for korean fried chicken (I've been spoiled), but Crisp puts up a good fight!

This is the only place I've had Korean bbq but it is the best Korean bbq I've ever had! The steak bowl is full of flavor. The wings are okay. I also really enjoyed the chicken bowl. I lived right down the street and would come here all the time. Love Crisp!

This place is soooo bomb! I'm Korean, grew up with authentic Korean food, and thought this place might not suit my tastes too well... Wrong! I got introduced to this place by a couple who lives within walking distance to here. I'm absolutely addicted and have got all my friends addicted as well. "Woah! That smells sooo good! What is it? Can I try one?" (5 seconds later, all gone...) The kimchi is also fantastic. Totally authentic. It's great that they deliver. We probably order a good 30-40 wings at least 1-3 times a week, if not more. Lol. Seoul Sassy 4 Life!

Omg. Just found a Korean gem in the city. I ordered their Bad boy Buddha with 8 veggies and has the beef Bulgogi with it. The flavor and serving is amazing. Very very value for money! I heard their wings are good too however in already so full with the rice bowl. This is my new go to place for Korean food.

I know why this place have so much reviews now. Cuz its one of the best chicken wangz i have eaten. I wish i had it at its full potential when its fresh out the kitchen, but we were on a time crunch and had to get it togo and it cooled down.

Yooo if you don't like this place you're legit tweeking. Actually, I probably can't take you serious as an eater if you review Crisp anything under four stars. Straight up. Sure, the tables are kinda dirty, sure the music isn't that good and yeah the service could be a tad better - but the dudes at register are probably mad stressed out seeing how they deal with 24/7 rushes. I totally feel them. Just went the other day and ordered a half of crisp bbq and a half of seoul sassy...dont bother asking me which I liked more, I don't really remember because I almost fainted from how delicious these things were. My buddy and I ordered a side of onion rings and a side of fried mushrooms to go along with our wings, it was a whooooole lotta food. Def enough for 3 people, but we eat like horses so nothing went to waste. To be honest I love what Crisp is doing. Quality fast eating at a extremely reasonable price. Only complaint is that the drinks are behind the direction you face in line and you can easily forget to order drinks with your food (because the dudes at the register don't offer you a drink) which means you have to get back in line just to pay for a can of pop. C'mon guys I wanna give you my money, just remind me!! Other than that this place is really banging. Parking obviously sucks, I mean it's Lincoln Park for goodness sake, but the food is worth it X 100.
Oh, Crisp, I love you so. Perfectly fried chicken with robust and delicious sauces. Some of the best french fries in the city to boot. Hugely recommended.

Crisp is so freakin' good! Every time! Get the seoul sassy 5 whole wings and you won't be disappointed. AMAZING. That's all. Only bad thing: Not enough seating in there, so go at a weird time (as opposed to right at lunch hour, or at 5-6pm). It's always packed!

1 star is solely for unfortunate planning / service on Crisp's part.  Hours before Super Bowl start, phone off the hook - a busy signal, no online ordering and then after taking a trip to their restaurant, a 'no wings' sign on the door. Many of us turned away.  Quiet restaurant.  Would be easier to understand if it were their first year.
I like the foodies choice sandwich, I would get again. The wings were good too. Typing this out actually makes me want some, right now..

To the owners. Really good food, terrible customer service. I walked up to the register and was ignored, then the kid at the register finally looked up and said he couldn't help me I had to go to another register. There are more things to a business than a good recipe.  Someone else that respects their customers will come in at take some customers from these kids. Your food is great. That's half the battle.

Incredibly amazing food. I can't believe it's taken me this long to discover this place. Wings out of this world. Korean BBQ without the hassle of actually going to a Korean BBQ place and emerging with your clothes smelling like a grease pit.

Crisp has some of the best chicken wings and sauces I have ever tried. Their original Crisp BBQ sauce has the perfect blend of Korean BBQ flavoring! I highly recommend this place to any and all chicken wing fans!
Crisp is great for meat eaters and veggies. i usually get the Buddha Bowl. It a great Korean place to get take out or sit in (limited seating). They also have great shoestring french fries.

Have had the amazing food at Crisp before-this time took my 83 year old Korean dad, who has heard of-but never tried Korean fried chicken. LOVED IT!!! Ordered chicken tenders (Seoul Sassy), People's Greens, Kimchee and Seoul Steak Bowl. Great quality. He'll want to come back! Umm, but on a side note--you guys need to expand! Thanks Crisp!!

Ordered delivery and when the chicken all arrived, it was extremely over fried. The chicken was so dry and practically shriveled up. It was quite disappointing because in the past, it was always good better. I'm still not a favorite of any wings where they don't cut the tips off. To me, its not edible and its not food. Everything else is pretty good.

I don't have a whole lot to add to what everyone else has said.  The wings are quite large (they are both jumbo sized and double wings) and the crisp bbq sauce is delicious and unique.  Veggies are also quite good.  Only downside is that the restaurant isn't big enough given its popularity.  We waited for 30 minutes to find somewhere to sit.

The wings are very good, I'm just not a fan of the wing being served whole. Why can't they be separated? They're not more attractive when whole, there's less surface area to be crisped and sauced, and if you're sharing 5 whole wings, split would be 10 pieces...even number, more easily shareable between 2 ppl. Just saying

I'm shocked that people are saying this place has better wings than LA. The KFC tasted like typical Asian sauce you find in the US market. Maybe they're not going for authenticity, but I've had better wings. I'll still come and eat here when I'm craving bibimbap. It's just not the best bibimbap (or buddha bowl) you can get. However, it's fast and convenient, so I can't really complain. I just strongly disagree with people who are saying this is the best KFC or chicken ever.
