If you are in Chicago, I do recommend visitors to check it out since it's very popular with locals.

Everyone raves about this place so I finally went to check it out. I ordered the foodies choice sandwich with bbq sauce and fries. The chicken was crispy and super saucy without being soggy. BBQ has a nice kick to it but not too spicy. So good - will definitely go back!

I found bugs crawling on the styrofoam container in the restaurant when I went and got my pick up order.  It was gross.  They may have the best fried chicken in town, but I am so grossed out by the crawling bugs that I am throwing away $30 of chicken.

Finally, finally got the chance to head to Crisp earlier this week! My friend and I ordered two half birds (one Seoul Sassy, one Crisp BBQ), and fries for around $20, which isn't a bad deal. The restaurant is small though and it can be hard to snag seating.  Fries - skip. Not worth it. They're very average. The chicken though - very good. I personally preferred Seoul Sassy, because while it was a soy ginger sweeter sauce, I thought it was light and I could eat it for days. Crisp BBQ is a little sweeter and definitely packed a bit of heat, so I'd recommend it for people looking for something a bit heavier. Overall, enjoyed both, can't really go wrong. If you're a fan of Korean fried chicken or just fried chicken in general, you should definitely hit up Crisp.

I totally don't dig this place....which seems bizarre because it seems like everyone in Chicago is obsessed. I've given it a few shots but it always seems sub par. I think it may be because I eat Korean over on Foster Ave all the time so I am spoiled when it comes to spicy real Korean Bi bim bop. The Buddha bowl waa pretty soggy and lacked flavor and good spice. Traditional Bi bim bop is served in a stone bowl so the rice gets super crispy- its the best part! Definitely not the place for an authentic Bi bim Bop rice bowl, but the Kimchi is actually.pretty dang good!

Absolutely delicious. Wings were cooked perfectly. I tried ALL the sauces and ALL were excellent. My favorite was the sassy sauce... It is ridiculous... My #1 pick for wings for any occasion. Anytime I have the craving for wings, I think Crisp.
One of the best places in the area... Food is really good, and delicious...!!! The fried chicken is out of the world, and the Korean bowls are high quality.!!

I came here with my boyfriend on a Saturday to escape the cold. I'm a huge fan of all types of Asian food and had been wanting to come here for a while. The Restaurant was pretty busy, and we had to wait a few minutes to be able to grab a seat. I ordered the big boy Buddha bowl, and my boyfriend got the crisp bbq wings. The wings were good, could have been a little spicier though. The bowl was just ok. I kind of wish I would have added some meat to it. It seemed to be lacking sauce and flavor- though I did enjoy the abundance of veggies! I think we'll come back here and try different menu items next time.

Absolutely delicious. I was in the area and it popped up on Yelp as I was getting hungry and I gave it a chance.  Wings are crispy and flavorful and their bibimbap is excellent and authentic. You can't go wrong.  That's it. There's nothing left to say.

Highly recommend! My girlfriend and I split the big boy Buddha Bowl and 5 wings. Half Sassy Soul and half Crisp BBQ. Both were great Crisp BBQ was a little more spicy and saucey. Sassy soul was a dry rub, which I liked better. The wings are whole wings (The drumstick and wing combined).
Crisp is dilicious.l like chicken korean.Sauce is good.I promise I will back again.Yummy

What a winner! We came in to crisp on a road to try a bunch of stuff on our day off.  I've been hearing about it for a long time, but never could convince anyone to come along - I should have tried harder as Crisp is delicious! There isn't a ton of Indoor seating here but tables are very wide and sharable between 2 parties of 3.  After ordering (quick and easy, btw) they bring your food out to the table for you. We ordered the Badboy Buddha bowl, 5 Seol sassy, 5 BBQ, and 5 buffalo spicy wings (everything but plain). The Badboy Buddha was very well presented and had a ton of different veggies - even though they all carry a similar pickled flavor they all have a special zing and texture.  Mixing in some of the Buddha sauce (a little like kimchi sauce) was tasty, but the white sauce was what really brought a ton of flavor to the party.  From the looks of it you can't go wrong for the price and taste on any of the bowls. The wings were all awesome.  They are huge too - so huge in-fact that my SO exclaimed "Why did you order 10?!" when they were bringing them to the table.  The orders are all wings and no drumsticks - but they include an extra piece of the wing that most places don't.  This makes your order of 5 wings much more like everybody else's 10.  I'm a bit of a wing aficionado and these had perfect breading, were perfectly cooked, and had delicious (though not too wild) sauces.  The sassy sauce is understated but sweet and tasty, BBQ is sweet but not really smokey (which works perfectly here), and the buffalo spicy were just the right amount of vinegar and spice - but if you like 'em really spicy you may want to go to the highest level. No doubt these are some of the best prepared and best tasting wings I've had. The drink selection looks really nice here with many sodas, flavored coconut waters, and it even sounded like someone ordered a mixed drink. With food like this Crisp when from on my list to way up my chart - I can't wait to go back for more!

Wamo! Crisp is just delicious. I ordered the three piece boneless strip with Seoul Sassy sauce. It was my lucky day because they were either feeling generous or goofed and I ended up with five pieces. Those crispy little critters were fried to perfection. And on top of that the flavor was tasty. Say you're a person that likes to add a little flair to their sauce, they have plenty of bottle with different sauces that you can drench your food in. The place can be bumpin so if you have a big group you're gonna have to try and magically get a table together. And it may not be the fastest service ever but you'll get over it because it's delicious.
The best Korean chicken joint hands down in Chicagoland area. Everything there is amazing!!!

We visited in November during our family trip to Chicago.  There is a lot of hype, I thought the food was just okay.  I got the baby bowl, honestly, there wasn't a lot of flavor, I expected more spice.  I added the sauce, and expected more spice. The wings were good.  They do provide huge portions, so we brought some back home.  Worth giving this place a try, you might like it.

- the wings are larger than life - I came in for a sampling of what's said to be the best Korean fried chicken in the city. It is a small mom & pop style restaurant with community seating and plenty of paper towels. The food: the beef bowl was hearty and more than enough for two people. The WINGS! Yes they are huge... Easily the biggest wing I've had and priced at $10 for 5 it's comparable in price  to that of an order at Buffalo Wild Wings with a flavor that puts B-dubs to shame!  Try to avoid prime hours as it gets busy

I give it 4 stars and not 5 because of the seating situation. The food was really phenomenal. I had a chicken rice bowl and it was amazing. huge portion too! unfortunately, it's self seating and what's even worse is that u end up sitting at a table with a bunch of people you don't know because it's a free for all. I would recommend pick up and going to eat it somewhere else honestly.
Arguably the best wings around. Plus, Buddha Bowls if you want to eat healthy. The only problem with Crisp is that there isnt one in each neighborhood.

The reviews on this place are right - they have really, really good wings. They are breaded, sauce is applied liberally, and then topped with chopped green onions. Some things to consider: 1. One wing here is the flat and the drum, so like two wings anywhere else. Still a little more expensive than other places, though. 2. Seating - it is limited. Some picnic benches, some bar stools by the wall or window, and that is it 3. Of the sauce, I don't really find the buffalo anything too special, but I haven't gotten up the courage to try suicidal yet. The Seoul Sassy is very good, although not too hot. They have some spicier sauces on the tables, though. 4. If you go at peak hours, it will be packed. If you go at off peak hours, it will be crowded still. Get the fried chicken. Avoid the the 'buddha bowls' (a bibimbop). They always have a puddle of water at the bottom for me.

Seoul Sassy Sauce FTW! I tried the Crisp BBQ and it was good but not as delectable as the flavor on their signature sauce. 5 Whole Wings is a decent sized dinner if you're not looking to overstuff yourself. They serve the entire wing unlike what you'd get at, let's say, Buffalo Wild Wings. 10 wings is appropriate for those with a big appetite or if you like taking home leftovers. I'd love to try their bibimbap bowls as we noticed about half the patrons ordering that as well. If you have a large group keep in mind that there is limited seating. Most of the seating consists of large picnic style tables (the rest is stool seating across wall/window) so don't be surprised if you're getting cozy with some strangers. Worth the hype!

Do not underestimate the size of the wings, they are huge! Love the choice of flavors and i'm sure they would be amazing with a side of rice. Gets pretty busy so if you have a big party it might be kind of tough. Parking also might be kind of hard but don't worry there a ton of other businesses in the area you can check out too.

I don't think this is worth the hype. I ordered this as a delivery, we ordered the Seoul Sassy and BBQ wings as well as the steak bowl. I thought the bowl was the best part but overall, just kinda meh. With all the delicious things to eat in Chicago, I probably will never return here

Rated as a top spot for wings in Chicago, I had to see for myself. I was working in the area so it was perfect timing for me to check this place out for lunch.  Parking is tight. Goodluck there! The restaurants space is small, w/a few communal tables. When you walk in you don't know who's ordered or who's in line to order, but everyone that you ask is friendly and usher you to the front. They have large plastic menus, with pricey options. 5 wings are $10. They do offer Yelper's who check in a whole chicken for $21.99. The employees are very friendly and helpful. The cashier advised me things to try as a newbie. I ordered the 5pc- 2 wings plain and 3 wings spicy. It took about 10mins for the order to be completed. I got them to go because the place was packed at 12:30pm with nowhere to sit. Got them to the car and they were nice and fresh. The wings are a decent size. The plain ones weren't anything special, they had a decent crunch, but no seasoning at all. The spicy were tasty and not too hot. But I wasn't WOWED. It definitely wasn't worth $10. I hate I didn't get the seo soul flavor, maybe another time.
I ordered plain whole chicken. It was ok but I expected to be more fresh and crispy from the review. The chicken was like fried two time. I don't like it.

Crisp probably serves the best Korean fried chicken I've ever had! We ordered 5 wings in the Seoul sassy and a foodie's choice crisp sandwich.The exterior of the wings are deliciously crispy and the insides juicy and moist. The sauce smacks you in the face with a nice balance of sweetness, tanginess, and heat. We chose the Seoul sassy sauce for the chicken sandwich as well. This sandwich was a flavor bomb! It's a deep fried fillet of chicken breast glazed in the seoul sassy sauce (you can pick) topped off with baby spinach, tomato, crumbled bleu cheese, bacon, mayonnaise and Allison's Atomic Sauce served between a split-top roll. The wings here are quite large; so the 5 wings and sandwich actually filled the two of us up pretty well. Can't wait to come back the next time I visit Chicago!

WOW! The wings are good. Big portion wings compared to Bdubs and the Seoul sauce was amazing - would highly recommend. I only wish that they would have more spacious seating, but the food is way worth. It's really fun if you have a decent size group on a slow day and order a bunch of wings. I had out of towners, and we all agreed that the wings are amazing!  Parking isn't too bad, but overall, love this palce!

Crisp has been on my "list" for a few years now. After finally getting a chance to dine there I can say all they hype is well deserved. This place is AMAZING! We were there for lunch. There are only a few tables inside however we must have arrived at a good time as we were able to get a table right away. We did have to park a couple of blocks away as this is a busy area of town. The short walk was needed after all the food we ate. Since no one in our group had eaten here before they asked me to order. Yes! We pretty much ordered the menu. We had 3 orders of their wings, 2 of their boneless wings, a couple of bowls and a burrito. Oh my goodness. The boneless wings are pretty good but their wings are the best wings I have had outside of MN. I really love D Spot in MN as those are my favorite wings. The wings at Crisp are 1-A. My favorite is their Seoul Sassy which is an Asian type wing with garlic, soy and ginger. Their Plain Jane is their base seasoned wing which is still very good. Then their Crisp BBQ is their Korean BBQ which is a bit spicy with a little sweet. They also have a Buffalo sauce that we were not interested in trying. The wings here are giant. I don't wanna know the size of the chicken these came from. They are extremely crispy yet the inside is juicy and flavorful. We also had a couple of their bowls. The Steak and Chicken bowl. The steak is tender Bulgogi with perfectly cooked sticky rice. The chicken is all white meat again with white rice. Both of these were so good. My wife who does not eat much beef unless its hamburger was eating those bowls because the meat was so tender and tasty. The burrito we ordered was bigger than Chipotle's and had fresh crunchy vegetables to go along with some of that outstanding meat. We ate until we were full then spent time picking at the delicious food while we waited for the rest of our party to finish. We loved everything and have even returned and got some food to go a few days later. This is a popular place for take out too. As were were finishing our meal all the tables were full and there was a line out the door, so we did arrive at the right time. Service was fast and friendly. We love to try new places but this is definitely a place that we will make several return trips to.

For all the great review, I was thinking it would be better than it was. I mean believe me it was good, but it was expecting more I guess. The chicken was delicious, not too dry, amount of sauce was just right. I'm not a big fan seaseme seed, mostly because they use ALOT of it.  Service was good. You just go to the back of the restaurant and order your food. You can wait to pick up your good but I would suggest go to find seating because that's where you'll have a slight problem since they are so small. Food will come in a tray and you find a seat and enjoy.  The place itself is nice. Small and cozy. Seating is limited, you really have to just sit anywhere you can find a spot. Not recommended for big party but perfect for a couple. Shouldn't have problem finding seating for just 2 people. Also, after you are done eating you should get up and leave so others can sit. They are pretty busy, so people will just stare at you if you just sit there chilling.    Overall, food is good. Just didn't wow me. But I think it's partly  bias since I've been to Korea at least 5 times and love their fried chicken.
So so yummy!!! My favorite chicken sandwich!!! Only wish that food didn't take so long to be ready because I'm usually there on a lunch break- but to be fair, it's because it's always busy.

Alright. This was the first place I ever had Korean chicken wings and at the time I thought they were the best chicken wings I'd ever had. However, my California friends would tell me that no, this isn't the best Korean fried chicken out there - I just haven't seen enough of the world yet. Well you know what, I live in California now, I've had the Korean fried chicken in California at multiple places, and Crisp still ranks at the top of my list. The other good asian fried chicken place in Chicago is Great Seas up on Lawrence, but their wings are a little different. They have lollipop wings that are delicious.  A couple of tips for coming here:  First of all, I always get a split of the Seoul Sassy and the Crisp BBQ. In my opinion, these are their two best sauces. The Crisp BBQ is spicy and the Seoul Sassy balances it out so your mouth doesn't stay on fire. I'd recommend that you get a split of the different types of wings so that you can try different ones. You can even split the 5 wing order into different sauces if you want - if I remember correctly.  If you're not a chicken wing person, you can opt for the whole chicken/half chicken. You get pieces of chicken other than chicken wings, like drums, thighs etc. They're just as good to me, though there is something very satisfying about eating a giant chicken wing. You can split the sauces for these too and try different sauces. This place is usually very crowded so if you come with a big group, I'd come either early or late so you can get a seat. Otherwise, you're left staring sadly at each other while you eat your chicken wings and sit apart in whatever section of the restaurant is empty.  Don't let your eyes be bigger than your stomach. An order of 5 chicken wings with other stuff, like the bowls and fries is usually enough for two people. These chicken wings are enormous.  For people who like boneless chicken, this is probably not the place for you. One of my best friends likes only boneless chicken and it wasn't nearly as good as the bone-in stuff. If you want boneless chicken go check out this place in Assi Plaza in Niles - called Do Re HoDoo DooRe Chicken. I know the name is funny but they do boneless Korean chicken right.  I've had other things at Crisp, including their bowls and their fries. I usually get the baby buddha bowl with beef and it's a nice side to the chicken wings, as well as fries. But let's get it straight, the chicken wings are the star of the show. If you don't like chicken wings and just get the sides, you will probably be disappointed with this place. But if you like chicken wings, I'm almost 100% sure you will greatly enjoy your meal here.

I think I died and went to heaven.  Yes that good.   I tried the Seoul Sassy and Crisp BBQ and both were amazingly delicious.  Crisp is a small casual spot with wings with an Asian twist.  When I first got here and saw the menu thinking, "Uh, this is kind of expensive for wings."  However when we got the order we were not disappointed.  First of all, aesthetically the wings were humungous.  It's like one wing was equivalent to two wings (at BWW or Hooters or Wing Stop or insert wing place here).  And once you bit into your wing you get a delectable flavor of Seoul and Sassy and BBQ in your mouth.  You'll absolutely love it.  The fries were fries, nothing special on them, but fries are a must when with a group of people.  The sauces were so good I had to take some home and call it my souvenir.  Sadly, if I want to come back here I have to travel over a thousand miles, but when I do come back I will be coming back here without a doubt.

Great food, interesting seating arrangement -usually a long wait. When we can deal with lack of parking and can stand to wait around for 45 mins in the area we are in. Keep track of your order though they are really busy and last time my order was given to the wrong party. It happens and we can deal with it - only happened this one time. Great food though - we love the bone in and none both amazing the sauces are to die for. Love ya Crisp! FYI not kid friendly with coats and gloves and stuff not a lot of room to store these items (and you may sit with more than one party (picnic table style) - try it in the summer - no place for a large stroller either. I am a mom and think about these things.

Meh. Everyone was nice. Ambiance was cool, but the food... Meh.  1. Steak bowl: Decent, but the Korean rice was over cooked... And the steak needed more onions. 2. The chicken was cold! How is fried chicken cold?!  Disappointed!

When this place first open it was great now now so much maybe due the fast pace they just don't care how they put out the food as long as they keep it moving! I would give it 5 stars if they want back to the basics!!

So first thing to note is 1 Korean wing= 2 big buffalo wings... We did not realize this as we ordered and ended up with enough food to cover a group twice our size... This is not an exaggeration as ppl next to us started laughing at the quantity of food that showed up at our table.   Luckily it was mostly deliciousness so no one was really complaining.  So we had the Seoul sassy and crispy bbq- both were great but the slight spicy kick of the crispy bbq won me over... Well seasoned, great crisp skin and super meaty, can't go wrong.  Also had the steak bowl and veggie bowl- didn't love the veggie bowl but we stole the egg and some the veggies from it to add to the steak bowl which made the latter pretty great. Also had a side of the magic mushrooms- the name is misleading on multiple levels, definitely skippable.  Go for what they are known for (wings) and you'll leave pretty happy.

Not impressed. Never have had plain no seasoned chicken in my life.  Per the menu they were supposed to be seasoned. The worst Harolds chicken was better than this. Need to let people know you need the sauces because the chicken is unseasoned
Ginormous wings packed full of flavor. Definitely a fan and will be back if i'm ever in Chicago again!

The food are so filling! Me and my friend ordered 5 wings Seoul sassy $8.95 and Seoul steak bowl $8.95. We were not able to finish the bowl and we tried really hard and finished all the wings. We really loved it though our stomach was not so happy hahaaha but yea, would definitely come back again. Actually, one of our friend wanted to go together but she was busy so we are planning on going back sometime next week.  We are going to get the whole chicken!!  P.s I would only come here for the wings because the bowls (bibimbap), I like them authentic in hot pot.

Eat Your Hearts Out! Crisp is located at 2940 N B'way and I live right off 3100 N B'way! Really, really convenient any time I want, which is often. I take all out of town visitors and on repeated visits they insist on Crisp at least one time, if not 2, during their visit. No need to elaborate. Yes, it is small with limited seating. However, the food outweighs any other short comings. I do not go for atmosphere or a spacious dining room. Each table is generously supplied with napkins and paper towels that you will use in abundance!
Really good korean Chicken... This place is always crowded on a friday night and the sitting/dinning area is communal sitting which can be interesting sometimes.

Crisp is a nice place. It should probably be a little bigger, granted how popular it is around 2 hours before close. It's very hard to find a place to sit unless you're by yourself, so go during non-peak hours if you don't want to wait for a table to clear.  The food itself is quite good. I've been several times, and have had the chicken with every type of sauce, the fries, the Buddha Bowl, the Bad Boy Buddha Bowl, and the plain steak bowl. No complaints about the food itself. Honestly, it is probably one of the better chicken places in the city. It's not much of a bargain unless you buy your chicken in bulk--i.e. with a group of people. The bowls are reasonably priced, for the most part.

I will be back here again for sure!!!those wings were super meaty and full of flavor...I got the crisp BBQ n my buddy got the Seoul wings...mmmmmmmm . We also got the beef bowls with brown rice that was fantastic!!

The first thing I have to say is this place is very small, expect to sit very close to people you don't know! You order in the back and they bring out your food, calling you by name. I would recommend scouting out a seat before you order so you're not stuck without a place to sit! My friend and I split the seoul sassy and crisp BBQ wings, both of which were amazing. I preferred the crisp BBQ because I liked that it was spicier, but both were equally great in their own respect. I ordered white rice as a side, which was HUGE, so definitely don't order one per person. It could probably be split between 3-4 people. We also ordered the cabbage kimchi which was good and came in a plastic bin, so I can't tell if they make it or buy it. The wings hilariously live up to the name, they are the crispiest wings I've ever eaten. They are also HUGE because they're the full wing, not just the drumstick or anything, so they're very massive and very filling. I really recommend this place if you're in the mood for some Korean street food!

I finally figured out that the key to the menu is to treat this not as a Korean fried chicken restaurant but rather as a Korean restaurant that happens to serve fried chicken on a separate track.  The Buddha Bowl is pretty good (though it needs flavor, so you need to have a heavy hand with the gochujang); the fried chicken with buffalo sauce is very good.  Just order them as separate line items and share them both with somebody.   Indeed, I might even be starting to like this place.

They're signature Crisp wings are AMAZING! A small order was enough for 2, but one person could honestly finish the serving because it's so good. They also serve a Korean melon dew ice cream which is one of my favorites, so I was able to enjoy that while waiting for my wings. Lost a star because the place is small and consistently busy, so you have to stand and eat or constantly scan the room and try to snag a table if someone else waiting already hasn't.
The chicken wings were really good. Recommend this place for snack but not for dinner.

Plain bad.  Bibimbap was so bad, we threw it in trash after a bit of tasting. Two kinds of fried chicken. Both bad. Managed to eat half of it and went to the pizza shop next door (Nancy's) which was not good either but edible...then went to Pastoral and got some munchies. Waste of time and money.
Best wings in Chicago and great for vegetarians. Order for pickup or byob but be nice, everyone is here for the food!

Korean fried chicken. So so so good.  I went with a buddy on a friday night and we had a delicious tasty meal. I went with the Seoul Sassy wings and we split some fries. The chicken was taaasty. Perfectly flavored, had a great breading, and was perfectly fried, which I respect because working with a fryer is a lot more difficult than one thinks.  Crisp is crowded and it has counter service, but somehow everything ran smoothly. We had to wait 5-10 minutes in line to order, and we were worried about finding 2 seats. But the natural flow inevitably meant that we were able to get two seats before our food was ready.  This is a great spot, as is evident by the 1,000 reviews and 4-5 star rating. I definitely recommend this place!

SOO GOOD! Crisp was one of the best if not the best thing I ate during my visit to Chicago. Saw all the rave reviews on Yelp and had to try it. The wings here are HUGE. I tried the Seoul Sassy and hot BBQ and wow they are definitely some of the best wings I've ever had. Once you bite into the hot crunchy wing and taste the explosion of flavor, your mouth will thank you. You know a place is good when while you are eating you are already thinking about how you want to come back here and eat it again. I need to find a place like this in L.A. Thankfully they sell their wing sauce so I decided to get two orders of it for the flight home. Made it at home and it is just as good. Love it. I need to ration it as I will be very sad once I run out. Definite recommend from me. Go now!

We were very disappointed with our last order. The supply of large wings must have dried up as our wings were very common, both in taste and size. $30 for 10 wings, fries, and onion rings? Simply not worth the price.

Wings!!!! Don't even waste your time ordering anything else. I personally like the Spicy bbq better. They have a ton of sauce options. Be sure to ask for extra sauce for your fries. Oh yeah, order fries with the wings!

Oh my god. This place is literally the best. I was in the area with a friend and I decided to try this place.  I ordered the Seoul Sassy and Plain Jane chicken wings, but they accidentally gave us Crisp BBQ instead of the plain ones. But that was the happiest accident ever. They eventually gave us the plain ones and it was delicious. Seoul Sassy was definitely my favorite; give this place a try, you won't be disappointed.

The best wings I ever had.. My wife and I had the opportunity to dine @ Crisp while visiting my brother and his fiance. We split 5 wings and the Little Buddha bowl with beef. The Buddha bowl was very good especially when we added some of the complimentary sauces to it; but the wings were out of this world. They are very large and the skin is very crispy with excellent flavor. When we go back we will get 10 wings and split them. The staff was great and BYOB was nice too.

This is one of those places where you read and read posts and there's all this hype about it... Anyway, I had really high expectations for this place and honestly I am not impressed. The food is not bad, but for the price you can get wings elsewhere, cheaper and better tasting. Got to try a couple of different sauces, again, not impressed. The place can get crowded, the communal seating makes it a little awkward to eat there. I need to come back and try a bowl, those looked ok, as for wings, this was not my favorite.  Like I said you can get cheaper better tasting wings elsewhere.

Heard really good things about this place so we decided to drive over and pick up a small order of wings and two chicken sandwiches.  The sandwiches were huge and def. enough to fill you up.  The sauce was pretty good and the bread good quality so that thing didn't fall apart like a lot of sandwiches.  However, I wasn't the biggest fan of their wings.  Although they are huge, I didn't think the meat was very good quality. I would definitely come back and try something else on the menu.

Hands down the best chicken every. The sassy sauce is a must try. The place was packed as we walked in but we got the food pretty quick. The atmosphere inside is very friendly but the most importantly as you take the first bite, the flavors burst in your mouth. This is a must try location and I recommend it. Another reason to try it, the price is very reasonable.

What a great little spot in the middle of Lakeview. I came here with three hungry men and we all left will little doggy bags for a dinner of leftovers. I ordered 5 wings with the Crisp BBQ flavor, while my friends ordered, wings, chicken tenders, a whole chicken (with the regular hot BBQ sauce as well) and fries and fried mushrooms. I must say, the Crisp BBQ is delicious. A little sweet, a little spicy and with an asian zing you expect from Korean food.  At $9 for 5 wings, you're a little shocked at first. But, these are no ordinary wings. The wing in itself is giant. AND each wing is both the drumstick and the flapper, as well as the tip, leaving you with 2-3x the amount of a normal wing order. I also received an extra 6th wing (probably by accident) which was just icing on the cake.  An extra bonus is that the wings reheat really well, so leftovers are just as delicious at home as in store.

I honestly didn't expect much from this place, but was pleasantly surprised! The chicken is crunchy and Korean BBQ sauce was packed with flavor! They have a weekday special that's a decent deal ($21 for a whole chicken, two sides, and two drinks). I thought the service was also quick and friendly.

Good chicken. Huge portions. But kind of basic options. Ordered the Chicken bowl. It's literally just chicken and rice. My friend ordered before me, and so I just asked for the same thing. I didn't realize he asked for brown rice which is an extra charge and had no clue. Also, they only offer cans of soda. And they literally have the worst seating in lakeview. It's giant tables and benches that you share with other guests. Not a big deal but the benches are very heavy to move and the guests often make you feel awkward when you join them.

If Food Network's "The Best Thing I Ever Ate" interviewed me and asked me what I thought was the best thing *I* ever ate, I would tell them--without hesitation and with enthusiasm--, "Seoul Sassy Chicken Wings from Crisp in Chicago, IL!" If you don't believe, you'd have to try it for yourself. No, it's not anything fancy but I do love the idea of Korean comfort food that stands out amongst a city known for its cuisine. That's right! It's not the deep dish pizza nor is it a Chicago dog nor is it something from Thomas Keller, José Andrés, or even my mother's kitchen... it is something so simple yet complex in ingredients that makes the Seoul Sassy Chicken Wings my absolute favorite food [as of the moment]! The crispy exterior, juicy chicken meat, and savory-salty-spicy thin sauce is undeniably finger-licking addictive! The bright orange awning on Broadway St. in the Lakeview East area of Chicago is where you want to be the next time you're in the city. This cozy little restaurant offers a moderate number of Korean comfort foods your 'eomma' ('mom' in Korean) would approve, from their savory rice bowls like the Seoul Beef Bowl (Bulgogi with Rice) to another one of their popular menu items, the Crisp BBQ Chicken Wings. You can choose how spicy you want the Crisp BBQ Chicken WIngs and I say go for the 'suicide' spice level! It's spicy enough you'll have to pause between bites yet delicious enough you'll want to keep stuffing your face with Crisp BBQ Chicken Wings! Crisp in Chicago, IL is just amazing! Go ahead... you'll thank me later! :)

I had no idea what to expect from a Korean bbq and was really impressed. We got the Seoul sassy and crisp bbq chicken wings, as well as the Seoul steak bowl. I'm not a fan of spicy so I didn't really love the bbq wings but Seoul sassy is amazing. Maybe even life changing.

I have heard many great things about this place and could not wait to try it. I went here last week and I was not disappointed. The Korean chicken wings were amazing! My favorite flavor was the Sassy Seoul. Korean mom's recommendation did not disappoint. The Seoul Beef bowl was delicious as well! I would recommend this place to anyone!

In short, the chicken wings rock. Ignore the buddha bowls and pretend they're not on the menu. It can be tough to figure out what makes Korean-style fried chicken wings so awesome. The often double-fried cooking. The light, super crispy skin. The size of the wing itself. Whatever it is, Crisp nailed it. At least, they nailed the texture. It's just as good as anywhere else.  The sauces, however, are a little limited. You really only get two options, the BBQ and Sassy Seoul (because you should never get the plain one). Both are great. But major missed opportunity on other flavors you'd expect from a Korean chicken wing joint. Where's the red-hot spicy version? The harder garlic with a kick? As for the buddha bowl, like I said earlier, pretend it's not on the menu. It tastes like rice salad (in the worst way). The veggies on bibimbap (the dish this is based on) aren't supposed to lack flavor. It's also not supposed to be cold. Ignore the bowl lineup. These aren't the bowls you're looking for. Moving on and forgetting it as part of this review, oh yeah--the chicken wings, that's why you're here. Those rock.

This place has gone downhill last 2 years..  The bowls are still decent but the wings have lost their charm... hard , dry meat with inconsistent sauce coat every time...  Places like dak and Cafe orient 33 are far superior to this place..

This needs to come to San Francisco. I usually make my biannual pilgrimage to Los Angeles for some of the best Korean food in the world, but I was shocked at the quality of K(orean, not -entucky) Fried Chicken I happened upon via Yelp in Chicago. Wow. REAL chicken wings. Not just the McWings type. You got the real wings with all the parts. Had the Seoul Sassy and the BBQ. I like to try all the types, but forget it. GET THE SEOUL SASSY.  Get wings, BYOB, C, D, E, F, whatever. Love that about Chicago.  Just listen to me, get the Seoul Sassy wings and go to work. Get your fingers dirty and ENJOY. Wow, I seriously am still kind of shocked this exists. Cheers!

I came here for the first time with a friend who's a chicken wing enthusiast and we were both away! The chicken here is out of this world! It's perfectly crisp, there's just the right amount of heat (we got the Crisp BBQ) flavor and the portions are huge for what you pay. The onion rings are 10/10 and so were the veggie sides (ban chan) to refresh things up. The atmosphere is lively and it was crowded, so we sat at the different bar seating. The also have a wide selection of drinks and a cool boom box playing great rap. Also make sure to check in on the Yelp app and you'll get a coupon for a whole chicken, 2 appetizers, 2 drinks, all for $21! I will for sure be returning to this awesome place.
Crispiest chicken ever. Loved the flavors. Interior is small. Wish they had some type of radish as a side (like Korean style chicken places).  Metered parking.

Fantastic food and fantastic service!! Even though the order takes a bit for them to prepare (so many customers, so little staff) it's totally worth the wait. It's not a fancy place, but food is amazing. I do a pilgrimage to Crisp every time I visit Chicago.
Yummy food! Friendly staff:) cute cashier! Price is reasonable:) Good Amount/ Serving will be back again!
Seating is very awkward here and place is small but chicken wings are the bomb. So crispy and sauces are amazing. If you love chicken wings I would absolutely try this place.

Just... Yes Yelp has told me that my review is too shot. I really don't need to say anything more than just "yes". If you are wondering if this place is good, the answer is yes. If you are wondering if you should go there, the answer is Yes. If you want to know if this place has the best wings ever, the answer is yes. Do you wonder if it's worth the money? The answer is Yes. Does this place play the best hip hop on a totally boss boom box? Yes.

the place is as great as it can be.I would recommend getting the Korean flavors wings because your at an Aisan fusion place but get the rice too because the wings could get salty. I really don't know how to explane the flavor of the wings because it was so good but the meat is not to dry, not too raw, just right jucy and tender

HUGE full wings.  And as mentioned by some, they throw in an extra here and that's pretty awesome.  Ten wings were good enough to split between my friend and I.  We got half seoul sassy and half crisp BBQ -  wasn't sure which was which and I also had a sore throat so I couldn't enjoy it as much as I hoped - but I did nonetheless. I definitely would order brown rice with it (although we didn't because we had more stops to make in Chicago), because the wings are pretty salty.

One of my colleagues was just talking about this place and I realized I had never reviewed it.  My travel companion and I have eaten good meals together in NYC, Chicago, San Fran, New Orleans, Louisville, Asheville, Cleveland, Columbus, Charleston, Savannah, Williamsburg, remote parts of NC, and many others in between over the past five or so years.  Some of them are fancy schmancy.  Some of them are holes in the wall. This place is neither of those two, but damn!  We loved it.  That Korean Fried Chicken was amaaaaazing.  And the coffee shop a couple blocks away. Even though I go to ORD weekly, I never really go into the city.  Talking about this place with my colleagues, remembering how awesome it was, and reminiscing really makes me want to now though!
Really great. It taste really like real Korean chicken (maybe better!!) Bibimbob is also good but chicken is the best!

The wings are absolutely delicious. Probably the best wings I've had in my life. Ordered the Seoul Sassy wings and wish I ordered more!  Also ordered the buddah bowl, not impressed and wouldn't get it again. But I will be back for those wings!
One of my favorite take out place in lakeview. Their Seoul half bird is always good and one portion of fries is enough for two. We are never tired of crisp!

I heard of this place for the first time through food network, my brother have watched an episode there where the talked about their awesome fried chicken, and boy they were right. So good, every single time, just don't go there on a date cause things can get messy.
Nothing I can say will do this place justice, come here and get crisp addicted if you dare!

Oh yeah! Been wanting to come back to this place for a couple years now. This is where we fell in love..... with Korean Fried Chicken. You can call in your order or you can get it while it's hot in the restaurant. We've tried almost everything on the menu during my stint in Chicago. One item that has been unsurpassable: Seoul Sassy Chicken.  I don't bother with the wings. When you can a get chopped up whole or half chicken, you not only get wings, but drum sticks/breasts/thighs. Taste the rainbow, my friend.  Seoul sassy is the best flavor for sure. It's that salty, caramelized essence that just makes you want to take another bite... and another. But it also hits you with a sweet tang that counterbalances the savory side.  They have other stuff such as bibimbap and burritos... but let's be honest, you can go to other places for that, that are indeed better. Go here for the chicken, man.  Get the Seoul Sassy.

HUGE wing fan and just for the Seoul Sassy wings -- 10 stars if I could! Really good service and the portions are HUGE. If you order 5 wings, they usually give you 6. Tried the Seoul Sassy wings and I was in love -- perfect slightly sweet flavoring with a hint of a peppery kick.  Also ordered the bibimbap with bulgogi and brown rice and yes, definitely enjoyed the meal although I wasn't blown away by the dish. The bulgogi was a little too fatty where the pieces of meat weren't the best but hey for the price, the taste, and the portions -- totally worth it and I got a nice pairing of veggies to go alongside my massive heaps of chicken wings.  Must come!!

Good food, terrible service. I've eaten at Crisp a few times, all with varying degrees of quality. The one consistent is their food is delicious, the wings are jumbo and crispy. However, I would recommend to not get delivery, nor count on carry out. Twice I've called in orders, only to arrive and find that my orders had been lost, good job guys. My most recent time getting delivery consisted of waiting two hours for them to deliver the full order. They forgot items the first go around and after taking about an hour and fifteen minutes, and I had to call back to get the rest delivered. Chris, who seemed to hate his job and life, told me it would be 30 minutes tops. An hour later I still hadn't received even a phone call. I then called back, only to have a nonchalant Chris, say another 10 minutes (tops). Finally, 20 minutes later did we receive a call from Chris again saying that the delivery driver only left it at the front desk, not even caring to actually fulfill the deliver. 2 hours is too long for any type of delivery, and even more so, you're terrible service and uncaring attitude is disappointing. Get it together.

I use to visit Chicago every three weeks or so and Crisp is a consistent regular on my itinerary.  I can never decide what to order because everything is so freaking good! What's worse (or better) is that the portions are so large that ordering a variety of things seems wasteful. The big buddha bowl is your basic bibimbap but filled to the brim with a variety of veggies and toppings. The wings (all three sections of drumstick, flapper, and tip) are perfectly crispy and covered in sweet and tangy sauces! I would fly/run/crawl to Chicago just to get these wings.  It can be hard to find a seat sometimes but don't let it deter you!

Don't eat here - unless you want to become insanely addicted. Crisp is the best restaurant on Broadway!!! I love the mild sauce on their not so common crispy chicken sandwich and the veggie bowls. My baby loves their sticky rice and was stealing it off my plate. If you want to dine in, stop by during the day unless you don't mind sharing a table. They are packed at night.,We used to get take out at least twice a week when we lived in Lakeview. But it is tasty enough to survive the el!
Amazing....amazing wings. Heaven in your mouth. Crisp wings are a must every visit I make to Chicago/Lincoln Park.

Incredible. One of the most amazing food places you'll go to in Chicago. Just so good. The steak bowl was amazing, and the Korean Fried Chicken is out of this world. Highly recommend this place to anyone.

Fan of their buffalo suicide wings. Ordered it on postmates and got it delivered in 30min. Created a postmates account just for crisp, after reading the raving reviews. I liked seoul sassy but not as big a fan as other yelpers. I'm more of a suicide gal now ;) If u wanna try crisp and feel its too far, def try  postmates.com  and you'll find promo code online for first time user which brough my delivery fee from $13.5 to $3.5 plus around $3 service fee. I also tipped the guy $3 although its not necessary. I don't know what's the big deal about the big buddha bowl thingies when its just veggies with rice and hot sauce! Didn't even eat beyond 2 bites. Their fruitfull is very good fresh fruit dessert for 2 bucks :) Got 5 suicide and 5 seoul sassy and one big buddha and 2 fruitfull for $32 without the postmates delivery charges. So, affordable I guess!
DELICIOUS AF. We always get the 10 piece and split up the order with sassy & bbq sauce. Does not disappoint. Tastes just as good when delivered, as it does in house.
For double fried wings, it definitely was not crispy. We got the spicy sauce, but I think they forget spicy. For some better wings head out to Cafe 33 in Albany Park.

I had the seoul sassy boneless wings and they're simply perfect--just saucy enough, amazing flavor, not too messy. They aren't spicy. We walked in around 3:30 PM on a Friday and it wasn't busy at all, though I know it gets much, much busier as the night carries on. We waited about ten minutes for our food, which is fair. The service was alright. I will definitely be back here, probably too many times.

We stopped by at about noon on a Saturday. The place was very busy and not a lot of seating was available. There are just a few larger tables and some counter seating.  Rather than try to score a table we got 5 wings with Sassy sauce to go. We didn't eat them until hours later after reheating in the oven. They were really good, the sauce a bit sweet and sticky. The wings were large and flavorful with the skin brought back to crispy. My husband said the more he ate the more he liked them. We can't wait to get more and also try other sauces and the bi bim bop. You should go, just not when I'm there.

Wow. You will not walk away hungry here. If you want an authentic wing experience (with the mess) go the bone-in route. If you want the great flavor without the mess, go bone-out (my preference). The sauces are diverse and scrumptious. The Korean BBQ was phenomenal but my favorite was the Seoul Sassy. My only wish is that there was more seating, but that's just a sign of how popular they are!
An intense chicken wing experience. I had chicken sauce from ear to ear! The place was packed, and it was 2 pm!

The chicken is awesome. I get that and the onion rings.... Typically. The strips/tenders, all the sauces and the wings are truly superb.  However, I recently started getting the cabbage kimchi. I'm disappointed.... That I wasn't ordering this from the beginning!!! I visited South Korea about 10 years ago for 7 days. Most people who visit a foreign country like South Korea for 7 days turn into an expert on the foreign land they visited with everyone back home. I am not an expert by any means. I never had kimchi prior to my trip to SK but loved it when I was out there. I tried buying a few caned types when I got back and have hit up several Korean bbq joints over the last 10 years and always order extra kimchi at each place. The kimchi at Crisp is what reminds me of the kimchi when I was in Korea.  Even though I have a beard and have been to South Korea I swear I'm not a hipster who is trying to talk up kimchi to be ironic. It's been so long since my trip and I don't know good kimchi from bad but all I can say is that for me, the kimchi at Crisp reminds me of the stuff from the mother land.

Holy chicken!  If you're ever in the area or if you're just craving some good chicken, STOP HERE.  Easily one of the best joints in lakeview.  The building is a little cramped, but it almost forces you to meet the people around you at the picnic-style tables.   Tip:  don't waste your time with the bowls, jump straight to the chicken.  The bowls are good, but the chicken will blow your taste buds away.
So good! Their fried chicken is almost desert food because it is so delicious.

Hannibal Lector would eat this over your face. Sex is 2nd to crisp. When Paul Bunyon rides into town on a wild buffalo, this'll be his first stop. Each chicken died an honorable death to get here.  The samurai's envy them and impatiently await the day their bodies will be served at Crisp. Keep calm and shove a chicken wing into yo mouth mofuckle.

I've been eating these wings for over 20 years and by far the best bang for your buck. Full size wings vs wingettes at other establishments. Fast friendly service. Good vibes that transports you to a different place and time.

So good, I stopped here after a small meal at Nando's Peri Peri down the street. I ordered the top two flavors for chicken wings, which I unfortunately forgot the name of. The BBQ flavor was sweeter than I prefer but still decent. The Korean flavor is so good, it's reminiscent of Vietnamese fish sauce wings. Yum!!! definitely coming back despite the cramped seating.

Ok these wings were huge!!! Stopped by here for dinner tonight to try their famous wings and I was impressed! Upon walking in, you'll notice that the restaurant is not that big and that you will probably need to share a table with someone or sit at the counter. My BF and I ordered 10 of the Seoul wings and the Seoul Bowl to share. After ordering we decided to just sit at a booth by the windows and after sitting down for about 10 minutes, our food arrived. That was really quick! We couldn't believe how big the portions were and we already knew that we were going to have leftovers. The wings were crispy and flavorful, especially when you dipped them with the atomic sauce, which is available on each table. The Seoul Bowl was also good and again I had put some of the atomic sauce in there to give it some heat. Yummm! After killing 8 of the wings and eating half of the Seoul Bowl, we just couldn't eat anymore. The wings here are definitely worth your money since you get both quality and quantity here!

Definitely a must-try when you're visiting the city! Came here on a Saturday afternoon, place was packed! There are only a couple of tables so you may or may not have to wait to get a spot. And when you do, the spot is probably sharing a table with several other people. The experience is a grab-eat-and-go kind of thing anyway. I loved the crispy, huge chicken wings! Sweet and gingery - I was really impressed! It's kind of like Bon Chon with the breaded crispy style (though it's hard to compare anything to Bon Chon) and the bibimbap is pretty good (hard to mess up bibimbap though). They also do delivery - I wish I lived nearby so I can take advantage.  So overall food and value: 4.5 stars!

Holy yum! I need to go back and try other things, but when you find the perfect meal it's hard to stray, ya know?! Seoul Sassy wings with the atomic sauce for dipping = wing perfection! The BBQ had a weird texture to us, gritty-like. The taste was good, though so maybe they were just oversauced. I've done two carry out orders -- one we ordered online and walked right in, paid, and had our food ready to go when they said it would be. The other time I went in and ordered at the counter. It took maybe 10 minutes aaaand I might have ate half a wing in the car before driving away! So, so good. I first had Korean fried chicken in NYC at the popular Turntable Mad for Chicken and it was awesome...but Crisp is better I think, and way closer ;) If they delivered to me (Gold Coast area) I'd be in big trouble. But in the best way possible. Please expand, Crisp! Actually, in their defense, I believe they're on Postmates and probably other similar services because I always see people waiting for orders in bike gear!

The staff was really cool with me, helping me place my order and answering any questions I had. He even admitted the fries were basically like McDonald's, so I give him credit for being honest. The Seoul sassy wings, in particular, were really enjoyable. Ginger, garlic, soy, and green onions complimented the oversized crispy wings very well. I added a little of their atomic sauce to add some much-needed heat to the sweet, and it made them even better! Do not skip that sauce! The BBQ was fine too, but I'd go with the Seoul next time.  I also had the baby Buddha bowl and I was surprised how much I enjoyed it. I'm not a big fan of sunny side eggs, but mixed in with the rice and veggie mix, it was great. I did add a decent amount of soy and atomic sauce to give it some extra flavor. Along with a bottle of tea, for $20, the meal was a pretty solid value. I think the one thing I'd like to see is some fresh brewed iced tea. Especially with Asian food, some flavored teas would work really well.  It's a little inconvenient for me to get to since I live in the west burbs. But if I happened to be in the neighborhood, I would go back for some more wings and a Buddha bowl.

My coworker would not stop raving about this place so I decided to give it a try last Friday. I wish I could give it more than 5 stars because it was FANTASTIC. My fiancé and I ordered 10 jumbo wings (Seoul Sassy and Suicide Buffalo) along with a Baby Buddha bowl to share. It was more than enough food for two people and freakin delicious! Being Bengali I thought the "Suicide" Buffalo wings would be nothing compared to your average south Asian food but I am WARNING YOU - IT WAS VERY SPICY (but awesome nonetheless). I can't wait to go back and try other things on the menu! I definitely recommend this to anyone looking to try something different.
Crisp can do no wrong. Don't forget about the bowls if you aren't in the mood for the artery clogging and absolutely perfect fried chicken.

GO HERE!!! The wings are amazing! Some times I get the boneless and they're great too! You must get the seoul sassy sauce!! The foodie's choice sandwich is to die for. It has fried chicken which I get the seoul sassy sauce put on, blue cheese, lettuce, bacon, and tomato. Honestly just go check it out it's just soo good!

When it comes to wings I am a Harold's/ Uncle Remis/ J&J Fish type of girl. One day while reading an online article, Crisp was ranked as one of Chicago's best place for wings along with my favorites. I immediately added it my bucket list of places to try.  While house sitting in Lakeview this week, I decided to try Crisp along with a close friend for the first time. We placed a to-go order of 10 wings (5 Korean BBQ and 5 Seoul Sassy) and 1 fry. I was a little nervous when we only ordered 10 wings and 1 fry for two because my friend can EAT. Sometimes I really believe this man has a bottomless pit for a stomach.  When we got back to the house and unpacked the food, all of my worries disappeared. The wings were very large and the fries were more than enough for two to share. We even had two wings left over when we finished eating! We both agreed the Seoul Sassy surpassed the Korean BBQ in taste. Yet the Korean BBQ had a kick of it's own. It was a bit spicy and completely different from my usual "mild sauce". Overall- Crisp gets a GO from me! Definitely not somewhere that i'll break my neck to get to, but I'll def stop by while in the area and hungry.

Went to crisp the other week to try their famous chicken. Like usual there is a long line. I ordered a whole chicken and 10 wings. The chicken came out extremely dry and was not crispy. The wings came out and it seems like it was boiled not fried. The wings were falling apart as I picked them up. They did not have the texture of fried wings and was not one bit crispy. Also when I saw a whole platter of wings that have been fried and was just sitting there in a aluminum pan which I though was odd. I will not be coming back and will not recommend this place. Maybe it was busy and they wanted the money and did not care about quality.

The wings are great. Half chicken Seoul Sassy and Spicy BBQ is the play. The buffalo is just okay. The bowls are pretty good and a nice change of pace if you've gotten the wings a bunch of times  The staff is friendly and it seems like they enjoy working there I wish they were open later

The crunch has definitely gone out of CRISP... Not as good the second time around...I thought Crisp was much better the first time I went here, about a year and a half ago.  I thought, or, was it just my imagination playing tricks on me the wings were a little bigger?   This time around I thought they were smaller, tasted okay though, crispy and somewhat juicy inside, ordered the Seoul sassy sauce.  However it took much longer to get my order, had to inquire after I waited over a half an hour. The guy apologized, but when it was ready he didn't even hand me my order, had to maneuver my way through the crowd to get it.  Sorry I bothered you dude!  Annoying to say the least, glad I didn't put anything in the tip jar! Also, place doesn't seem authentic to me, not Asian-run. Couldn't help but notice the dinginess of the place too, that was the only thing that hasn't changed.  The ceiling even seemed too low, giving the place a claustrophobic feel to it.  All in all, was a lot busier though this time around, wall-to-wall people.  Had the choice of either sitting at a table, or one of the stools.  Luckily grabbed an empty stool.  Uncomfortable to say the least. About a week ago, I went to Crisps' newest competitor DAK on Granville and did a comparison.  Dak's wings were a lot bigger and also juicier and chewier.  Plus, Dak's space is newer, updated and better designed. No sloping ceiling.  Still kind of small though, but it felt more spacious than Crisp, a nice plus was it only had tables, no kiddie stools.  As far as efficiency goes, cashier/server brought out my meal in a timely manner and was very nice, no attitude.  Went here for lunch, restaurant filled-up very quickly, up to capacity.  This place definitely has an authentic Asian feel to it.  Gotta  go back! The winner hands-down for me at least is DAK!!!
This place has really found a niche. We have enjoyed this spot since its inception. They are affiliated with Budacki's on Damen (South of Lawrence). I highly recommend. You will not be disappointed.

I ordered the KBBQ chicken wings and rice and was definitely not disappointed! Great flavor and huge portions. The restaurant itself was a bit small, so we opted for takeout, which is a great option as well.

Korean fried chicken in Chicago = Crisp! Definitely the Korean fried chicken place in Chicago. The key is the crispness of the chicken and the sweet and tangy / spicy and sweet  balance with fries or have it with the variety of bowls. I thought having the display of bowls were a great touch to show the variety of bowls. Service was beyond excellent and the speediness was very impressive. The wings were humongous and two of us got the 10pcs but we only finished half. The wings were actually whole wings! Like the drum and the flap which means 10 wings here are 20 elsewhere. Loved it!

We got the 'whole chicken' deal and it came with 2 pop, 2 sides, and a whole chicken. You can choose 2 sauces for the chicken and we got Seoul Sassy and Korean BBQ! The fried mushrooms were tasty, but could use a little more seasoning. The fries were mehhhh....but the chicken.....OH MY LAWRD. They are ah-mah-zing!!!! I mean you gotta try it to believe it. There's a reason why this place has 1700+ reviews. More points for BYOB with no extra fees!! Definitely will be returning!

My wife told me that she wouldn't have Korean fried chicken unless I took her to Ktown in NYC to Turntable.  Well on this trip to Chicago I wasn't going to pass up the opportunity to put up what is arguably one of the great KFC locales in NYC up to the challenge of one of the many award winning Korean places in Chicago. Crisp has won awards, sure.  Their titles of acclaim are on the front window and can be seen before you even enter the restaurant.  This place had collected a handful of accolades yes but how will you know how it is unless you try it for yourself?   Well I have to say that I dragged my wife here for one thing and it was Korean fried chicken.  We were staying in the Mag Mile area but I wasn't going to let a little distance get between us and having a try at a highly rated KFC place.  She as much as I have become in love with the KFC we were served in NYC.   We took the CTA Red line up to Fullerton and changed to the Brown line to be able to get off at Wellington.  From Wellington it's just a few blocks east to Broadway. The place only really has 3 bench type tables that fit maybe 6 people each.  Other seating is stool type at the front window and along the side wall where we ended up sitting because it was sort of busy in there. The prices you may think for wings is expensive as 5 wings are 9 bucks and 10 wings are 17.  It is NOT expensive and I will explain in detail why it's reasonable.   I had ordered 20 wings for just myself and my wife.  The guy there was telling me that if it's just us two to trust him and only order 10 wings and order more afterwards if we wanted more.  I'm a big guy and I can eat a lot.  This guy telling me to trust him and only order 10 wings for the two of us.  I had to go with his recommendation.   He went on to explain that these wings are NOT split in that the drum and flat are not separated and are fried attached.  So by definition these are WHOLE wings essentially what can be defined by others as 2 "wing pieces" in one big piece.  That explains that their 10 is other people's 20.  THEN you get to the fact that these wings are in fact JUMBO.  Honestly I have to wonder what kind of chickens these are to be able to grow as big as their pieces of chicken are.  These pieces of chicken were in fact not short of JUMBO as they explained on their menu as "WHOLE JUMBO WINGS"... indeed they are that.   Think about it for a second.  I'm used to "flats" being around 2.5 to 3 inches long not 4 to 5 inches long.  Some of these wings are double sized.  Again, think about it... double the length is double the meat right?  WRONG.  Double the length is also double the WIDTH.  So what would a normal 2.5 inch flat part of the wing is now doubled in length, the width is also doubled so really Crisp's definition of "WING" is what can be as much meat mass as 8, yes as much as EIGHT wings to their ONE.  For the math inclined I'll break it down like this: Normal flat portion of wing I'm used to is for the sake of argument 2 chicken units.  These Crisp wings are roughly double the length AND width.  If you double the length add another 2 units.  The fact that they are about twice as wide, add another 4 units (2 for the extra width and another to to match up the extra length...) are you still with me?   To make your mind explode don't forget that their "WING" is not split so it's both the drum AND flat combined so if you take the above explanation and multiply it by two (flat and drum combined) that's freaking 16 units of chicken to a measly 2 units for a normal (wing or drum) sized wing hence the 8 to 1 ratio... My head is hurting to try to quantify how much you are getting to justify basically 1.70 dollars per wing.  If you can understand my math it's not expensive for the amount you get.  As these are both unsplit and jumbo at the same time.   Now forget the justification of bang for the buck and money to mass for a second if you will.  The flavors are over the top great.  We went with Plain Jane (x5) and Garlic Soy for the other 5 wings.  Normally I can't stand it when places go overboard with the sauce which is NOT uncommon unfortunately but I have to give it up to Crisp for keeping it CRISP and not drowning their wonderful chicken in sauce making the crispy crunch of their chicken wings go bye bye.  The sauce was just right, not too much, not too little but enough to make it look sort of try but enough to give flavor.  Kudos to that!  So many places I've gone for KFC think more sauce is better when it's not the solution. Crisp's chicken wings are not dry inside and are crispy and tasty.  The fact that the wings are not split are a huge plus.  I like the amount of flavor you can get by keeping them together.   Look at my photo in my review.  I took 2, yes only 2 wings and both of them covered my plate.  That is how big they are which is almost scary if you think about how chickens are not supposed to grow that large. With great food and value come great responsibility.

Great wings-- I love the sassy seoul and Crisp BBQ sauces. The fried mushrooms and Amy's Atomic Sauce are to die for. I had a bowl once and it was just mediocre. I love the canned soda options (haha) and the casual setting. However, it is kinda pricey for the style of food.
The baby Buddha w/ bulgogi added is awesome. Love the sauces too. Very friendly staff

I have heard quite a lot about this place and finally had a chance to go there! This place is a very unpretentious little spot located in a nice neighborhood. As soon as you walk in, you do get the vibe that their food is going to be spectacular and boy it is! You order at a little counter in the back and wait for your order. Menu is super cheap, we ordered the full chicken which we divided in two flavors, two sides, and 2 drinks for 21 buck (amazing deal)!!!! We got the sassy seoul (based on all the reviews) and BBQ flavor.  We sat ourselves in the shared table and food arrived rather fast. The chicken looked AMAZING!! Very nicely presented and looked like we were going to have an amazing time devouring that! The chicken did turn out great! It was the perfect amount of crispy and juicy!! Flavor wise, I did like the seoul sassy but i love spicy flavors and BBQ stood out more to us! Their sauces on the side of the table are really nice, different. You can get the BBQ more spicy if you'd like, but since we were sharing, we got the regular flavor which itself was extremely flavorful and right amount of spicy. Seoul sassy was a great flavor for people who don't appreciate spice, nonetheless, we liked that flavor as well. We had onion rings and fries on the side but we barely touched those and killed the whole chicken within 20 minutes! DELICIOUS DELICIOUS DELICIOUS! Cannot wait to return with more friends! This place is a must go!!

If I could say something about Crisp, it would be that their food/service is really consistent. My friends and I arrived around 4. We definitely wanted to beat the rush and for the first time there were actually seats for us to sit down.  I ordered the Seoul Sassy Wings which came with six instead of five!! I don't know if they just did it because it wasn't busy or perhaps the wings were smaller? Not sure, but I'm not complaining! The wings were crispy and hot - especially with their special spicy white sauce on the side. Mmm, it makes me wish I had more. The big buddha was meh. The rice was mushy which was a bummer. However, the flavor still holds strong. If you were to order this, I would recommend to split with someone but having leftovers ain't too shabby either!

As others will attest, this is a place that can not be missed.  Sure you can expect a line, but what you do get with the line, is food that is worth waiting for.  There were four of us in our party, think we all tried something different.  Everything was good but the memory I will always keep of Crisp is having to fight off my wife and friends to keep them away from my wings.  Seoul Sassy all the way, not too hot, just right, even my wimpy wife wanted more. Not the easiest place to get to without a car, since I am from out of state, and stayed downtown, but so very worth the rides.

This place was great, after seeing all of the reviews i couldn't wait to try it and it definitely worth it.  We had the original bad boy, seoul bowl, and sassy wings. The wings were the best I've had! Moist and tender on the inside and crispy, flavourful on the outside. I am already thinking of the next trip out here to try their other flavor wings.

Came here for lunch on a Wednesday 30 mins after they opened and this place was already packed! Perhaps it was because the dinning area is super small--only three large benches and additional seats across the walls so I suggest go early to get the benches if you're dinning with a large group of people.  I ordered the 5 whole wings for about over $8 which at first impression might seem pricey, but they definitely give you more than 5 and these wings were not your average size (awesome~~)!! The Seoul sassy was definitely the recommendation all over yelp so I got that, and sure enough it was bomb!!!! I dipped my wings into the Buddha sauce which made it 10x more better, it was like I had died and went to heaven. The French fries were also in a huge portion and tasted really fresh as well.  My boyfriend ordered the steak (bulgogi) rice bowl with an extra egg on top and a side of kimchi. The portions of both of these were HUGGEEEEEE for 3.50 you get a tube of kimchi, I've never seem a place that offers that. He couldn't even finish his rice bowl because there was so much (a good thing).   Overall, if you're around this area definitely check Crisp out because they have fantastic food that won't let you leave feeling anything but full! Flavor is there, portion is there, and quality is there. Only wish the place was bigger but what can you say Chicago is a tightly packed place!

Crisp. They can do no wrong. Wings are meant to be cooked crispy and they do the best job on them! Sauces are drinkable! Keep up the great work Crisp! Oh...and open a bigger place and more of them! They could easily become a chain!  xox

Stopped by here at 3:00PM on a Sunday, and it was packed!  I ordered 5 Sassy Seoul whole wings and a Bad Boy Bhudda Bowl for two people. The bowl was was delicious with warm rice, running egg yolk, and veggies. The superior dish was the chicken. The chicken wings were well seasoned and crispy.  I really want to give Crisp 5 stars, but I've had better fried chicken.

Not your typical Korean BBQ joint, but they've found a way to improve the already delicious bibimbap dish (what they call the Buddha Bowl) and Korean style wings. Absolutely love coming here; even better incentive is that it's BYOB. The venue is small, so seating can be tight, but you get to make some new friends along the way. Street parking may also be difficult during peak times, so I'd recommmend taking public transportation in, or if you must drive, park on Halsted and walk a few blocks. My favorites are the Seoul Sassy wings and the Buddha Bowl, reminds of the classic Korean dish but with a twist of different veggies. The wings are massive, so you won't be disappointed. Can't wait to head back -  Best, Charlie

I honestly don't get the excitement over this place. The wing sauce was good but the wings didn't have much meat on them. We got the sassy and BBQ sauce. We also split a Big Buddha bowl - which was good but nothing special. For 32$ I would look elsewhere next time for dinner. The seating is also limited and you sit on benches probably by people you don't know - awkward if they're busy.

I wanted to love it, but it just didn't work out between us. I went with the Seoul sassy sauce. It was only OK. A little too sweet in my opinion. I needed something spicy to balance it out. The atomic sauce was good but needed a little more spice. I went boneless and I couldn't help thinking these wings tasted like wing stop wings. The boneless were a good size. I went 3 star because I think some of the other sauces may make for a better taste experience.

I ordered the chicken bowl and, boy, what a mistake that was. The food was lukewarm, the rice was old and hard, and the chicken lacked flavor. From all the reviews raving about this place, I was expecting more than tasteless and stale imitation of bibimbap. Here's my advice to any out of towners who want to try this place: Find yourself a real Korean restaurant and order yourself a real bibimbap, not this poorly executed imitation.

Great Korean fried wings, steak bowls, chicken bowls and raw vegetable option. If you are getting the wings considering sharing they are decent in size. The sauce options are really great and add a great compliment.

Love love love this place! Excellent friend chicken. A whole bird with two sides and two drinks is only $21.99. I love the BBQ and the sassy sauces, the latter being a ginger soy glaze. You can also spice it up with the Buddha or illusions sauces at the tables. Go early cause once dinner cubes this place gets crowded, for good reason.
Awesome everytime.  I love this place, best chicken, burriots and kimchi.   a must, your chicken eating life isn't fullfilled until you try this place.  Sassy Seoul and BBQ.  All day long.

I love everything about Crisp. Close to my house. Casual. Cheap (for Chicago). Fast. Friendly. Sassy sauce is all you need. The Buddha (bulgogi) bowls are large and you can swap out the vegetables you want. A friend and I can split 5 wings with a Baby Buddha and leave fully satisfied. I've never had a problem with seating, but sometimes you'll have to get close to your neighbor. If only they'd stay open later....

The best Korean BBQ chicken I have ever had and dare I say...best fried chicken. Sometimes I will Postmates an order when I have a craving. The rice bowls are okay but not worth the extra effort to get. No doubt, order either the rotisserie chicken or jumbo wings. Some of the spicer sauces could be too hot for those that cannot tolerate the heat. But that's okay, all their specialty sauces are packed with tons of flavor that will keep you coming back.
Literally top 5 most delicious meals of my life!! The bulgogi is out of this world, as is the fried chicken. I definitely would recommend going in to eat versus delivery. Fresh is the best.

It's really hard to find this hidden gem if you're not looking for it but if you do, you're gonna LOVE it! My favorite is the Boneless Wings with the Seoul Sassy sauce, it is UNBELIEVABLE!  I also like to get the ChiTown Chicken Bowl with the Seoul Sassy sauce, can't get enough of it.   Really great feel once your inside, seating is a little tough because it gets pretty busy.   Make sure to check this place out TODAY!

Fried chicken done WAY right! Got 10 wings, half Seoul sassy and half barbecue. Don't be fooled by 10 wings, it's plenty to feed 2 people and you both will be full. I wish I had more belly room to try their bibimbap. They also sell an impressive range of Korean/Asian specialty drinks, we got a milk-flavored soda, grape soda, and something that tasted like the Korean version of Orangina.  Definitely a young, hip, super casual spot to grab a bite and catch up with a buddy.

Meh.  Good chicken, average rice bowls, weird tables.  I got a baby buddha bowl which is a smaller sized bibimbop that came with a lot of veggies and added a side of 3 boneless fried chicken tenders in the Crisp sauce (sweet & spicy).  It came out to $14?!  I'm no Korean fried chicken connoisseur, but I've had it before, and theirs wasn't so amazing that I'd come back again.  FYI, my friend got the plain wings, and they were giant - almost like baby turkey wings or just overfed with hormones?  Tables are communal seating with a few individual high stools along the window and one of the interior walls.  The picnic tables are clunky, take up a lot of room, and are situated really close together, so you have to be limber to climb in/out without falling on top of someone.

I could write a page on this place but what's the point? Everyone knows why this place is the bomb dot com. If you're a first timer then do yourself a favor and get the Seoul Sassy wings. Some of the best wings you'll ever have. I'm not talking just about the sauce either. I'm talking about the chicken itself and how they prepare it. It hits the spot every time.
Tasty wings! It gets a bit busy/hectic in there so I recommend taking away or ordering in.

Whenever I'm in the Lakeview area I make a point to grab a meal at Crisp. The flavor is incredible and the straight forward simplicity of the operation is great. Whether I eat in or take the food home it's always solid. I personally like the Seoul sassy fried chicken (I'm fairly certain I'm not alone in that). Their bulgogi burrito is also excellent. The only complaint I have is that occasionally some of the chicken can be a tad dry in the center, but the flavored parts are still great. I always tell anyone visiting Chicago that Crisp is a must add to their trip.
The wings are phenomenal and the steak bowl was insanely good. This is one you just have to hit.

I can't believe I'm saying this, but this place may actually beat out the Korean fried chicken joints in LA!? My good friend from grad school and I came here after we found it listed in Lonelyplanet. Now that we're both locals, we wanted to see what all the fuss was about with this Korean chicken place. When I first walked in, I didn't see a single Asian worker behind the counter or kitchen, and I immediately got skeptical. Thank goodness the lines and smell kept me patiently waiting for my order, because these chicken wings were AH-MAZING! I ordered the 5 Crisp BBQ Jumbo Wings for $9. At first I thought it was a bit pricy for just five wings, until they came out, and I was like... eff. These wings were HUGE. They were not kidding about the size of these babies. The Crisp BBQ style was smoky, sweet, and delicious. Chicken was tender and had great flavor! Seriously, some of the best I've had. A few rules to keep in mind: - Always order BONE-IN. It's just not as good when it's boneless. - Drown your food in the Atomic sauce. It's not spicy, it's just freaking "out of this world" GOOD. Crisp is absolutely worth the wait and money spent.

When my girlfriend and I purchased 10 wings and fries to split we were hoping to just get a taste of what Crisp has to offer, little did we know we would leave stuffed full of amazing flavor.  The wings were simply amazing, fried crispy yet wasn't dry, I literally ate off every part of the chicken wing.
